translated: Seeing a suffering and poor man, I gave up my own beloved body,

original: prāpya dhanaṃ sa kṛtaśca mayāḍhyaḥ sarvadadena nṛpeṇa satā me // //
analyzed: prāpya dhanam sa kṛtaḥ ca mayā āḍhyaḥ sarvadadena nṛpeṇa satā me  /
translated: And having obtained wealth, I made him rich, as I was a righteous king giving everything.

original: śaraṇāgata vīkṣya kapotaṃ svaṃ piśitaṃ vinikṛtya śarīrāt /
analyzed: śaraṇa āgata vīkṣya kapotam svam piśitam vinikṛtya śarīrāt
translated: Seeing a dove that had come to me for protection, I cut flesh from my own body,

original: dattamapi svatanurna bhayārtastyakta ihāpi nṛpeṇa satā me // //
analyzed: dattam api sva tanuḥ na bhaya ārtaḥ tyaktaḥ iha api nṛpeṇa satā me
translated: Even when I gave away my own body, afflicted with fear, the king did not abandon me here.

original: kṛtsnamupārjitamāpya bhiṣagbhirbhaiṣajamapratimaṃ mama pūrvam /
analyzed: kṛtsnam upārjitam āpya bhiṣagbhiḥ bhaiṣajam apratimam mama pūrvam
translated: Having completely collected the incomparable medicine for me from the physicians in the past,

original: jīvita tyajya parasya dadau taṃ kesarirāja babhūva yadāham // //
analyzed: tyajya parasya dadau tam kesari rāja babhūva yadā aham
translated: I gave my life to another when I was King Keśarin.

original: Vaidya / RP 🔽caratā ca purā jagadarthe madri pativrata tyakta saputrā /
analyzed: vaidya rp  caratā ca purā jagat arthe madri pativrata sa putrā
translated: As a doctor,🔽In the past, while wandering for the sake of the world, I abandoned my wife and children, the wife of King Madra,

original: duhitāpyanapekṣyadasaṃgha āsi nṛpātmajo yada sudaṃṣṭraḥ // //
analyzed: duhitā api an apekṣyat a saṃghaḥ āsi nṛpa ātmajaḥ sudaṃṣṭraḥ
translated: And also my daughter without regard, when I was Prince Sudanṣṭra.

original: varṣasahasra mayā paripūrṇā marṣita duṣkarāścaturaśīti /
analyzed: varṣa sahasra mayā paripūrṇāḥ marṣita duṣkarāḥ caturaśīti
translated: For a thousand years, I endured the eighty-four thousand hardships,

original: uttaptavīryu yada āsīt arthadhanaśriyo 'pi ca purā me // //🔽jinadhātustūpapurato me jvalita āśrayaḥ paramabhaktyā /
analyzed: uttapta vīryu yadā āsīt ca purā me  / jina dhātu stūpa puratas me jvalitaḥ āśrayaḥ parama bhaktyā
translated: When I was Utptavirya, and in the past, I also had wealth and prosperity.🔽In front of the stūpa of the Jina's relics, I burned my body with supreme devotion,

original: pūjā kṛtā daśabalānām āsi nṛpātmaji vimalatejāḥ // //🔽raudrākṣa eva ca ruṣitvā yācitavān sa cāpi mama śīrṣam /
analyzed: pūjā kṛtā daśa balānām āsi nṛpa ātmaji vimala tejāḥ    raudrākṣaḥ eva ca ruṣitvā yācitavān sa ca api mama śīrṣam
translated: And made offerings to the powerful ones. I was Prince Vimalatejas.

original: dattaṃ nikṛtya ca mayā tad rāja yadā ca candraprabha āsīt // //
analyzed: dattam nikṛtya ca mayā tat rāja yadā ca candraprabhaḥ āsīt
translated: And Raudreśa, having become angry, asked for my head, and I cut it off and gave it to him, when I was King Candra.

original: sarvatra grāmanagareṣu vīthimukheṣu bhaiṣajamudāram /
analyzed: sarvatra grāma nagareṣu vīthi mukheṣu bhaiṣajam udāram
translated: In every village and town, at the entrances to the streets, I placed abundant medicine,

original: sattvārtha sthāpit mayā te puṇyasamo babhūva ca yadāham // //
analyzed: sattva artha mayā te puṇya samaḥ babhūva ca yadā aham
translated: For the sake of beings, and I became equal to them in merit.

original: srīṇām sahasramabhirūpāḥ kāñcanamuktibhūṣitaśarīrāḥ /
analyzed: srīṇām sahasram abhirūpāḥ kāñcana mukti bhūṣita śarīrāḥ
translated: I gave away a thousand beautiful women, their bodies adorned with golden ornaments,

original: tyaktāṃ pūrvabhaveṣu caratā me āsi yadā śubho nṛpati pūrve // //
analyzed: tyaktām pūrva bhaveṣu caratā me āsi yadā śubhaḥ nṛpati pūrve
translated: When I was the king named Śubha in a past life, while practicing the conduct.

original: puṣpairvarairapi ca gandhaiḥ kāñcanamuktikāpravara śrīmān /
analyzed: puṣpaiḥ varaiḥ api ca gandhaiḥ kāñcana muktikā pravara śrīmān
translated: With excellent flowers and fragrances, I gave away my own glorious golden ornaments,

original: tyaktaśca me makuṭa pūrva āsi nṛpo yadā ratanacūḍaḥ // //
analyzed: tyaktaḥ ca me makuṭa pūrvaḥ āsi nṛpaḥ yadā ratana cūḍaḥ
translated: When I was the king named Ratana-cūḍa, I gave away my crown.

original: mṛdutūlapicūpamasūkṣmau komalapadmapatrasukumārau /
analyzed: mṛdu tūla picu upama sūkṣmau komala padma patra sukumārau
translated: My soft and tender hands and feet, delicate like the finest cotton or lotus petals,

original: tyaktau karau sacaraṇau me pūrva nṛpeṇa dhṛtimatā ca // //
analyzed: tyaktau karau sa caraṇau me nṛpeṇa dhṛtimatā ca
translated: I gave away in the past as a king named Dhṛtimān.

original: vinigṛhya rākṣasiśatāni nirghṛṇadāruṇaprabalacaṇḍā /
analyzed: vinigṛhya rākṣasi śatāni nirghṛṇa dāruṇa prabala caṇḍā
translated: Having restrained hundreds of cruel, merciless, powerful, and fierce rākṣasīs,

original: kṛta mānuṣā badaradvīpe siṃhala sārthavāha yada āsīt // //🔽kāmeṣu mṛrcchitamanā me bāli sa rākṣasī pramadasaṃjñā /
analyzed: kṛta mānuṣā badaradvīpe siṃhala sārthavāha yada āsīt  / kāmeṣu mṛrcchita manāḥ me bāli sa rākṣasī pramada saṃjñā
translated: I made the island of Laṅkā a human dwelling place, when I was the merchant leader Siṃhala.🔽When I was Sunetra, I rescued five hundred merchants

original: pañcaśatāni vaṇijānāṃ mokṣita te yadā bhave sunetraḥ // //
analyzed: pañca śatāni vaṇijānām mokṣita te yadā bhave su netraḥ
translated: who were infatuated with sensual pleasures, and a rākṣasī disguised as a beautiful woman,🔽and a young boy.

original: catvāri koṭi pramadānām apsaratulyarūpiṇāṃ vihāya /
analyzed: catvāri pramadānām apsara tulya rūpiṇām vihāya
translated: Abandoning four koṭis of women equal in beauty to celestial nymphs,

original: pravrajya nirgatu jinasya śāsane puṇyaraśmi yada āsīt // //
analyzed: pravrajya nirgatu jinasya śāsane puṇya raśmi yadaḥ āsīt
translated: When Puṇyaraśmi went forth from the world into the teachings of the Victorious One,

original: mayi tyaktamaṅguli udārā sattvahitārthameva caratā me /🔽jālārcitā vimalaśuddhā kāñcanavarṇa pārthiva yada āsīt // //🔽śubha nīlapadmasamavarṇā netra manoramā hṛdayakāntā /
analyzed: mayi tyaktam aṅguli udārā sattva hita artham eva caratā me  jāla arcitā vimala śuddhā kāñcana varṇa pārthiva yadā āsīt  / nīla padma sama varṇā hṛdaya kāntā
translated: I gave away my excellent fingers, always acting for the benefit of beings.🔽O King, when I was Jālin, my pure and stainless body was the color of gold.

original: tyaktā mayā ca jagadarthe utpalanetre pārthiva yadāsīt // //
analyzed: tyaktā mayā ca jagat arthe utpala netre pārthiva yadā āsīt
translated: O King, when I was Utpalanetra, I gave away my eyes, which were beautiful like blue lotuses, pleasing to the mind and dear to the heart, for the sake of the world.

original: priyaviprayogahata dṛṣṭvā strī ca pranaṣṭarūpamativeṣā /
analyzed: priya viprayoga hata dṛṣṭvā strī ca pranaṣṭa rūpa mati veṣā
translated: Seeing a woman afflicted by separation from her beloved, her beauty, mind, and attire lost,

original: parimocitā karuṇayā me keśava vaidyarāja yada āsīt // //
analyzed: parimocitā karuṇayā me keśava vaidya rāja yadaḥ āsīt
translated: I liberated her with compassion. O Keśava, when I was the king of physicians,

original: vyādhyāturaṃ ca naramīkṣya svaṃ rudhiraṃ pradattamapi me 'bhūt /
analyzed: vyādhi āturam ca naram īkṣya svam rudhiram pradattam api me bhūt
translated: Seeing a sick person afflicted by disease, I even gave my own blood.

original: nirvyādhitaḥ sa ca kṛto me prāgbhava sarvadarśi yadabhūvam // //🔽Vaidya / RP
analyzed: nirvyādhitaḥ sa ca kṛtaḥ me prāk bhava sarva darśi yat abhūvam  vaidya rp
translated: Having cured him of his disease, I became a universal monarch in a past life.🔽O King, when I was the physician Jīvakabhṛtya,

original: hitvā svamasthi ca śarīrād vyādhikṛśasya majja mayā dattam /
analyzed: hitvā svam asthi ca śarīrāt vyādhi kṛśasya majja mayā dattam
translated: Having given away my own bones and marrow from my body to one emaciated by disease,

original: na ca sattva tyakta maya jātu āsi nṛpo yadā kusuma nāma // //
analyzed: na ca sattva tyakta maya jātu āsi nṛpaḥ yadā kusuma nāma
translated: And I never abandoned any being, when I was King Kusuma.

original: sarvasvakośamapi tyaktva jīvita tyakta me priya manāpam /
analyzed: sarva sva kośam api tyaktva jīvita tyakta me priya manāpam
translated: I gave up my entire wealth, my life, and my beloved and pleasing things,

original: naru mokṣito vyasanaprāpta āsi nṛpo 'rthasiddhi yada pūrvam // //
analyzed: mokṣitaḥ vyasana prāptaḥ āsi nṛpaḥ pūrvam
translated: When I was King Arthasiddhi in the past, I rescued a man who had fallen into misfortune.

original: cakrāṅkitaṃ kamalatulyaṃ paṇiyugaṃ pradamattamanapekṣam /
analyzed: cakra aṅkitam kamala tulyam paṇi yugam pradamattam anapekṣam
translated: I gave away a pair of hands marked with wheels, equal to lotuses, without regard for them,

original: nṛpa āśuketu yada āsīd bodhimabhīpsamāna jagadarthe // //
analyzed: nṛpaḥ āśuketu yadaḥ āsīt bodhim abhīpsamāna jagat arthe
translated: When I was King Ashuketu, seeking enlightenment for the sake of the world.

original: nṛpa sarvadarśi yada āsīt kāruṇiko janārthahitakāmaḥ /
analyzed: nṛpa sarvadarśi yadaḥ āsīt kāruṇikaḥ jana artha hita kāmaḥ
translated: When I was King Sarvadarshi, compassionate, desiring the benefit and welfare of people,

original: tyaktā mayā caturo 'pi ca dvīpāḥ sphītanarairvranarīśataiśca // //🔽mṛdu komalaṃ vikalagauraṃ ūru tacchittva hṝṣṭamuditāyā /🔽dattaṃ svamāṃsa rudhiraṃ me jñānavatī yadāsi nṛpaputrī // //🔽kanakābhapīnasukumāraṃ tyakta stanadvayaṃ hṝdayakāntam /
analyzed: tyaktāḥ mayā caturaḥ ca dvīpāḥ sphīta naraiḥ vranarī śataiḥ ca  mṛdu komalam vikala gauram  dattam sva māṃsa rudhiram me jñānavatī yadā asi nṛpa putrī  kanaka ābha pīna sukumāram stana dvayam hṝdaya kāntam
translated: I gave away all four continents, prosperous with men and women.🔽When I was Princess Jnanavati, I joyfully and happily cut off my soft, tender, and delicate thighs🔽and gave away my own flesh and blood.🔽When I was Princess Rupya-vati, I saw a woman who was afflicted by hunger and thirst

original: strī prekṣya me kṣudhatṛṣārtaṃ sā rūpya pa /🔽vatīti vanitā yadābhūt // //
analyzed: strī prekṣya me kṣudha tṛṣā ārtam sā 🔽vatī iti vanitā yadā abhūt
translated: and gave away my own breasts, golden-colored, plump, and tender, dear to my heart.

original: varabhūṣaṇānapi suramyān ratnamanekavastrarathayānān /
analyzed: vara bhūṣaṇān api su ramyān ratnam aneka vastra ratha yānān
translated: And the most beautiful ornaments, many jeweled garments, chariots, and vehicles,

original: saṃtyakta dustyajamanekaṃ viśrutaśrīnṛpeṇa ca mayābhūt // //
analyzed: saṃtyakta dustyajam anekam viśruta śrī nṛpeṇa ca mayā abhūt
translated: I, King Śrībhu, gave up many things difficult to let go of.

original: rājñaḥ suto tu vikṛtajñaḥ tārita sāgarādyada kṛtajñaḥ /
analyzed: rājñaḥ suto tu vikṛtajñaḥ kṛtajñaḥ
translated: The king's son was grateful, and when I was saved from the ocean, he was grateful.

original: ratnārtha netra mama tena uddhṛta naiva me ruṣita cittam // //
analyzed: ratna artha netra mama tena uddhṛta na eva me ruṣita cittam  /
translated: For the sake of jewels, he gouged out my eyes, but my mind was not angry.

original: mā bhūtpipīlikavadho me tyakta varāśrayo 'pi canapekṣya /
analyzed: mā bhūt pipīlika vadhaḥ me tyakta
translated: May there be no killing of ants for me, even if I abandon the best support without regard.

original: na ca citta kampita tadā me tyakta pūrvabhaveṣu godha yada āsīt // //
analyzed: na ca citta kampita tadā me tyakta pūrva bhaveṣu godha yada āsīt
translated: And then my mind did not waver, when in past lives I was a deer that was abandoned.

original: upasthānagauravarato 'haṃ vṛddhacarīṣu nitya rata āsīt /
analyzed: upasthāna gaurava rataḥ ham vṛddhacarīṣu rataḥ āsīt
translated: I was devoted to attending and honoring, and always delighted in the conduct of the elders.

original: na ca mānavānapi ca stabdha āsi kapiṃjalo vicaramāṇaḥ // //
analyzed: na ca mānavān api ca stabdhaḥ āsi kapiṃjalaḥ vicaramāṇaḥ
translated: And I was not conceited even towards humans, moving about as a partridge.

original: śaraṇāgatasya ca mayārthe tyakta samucchrayaḥ kṛpa janitvā /
analyzed: śaraṇa āgatasya ca mayā arthe tyakta samucchrayaḥ kṛpa janitvā
translated: And for the sake of one who had come for refuge, I generated compassion by abandoning my own body.

original: na ca tyakta vānaragatena vyādhanaraḥ śarābhinihatena // //
analyzed: na ca vānara gatena vyādha naraḥ śara abhinihatena
translated: And I did not abandon the path of the monkey, killed by an arrow-wielding man.

original: gajavaśagatena śoṣito me tanurapi vṛddhaguruṃ jagatsmaritvā /
analyzed: gaja vaśa gatena śoṣitaḥ me tanuḥ api vṛddha gurum jagat smaritvā
translated: When I was in the state of an elephant, my body was emaciated, but remembering the world's elders,🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: suruciramaśanaṃ mayā na bhuktaṃ mokṣita ātma gajā yadā tadāsīt // //
analyzed: su ruciram aśanam mayā na bhuktam mokṣitaḥ ātma gajāḥ yadā tadā āsīt
translated: I did not eat the most delicious food, but when I was released, I was like an elephant.

original: ṛkṣapatirabhūva śailadurge himahata sapta dināni rakṣito me /
analyzed: ṛkṣa patiḥ abhūva śaila durge hima hata sapta dināni rakṣitaḥ me
translated: I was the king of bears in a difficult mountain fortress, and for seven days I was protected by snow.

original: puruṣa vadhaku tena me prayukto na ca pratighāta kṛtaśca me tadāsmin // //
analyzed: tena me prayuktaḥ na ca pratighāta kṛtaḥ ca me tadā asmin
translated: A man tried to kill me with that, but I did not resist at that time.

original: āsi gajo himakundanikāśo bodhivarāśrita buddhaguṇārthī /
analyzed: āsi gajaḥ himakunda nikāśaḥ bodhi vara āśrita buddha guṇa arthī
translated: I was a white elephant, seeking the qualities of a Buddha, resorting to the supreme enlightenment.

original: sa viṣeṇa śareṇa ca viddho daṃṣṭravarāṃstyajamāna na dviṣṭaḥ // //
analyzed: sa viṣeṇa śareṇa ca viddhaḥ daṃṣṭra varān tyajamāna na dviṣṭaḥ  /
translated: Though pierced by poison and arrows, I did not hate, but gave up my excellent tusks.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: I was a doctor.

original: vanagocari khaṇḍakadvīpe tittiripotaka maitravihārī /
analyzed: vanagocari khaṇḍakadvīpe
translated: In the forest of Khāṇḍa Island, I was a young partridge, dwelling in friendliness.

original: sahadarśanena śamito 'gniṃ devagaṇā kusumāni kṣipanti // //
analyzed: saha darśanena śamitaḥ gnim deva gaṇā kusumāni kṣipanti
translated: The fire was extinguished by merely seeing me, and the gods scattered flowers.

original: gaṅgataraṅgajalairhiyamāṇaḥ tārita me yada āsi mṛgatve /
analyzed: gaṅga taraṅga jalaiḥ hiyamāṇaḥ tārita me yadā asi mṛga tve
translated: When I was a deer, I was carried away by the waves and waters of the Ganges.

original: vadhakā mama tenapanītā naiva mano mama tatra praduṣṭam // //
analyzed: vadhakāḥ mama tena apanītāḥ na eva manaḥ mama tatra praduṣṭam  /
translated: By that, my killers were removed, but my mind was not corrupted there.

original: tārita pañcaśataṃ vaṇijānāṃ sāgaramadhyagatāśca anāthāḥ /
analyzed: tārita pañca śatam vaṇijānām sāgara madhya gatāḥ ca anāthāḥ
translated: I rescued five hundred merchants who had fallen into the middle of the ocean, helpless.

original: taiśca hataḥ kṣudhitaiśca tadāhaṃ kacchapayonigato 'pi ca maitraḥ // //
analyzed: taiḥ ca hataḥ kṣudhitaiḥ ca tadā aham ca maitraḥ
translated: Though hungry, they killed me then, but I was friendly, even in the womb of a tortoise.

original: bodhicariṃ caramāṇahu pūrvaṃ matsya babhūva yadā jalacarī /
analyzed: bodhicarim pūrvam matsya babhūva yadā jalacarī
translated: When I was a fish in the water, practicing the conduct of enlightenment in the past,

original: tyakta mayāśraya sattvahitāya bhakṣita prāṇisahasraśatebhiḥ // //
analyzed: tyakta mayā āśraya sattva hitāya bhakṣita prāṇi sahasra śatebhiḥ
translated: I gave up my body for the benefit of beings, and was eaten by hundreds of thousands of living creatures.

original: vyādhiśatābhihataṃ jagadīkṣya samucchraya kṛtvā /
analyzed: vyādhi śata abhihatam jagat īkṣya samucchraya kṛtvā
translated: Seeing the world afflicted by hundreds of diseases, I took on a body,

original: sattva kṛtāḥ sukhitā nirujāśca prāṇaku saumya tadā ca yadāsīt // //
analyzed: sattva kṛtāḥ sukhitāḥ nirujāḥ ca saumya tadā ca yadā āsīt
translated: and made beings happy and free from illness. O gentle one, when I was like that,

original: siṃha babhūva yadā mṛgarājā sthāmabalānvita kāruṇikaśca /
analyzed: siṃha babhūva yadā mṛga rājā kāruṇikaḥ ca
translated: when I was a lion, the king of beasts, endowed with strength and power, and compassionate,

original: viddha śareṇa na dūṣita cittaṃ maitri tadā vadhake 'pi tadā me // //
analyzed: viddha śareṇa na dūṣita cittam maitri tadā vadhake tadā me  /
translated: even though I was pierced by an arrow, my mind was not corrupted. At that time, I had loving-kindness even towards the one who killed me.

original: śaṅkhatuṣāranibho hayarājā āsi purā ca samudrataṭe 'ham /
analyzed: śaṅkha tuṣāra nibhaḥ haya rājā āsi purā ca samudra taṭe ham
translated: In the past, I was a horse king, white like a conch or snow, on the shore of the ocean.

original: rākṣasimadhyagatā vaṇijo me tārita kṛtva kṛpāṃ karuṇāṃ ca // //
analyzed: rākṣasi madhya gatāḥ vaṇijaḥ me kṛpām karuṇām ca
translated: In the midst of rākṣasīs, I saved merchants by showing them compassion and kindness.

original: bodhicariṃ caramāṇa janārthe āsi kuṇāla ahaṃ yada pakṣī /
analyzed: bodhi carim caramāṇa jana arthe āsi kuṇāla aham pakṣī
translated: While practicing the conduct of enlightenment for the sake of people, I was a bird called Kuṇāla.

original: varjita kāmaguṇā bahudoṣā no ca vaśaṃ pramadāna gato 'ham // //
analyzed: kāma guṇā bahu doṣā gataḥ ham
translated: I avoided the many faults of sensual pleasures, and did not fall under the power of women.

original: āsi śaśo vanagulmanivāsī śāsatī taṃ sukṛte śaśavargam /
analyzed: āsi śaśaḥ vana gulma nivāsī śāsatī tam sukṛte śaśa vargam
translated: I was a rabbit living in a forest grove, teaching a group of rabbits about good conduct.

original: munirāśramavāsi kṣudhārtastasya kṛtena mayāśrayu tyaktaḥ // //
analyzed: muniḥ āśrama vāsi kṣudhā ārtaḥ tasya kṛtena tyaktaḥ  /
translated: I was a sage living in an ashram, tormented by hunger, and for his sake, I abandoned my own hermitage.

original: āsi śuko drumapuṣpaphalāḍhyo śuṣkadrumo na ca me sa hi tyaktaḥ /
analyzed: ā asi śukaḥ druma puṣpa phala āḍhyaḥ śuṣka drumaḥ na ca me sa hi tyaktaḥ
translated: I was a parrot, abundant with tree flowers and fruits, but even when the tree was dry, I did not abandon it.

original: dṛṣṭa kṛtajña tadā mama śakrastaṃ kṛtavāṃstaru patraphalāḍhyam // //
analyzed: dṛṣṭa kṛtajña tadā mama śakraḥ tam kṛtavān taru patra phala āḍhyam
translated: Then Shakra, seeing my gratitude, made that tree abundant with flowers and fruits again.

original: vānarasaṃghamupadruta dṝṣṭvā nāganṛpeṇa vivarjītadeśam /
analyzed: vānara saṃgham upadruta dṝṣṭvā nāga nṛpeṇa
translated: Seeing a group of monkeys afflicted, banished from their country by the king of the nagas,

original: rājabhayāttu vimokṣita te me vānararāja ahaṃ yada āsīt // //
analyzed: rāja bhayāt tu vimokṣita te me vānara rāja aham yadā āsīt
translated: I rescued them from the fear of the king. I was the king of the monkeys then.

original: śuka bhūta purā guruhetoḥ śāli haraṃśca nareṇa gṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: śuka bhūta purā guru hetoḥ śāli haran ca nareṇa gṛhītaḥ
translated: In the past, for the sake of my guru, I was caught by a man while stealing rice.

original: kiṃ nu śukā harase mama śāli nāśayate 'pi ca pakṣi maśasyam matsasyam // //
analyzed: kim nu śukā harase mama śāli nāśayate ca pakṣi maśasyam
translated: The man said, O parrot, why are you stealing my rice? You are also destroying my crop.

original: śuka so 'bravīdbhadra śṛṇuṣva caurya harāmi na te ahu śālim /
analyzed: śuka saḥ bravīt bhadra śṛṇuṣva caurya harāmi na te ahu śālim
translated: The parrot replied, O good man, listen. I am not stealing your rice.

original: jīrṇagurudvayapoṣaṇahetoḥ śāli harāmi kṛpārtha tu teṣām // //🔽Vaidya / RP
analyzed: jīrṇa guru dvaya poṣaṇa hetoḥ śāli harāmi kṛpā artha tu teṣām  vaidya rp
translated: For the sake of nourishing my two old gurus, I am stealing rice out of compassion for them.🔽The man said, O parrot, if you are stealing for the sake of your gurus, then take as much as you want.

original: bīja prakīrṇa yadā prathamaṃ te bhāga dadāmi sarvajanasya /
analyzed: bīja prakīrṇa yadā prathamam te bhāga dadāmi sarva janasya
translated: The parrot said, When you first scattered the seeds, I gave you a share of them for all people.

original: tacca giraṃ vadato mama śrutvā tenāpi caurya bhavenna kadācit // //
analyzed: tat ca giram vadataḥ mama śrutvā tena api caurya bhavet na kadācid
translated: Having heard those words of mine, you should never steal from them again.

original: sādhu śukā hara śāli yatheṣṭaṃ durlabha mānuṣa yasyimu bhaktiḥ /
analyzed: yathā iṣṭam durlabha mānuṣa bhaktiḥ
translated: “Excellent, parrot! Take the rice as you wish. It is difficult for humans to have this kind of faith.

original: mānuṣa tvaṃ maya tīryagatehā sādhu damaḥ śama saṃyama tubhyam // //
analyzed: mānuṣa tvam maya tīrya gata īhā sādhu damaḥ śama saṃyama tubhyam
translated: Human, may you and the animals here be well! Excellent self-control, peace, and restraint for you!”

original: ityevamāni caritāni pūrva caranta duṣkara kṛtāni /
analyzed: ityevamāni caritāni pūrva caranta duṣkara kṛtāni
translated: Thus, in the past, I practiced these difficult deeds.

original: na ca me manasi tatra bhavi kheda eṣata uttamāṃ viraja bodhim // //
analyzed: na ca me manasi tatra bhavi khedaḥ eṣatas uttamām viraja bodhim
translated: But my mind was not weary, seeking the highest, dust-free enlightenment.

original: ādhyātmikaṃ hyatha ca bāhyaṃ nāsti hi vastu yanmayā na dattam /
analyzed: ādhyātmikam hi atha ca bāhyam na asti hi vastu yat mayā na dattam
translated: There is no inner or outer thing that I have not given away.

original: śīle ca kṣānti tatha vīrya dhyāna upāya prajña carito 'ham // //
analyzed: śīle ca kṣānti vīrya dhyāna upāya prajña caritaḥ ham  /
translated: I have practiced morality, patience, diligence, concentration, skillful means, and wisdom.

original: māṃsaṃ tvacaṃ tathapi ca majja śoṇitameva datta svaśarīrāt /
analyzed: māṃsam tvacam ca majja śoṇitam eva datta sva śarīrāt
translated: I have given away flesh, skin, marrow, and blood from my own body.

original: prānte guhāsu ca yadā me śoṣita āśrayo 'pi caratā me // //
analyzed: prānte guhāsu ca yadā me śoṣitaḥ caratā me
translated: In the end, in the caves, my body was dried up as I practiced.

original: dhutayāna deśita jinebhiḥ yatra prayujyato jina bhavanti /
analyzed: dhutayāna deśita jinebhiḥ yatra prayujyataḥ jina bhavanti
translated: The Jinas have taught the ascetic path, practicing which one becomes a Jina.

original: tatra dhute satataṃ ca prayukto āsi caranta pure ahu nityam // //
analyzed: tatra dhute satatam ca prayuktaḥ āsi caranta pure ahu nityam
translated: In that asceticism, I was always engaged, always practicing in the past.

original: etādṛśā vrata udārā ye ca niṣevitā caratā me /
analyzed: etādṛśāḥ vrate udārāḥ ye ca niṣevitā caratā me
translated: These are the excellent vows that I have practiced.

original: śrutvā ca teṣamimāścaryamekapade na bhaviṣyati chandaḥ // //
analyzed: śrutvā ca teṣam imā āścaryam eka pade na bhaviṣyati chandaḥ
translated: Having heard this marvel, they will immediately lose their enthusiasm.

original: hāsyu bhaviṣyati ima śruṇitvā śāsanametadeva ca taḍānīm /
analyzed: bhaviṣyati śruṇitvā śāsanam etat eva ca taḍānīm
translated: They will laugh when they hear this teaching.

original: āhāramaithunaparāste middhasadābhibhūta śatakāṅkṣāḥ // //
analyzed: āhāra maithuna parāḥ te śata kāṅkṣāḥ
translated: Devoted to food and sex, constantly overcome by sleep, they are full of doubts.

original: dharmadviṣaḥ sada anāryāḥ śāsanadūṣakā guṇavihīnāḥ /
analyzed: dharma dviṣaḥ sada anāryāḥ śāsana dūṣakāḥ guṇa vihīnāḥ
translated: Always hateful of the Dharma, ignoble, defilers of the teaching, devoid of good qualities,

original: śrutvā ca dharmamima śāntaṃ naiṣa jinokta ityabhivadanti // //
analyzed: śrutvā ca śāntam na eṣa jina uktaḥ iti abhivadanti
translated: having heard this peaceful Dharma, they say, This was not spoken by the Victor.

original: ācāryo me śrutasamudro āsi bahuśrutaḥ kathikaśreṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ me śrutasamudraḥ āsi bahu śrutaḥ kathika śreṣṭhaḥ
translated: My teacher was a great ocean of learning, a renowned speaker, the most eloquent.

original: tenāpi caiṣa pratiṣiddho buddhavaco hi naiṣa tu kathaṃcit // //
analyzed: tena api ca eṣa pratiṣiddhaḥ buddha vacaḥ hi nā eṣa tu kathaṃcid
translated: He also rejected this, saying, 'This is not the Buddha's word in any way.'

original: parato 'pyabhūdapi ca vṛddhaḥ tasya guruḥ sa śāmitaguṇaughaḥ /
analyzed: paratas pi abhūt api ca vṛddhaḥ tasya guruḥ sa śāmita guṇa oghaḥ
translated: There was also an elder who was his teacher, a great ocean of learning, a renowned speaker, the most eloquent.

original: tenāpi naiṣa hi gṛhīto mātra prayujyatha vitathametat // //
analyzed: tena api nā eṣa hi gṛhītaḥ mātra vitatham etat
translated: He also did not accept this, saying, 'This is not the Buddha's word in any way. You are just applying yourself to what is false.'

original: yatrātma nāsti na ca jīvo deśita pudgalo 'pi na kathaṃcit /
analyzed: na asti na ca jīvaḥ na kathaṃcid
translated: Where there is no self and no living being, and no person in any way,

original: vyarthaḥ śramo 'tra ghaṭate yaḥ śīlaprayoga saṃvarakriyā ca // //
analyzed: vyarthaḥ ghaṭate yaḥ saṃvara kriyā ca
translated: the effort here is pointless, as is the practice of morality and the performance of vows.

original: yadyasti caiva mahāyānaṃ nātra hi ātma sattva manujo vā /
analyzed: yadi asti ca eva mahāyānam na atra hi
translated: If the Mahāyāna does not exist, then there is no self, being, or human here.

original: vyarthaḥ śramo 'tra hi kṛto me yatra na cātmasattvaupalabdhiḥ // //
analyzed: vyarthaḥ hi kṛtaḥ me yatra na ca ātma sattva aupalabdhiḥ
translated: My effort here is in vain, where there is no perception of self or being.

original: kavitāni haiva svamatāni pāpamataiḥ kutīrthikamataiśca /
analyzed: kavitāni ha eva sva matāni pāpa mataiḥ kutīrthika mataiḥ ca
translated: The poets have their own opinions, with evil views and the views of the tīrthikas.

original: bhāṣeta no jina kadācit vācamimāṃ hi bhikṣuparibhāṣām // //🔽hrīrapatrāpaśīlacaritāśca dhvāṅkṣa pragambha uddhatapracaṇḍāḥ /
analyzed: bhāṣeta naḥ jina kadācid vācam imām hi bhikṣu paribhāṣām  dhvāṅkṣa pragambhaḥ uddhata pracaṇḍāḥ
translated: The Victor never speaks this speech, which is a reproach to the monks.🔽The monks here in my teaching will have conduct devoid of shame and embarrassment, be like crows, deep, agitated, and fierce,

original: bhavitā hi bhikṣava mameha śāsani īrṣyamānamadadagdhāḥ // //
analyzed: bhavitā hi bhikṣava mama iha śāsani īrṣyamāna mada dagdhāḥ
translated: burned by envy, pride, and intoxication.

original: vidhyanta hasta tathā pādāṃścīvarakarṇakā nidhunantaḥ /
analyzed: vidhyanta hasta tathā pādān cīvarakarṇakāḥ nidhunantaḥ
translated: They will cut off their hands and feet, shake the corners of their robes,

original: kāṣāyakaṇṭha vicarantā grāmakuleṣu madyamadamattāḥ // //🔽Vaidya / RP
analyzed: kāṣāyakaṇṭha vicarantā grāma kuleṣu madya mada mattāḥ  / vaidya rp
translated: with throats like crows, wandering in villages and families, intoxicated by the intoxication of alcohol.

original: buddhasya te dhvaja gṛhītvā sevakarā gṛhasthajanatāyām /
analyzed: buddhasya te dhvaja gṛhītvā seva karāḥ gṛhastha janatāyām
translated: The Buddha's banner they take up, serving the laity,

original: lekhaṃ vahanti satataṃ te śāsanadaṃ vihāya guṇarāśim / //
analyzed: lekham vahanti satatam te śāsana dam vihāya guṇa rāśim
translated: they always carry a letter, abandoning the one who gives the teaching, the heap of qualities.

original: gogardabhāśvapaśudānātsaṃbhavate hi dāsya pi teṣām /
analyzed: go gardabha aśva paśu dānāt saṃbhavate hi teṣām
translated: From the gift of cows, donkeys, and horses, they will obtain slavery.

original: kṛṣikarmavāṇijyaprayogā yuktamanāśca te 'niśamāryāḥ // //
analyzed: kṛṣi karma vāṇijya prayogāḥ yukta manāḥ ca te niśam āryāḥ
translated: They are always engaged in farming, business, and other activities, and their minds are always focused on wealth.

original: naiṣāmanāryamapi vācyaṃ naiva ca kiṃcidasti yadakāryam /
analyzed: na eṣām anāryam api vācyam nā eva ca kiṃcid asti yat akāryam
translated: There is nothing that they consider improper to do, and they do not refrain from anything.

original: staupika sāṃghikaṃ hyapi ca vittaṃ paugdalikaṃ ca yacca samameṣām // //
analyzed: staupika sāṃghikam hi api ca vittam paugdalikam ca yat ca samam eṣām
translated: They consider the wealth of the stūpas, the Saṅgha, and the individual monks to be equal to their own.

original: bhikṣuṇa vīkṣya ca guṇāḍhyaṃ teṣvapi cāpyavarṇa kathayanti /
analyzed: vīkṣya ca guṇa āḍhyam teṣu api kathayanti
translated: Even when they see a monk who is rich in good qualities, they speak ill of him.

original: duḥśīla vañcaka praviśya kuhāste strī ca vināśayanti hi sughorāḥ // //
analyzed: duḥśīla vañcaka praviśya kuhāḥ te strī ca vināśayanti hi su ghorāḥ
translated: They are deceitful and cunning, and they destroy women with their terrible deeds.

original: gṛddho gṛhīṇa tathā kāmairyādṛśe pravrajitva te gṛddhāḥ /
analyzed: gṛddhaḥ tathā kāmaiḥ yādṛśe te gṛddhāḥ
translated: They are as greedy for sensual pleasures as householders, and even more so after going forth.

original: bhāryāṃ sutā duhitaraśca teṣu bhaviṣya gṛhisamānam // //
analyzed: bhāryām sutāḥ duhitaraḥ ca teṣu bhaviṣya gṛhi samānam
translated: They will have wives, sons, and daughters, just like householders.

original: yatraiva satkṛta kule te cīvarapiṇḍapātaparibhogaiḥ /
analyzed: yatra eva kule te cīvara piṇḍapāta paribhogaiḥ
translated: They will be honored in families with offerings of robes, alms-food, and other requisites,

original: tasyaiva dāraparigṛddhā kleśavaśānugāḥ sada anāryāḥ // //
analyzed: tasya eva kleśa vaśa anugāḥ anāryāḥ
translated: but will be attached to the wives of those very people, always acting like low-class people under the sway of afflictions.

original: kāmā ime khalu na sevyāḥ pātana tiryakpretanirayeṣu /
analyzed: kāmāḥ ime khalu na sevyāḥ pātana tiryak preta nirayeṣu
translated: These sensual pleasures should not be enjoyed, as they lead to falling into the realms of animals, hungry ghosts, and hell beings.

original: vakṣyanti te sada gṛhīṇāṃ te ca svayamadānta anupaśāntāḥ // //
analyzed: vakṣyanti te gṛhīṇām te ca anupaśāntāḥ
translated: They will always speak to householders, while themselves being undisciplined and uncontrolled.

original: svayameva te yatha adāntāḥ śiṣyagaṇo 'pi teṣa na sudāntaḥ /
analyzed: svayam eva te a dāntāḥ śiṣya gaṇaḥ pi teṣa na su dāntaḥ
translated: Just as they themselves are undisciplined, so too their assembly of disciples is not well-disciplined.

original: āhāramaithunakathāyāṃ rātridivāni teṣu gamiṣyanti // //
analyzed: āhāra maithuna kathāyām rātri divāni teṣu gamiṣyanti
translated: Days and nights will be spent by them in talk about food and sex.

original: sevārthameva na guṇārthaṃ te khalu saṃgrahaṃ dadati teṣām /
analyzed: sevā artham eva na guṇa artham te khalu saṃgraham dadati teṣām
translated: They will give them alms only for the sake of service, not for the sake of virtue.

original: śiṣyagaṇaiḥ svakaiḥ parivṛto 'haṃ pūja jane sadātra cala sidhya // //
analyzed: śiṣya gaṇaiḥ svakaiḥ parivṛtaḥ ham pūja jane sadā atra cala sidhya  /
translated: Surrounded by my own assembly of disciples, I will always receive worship here, O Wandering Ascetic.

original: kathayanti te 'pi ca janasya saṃgraha eṣa me karuṇayaiṣām /
analyzed: kathayanti te ca janasya saṃgrahaḥ eṣa me karuṇayā eṣām
translated: They will say, This is for the sake of gathering people, out of compassion for them.

original: upasthāma prārthayāmi tebhya śiṣyagaṇebhya eva na kadācit // //
analyzed: upasthām prārthayāmi tebhyaḥ śiṣya gaṇebhyaḥ eva na kadācid
translated: I will never request service from those very assembly of disciples.

original: rogābhibhūta bahu tatra kuṣṭhilāścitragātrasuvirūpāḥ /
analyzed: tatra kuṣṭhilāḥ citra gātra su virūpāḥ
translated: Many will be overcome by disease, with leprosy, their bodies disfigured in various ways.

original: pravrajiṣyanti narakeṣu āgatā āgatā sada anāryāḥ // //
analyzed: pravrajiṣyanti narakeṣu āgatā āgatā sada anāryāḥ
translated: They will go forth, having come from the hells, always ignoble.

original: uddeśasaṃvaravihīnā bhikṣuguṇeṣu te sada viyuktāḥ /
analyzed: uddeśa saṃvara vihīnāḥ bhikṣu guṇeṣu te viyuktāḥ
translated: Devoid of the precepts and vows, they will always be devoid of the qualities of monks.

original: gṛhiṇo na te 'pi vna ca bhikṣū varjita te yathā śmaśāna iva dāruḥ // //
analyzed: gṛhiṇaḥ na te ca bhikṣū te yathā śmaśāne iva dāruḥ
translated: They will be neither householders nor monks, to be avoided like a piece of wood from a charnel ground.

original: śikṣāsu cādara na teṣāṃ syānna ca prātimokṣavinaye vā /
analyzed: śikṣāsu na teṣām syāt na ca prātimokṣa vinaye vā
translated: They will have no respect for the trainings, nor for the Prātimokṣa discipline.

original: uddāmagāḥ svavaśagāste aṅkuśamuktakā iva gajendrāḥ // //
analyzed: uddāma gāḥ sva vaśa gāḥ te aṅkuśa muktakāḥ iva gaja indrāḥ
translated: They are unrestrained, under their own control, like great elephants let loose from their goads.

original: vanavāsināmapi hi teṣāṃ grāmagataṃ bhaviṣyati hi cittam /
analyzed: vana vāsinām api hi teṣām grāma gatam bhaviṣyati hi cittam
translated: Even though living in the forest, their minds will be set on village life.

original: kleśāgninā prapatitānāṃ cittamavasthitaṃ hi na ca teṣām // //
analyzed: kleśa agninā prapatitānām cittam avasthitam hi na ca teṣām
translated: Their minds will not be stable, as they fall into the fire of afflictions.

original: vismṛtya buddhaguṇa sarvān śikṣadhutāṃśca te 'pi ca upāyāna /
analyzed: vismṛtya buddha guṇa sarvān śikṣa dhutān ca te ca upāyāna
translated: Forgetting all the qualities of the Buddha and the trainings and observances, they will be filled with pride, conceit, and arrogance.

original: madamānadarpaparipūrṇāṃ te prapatanti dāruṇavīcīm // //
analyzed: mada māna darpa paripūrṇām te prapatanti dāruṇa vīcīm
translated: They will fall into the terrible Avīci hell.

original: Vaidya / RP 🔽rājakathāratāśca satataṃ te corakathābhikīrtanaratāśca /
analyzed: vaidya rp  rāja kathā ratāḥ ca satatam te cora kathā abhikīrtana ratāḥ ca
translated: They will be like physicians,🔽always delighting in stories of kings and in reciting stories of thieves,

original: jñātiniṣevane ca niratāste cintayamāna rātriṃdivasāni // //
analyzed: jñāti niṣevane ca niratāḥ te cintayamāna rātriṃdivasāni
translated: and always delighting in attending to relatives, thinking about them day and night.

original: dhyānaṃ tathādhyayanaṃ tyaktvā nitya vihārakarmaṇi niyuktāḥ /
analyzed: dhyānam tathā adhyayanam tyaktvā nitya vihāra karmaṇi niyuktāḥ
translated: Abandoning meditation and study, they will always be engaged in the duties of the monastery.

original: āvāsagṛdhrakuṭīkāste ca adāntaśiṣyaparivārāḥ // //
analyzed: āvāsa gṛdhra kuṭīkāḥ te ca a dānta śiṣya parivārāḥ
translated: They will be like crows in their nests, surrounded by unruly disciples.

original: na ca karmiko hyahaṃ vihāre ātmana hetureṣa hi kṛto me /
analyzed: na ca karmikaḥ hi aham vihāre ātmana hetuḥ eṣa hi kṛtaḥ me
translated: I am not the one who should be served in the monastery. This was done by me for my own sake.

original: ye bhikṣavo mamānukūlāsteṣvavakāśamasti hi vihāre // //
analyzed: ye bhikṣavaḥ mama anukūlāḥ teṣu avakāśam asti hi vihāre
translated: There is room in the monastery for those monks who are favorable to me.

original: ye śīlavanta guṇavanto dharmadharā janārthamabhiyuktāṃ /
analyzed: ye guṇavantaḥ dharma dharāḥ jana artham abhiyuktām
translated: Those who are virtuous, have good qualities, uphold the Dharma, and are dedicated to the welfare of people,

original: damasaṃyame satatayuktāḥ saṃgraha teṣu te na kurute ca // //
analyzed: dama saṃyame satata yuktāḥ saṃgraha teṣu te na kurute ca
translated: Always engaged in self-control and restraint, you do not gather them.

original: layanaṃ mamaitaduddiṣṭaṃ sārdhavihāriṇo 'pi ca mamedam /
analyzed: layanam mama etat uddiṣṭam ca mama idam
translated: This is designated as my dwelling, and this is for my fellow monks.

original: saṃmodikasya ca mamedaṃ gaccha na te 'sti vāsa iha kaścit // //
analyzed: saṃmodikasya ca mama idam gaccha na te sti vāse iha kaścid  /
translated: This is for my friend. Go, you have no place to stay here.

original: śayyāsanaṃ nikhila dattaṃ bhikṣavaḥ sthāpitā iha prabhūtāḥ /
analyzed: śayyā āsanam bhikṣavaḥ sthāpitāḥ iha prabhūtāḥ
translated: All the bedding and seats have been given away, and many monks have been established here.

original: na ca lābhasaṃbhava ihāsti kiṃ paribhokṣyase 'tra vraja bhikṣo // //
analyzed: na ca lābha saṃbhavaḥ iha asti kim paribhokṣyase vraja bhikṣo
translated: But there is no possibility of gain here. What will you enjoy here? Go, monk.

original: śayyāsanoddiśana teṣāṃ naiva bhaviṣyate 'pi ca kadācit /
analyzed: teṣām na eva bhaviṣyate ca kadācid
translated: They will never be assigned bedding and seats.

original: gṛhisaṃcayāśca bhavitāraste ca prabhūtabhāṇḍaparivārāḥ // //
analyzed: gṛhi saṃcayāḥ ca bhavitāraḥ te ca prabhūta bhāṇḍa parivārāḥ
translated: They will become householders' stores, and they will have many utensils and attendants.

original: nirbhartsitā pi ca samantātte hi mamaurasāścarimakāle /
analyzed: nirbhartsitā ca samantāt te hi mama aurasāḥ carima kāle
translated: They will be reviled everywhere, and in the end times they will be my own flesh and blood.

original: vacanaṃ na caite mam hi smṛtvā prāntavane tadābhinivasanti // //
analyzed: vacanam na ca ete mam hi smṛtvā prānta vane tadā abhinivasanti
translated: But they will not remember my words, and then they will dwell in the outskirts of the forest.

original: hā śāsanaṃ jinavarasya nāśamupekṣya hi nacireṇa /
analyzed: hā śāsanam jinavarasya nāśam upekṣya hi nacireṇa
translated: Alas, the teaching of the Victorious One will soon be destroyed.

original: lābhābhibhūta guṇadviṣṭā bhikṣavaḥ prādurbhūta bahu yatra // //
analyzed: guṇa dviṣṭāḥ bhikṣavaḥ
translated: Many monks will appear there, overcome by gain and hating good qualities.

original: paribhūtakāśca satataṃ te paścimakāli śīlaguṇayuktāḥ /
analyzed: paribhūtakāḥ ca satatam te paścima kāli śīla guṇa yuktāḥ
translated: And in the future time, those who possess moral discipline and good qualities will be constantly ridiculed.

original: te cāpyaraṇyavanavāsī grāma vihāya rāṣṭranagarāṇi // //
analyzed: te ca api araṇya vana vāsī grāma vihāya rāṣṭra nagarāṇi
translated: And they, dwelling in the forest and wilderness, will abandon the villages, countries, and cities.

original: sada satkṛtā guṇavihīnā bhedaka sūcakāḥ kalahakāmāḥ /
analyzed: sada satkṛtāḥ guṇa vihīnāḥ bhedaka sūcakāḥ kalaha kāmāḥ
translated: Those who are devoid of good qualities, divisive, deceitful, and fond of quarrels, will always be honored.

original: te śāstṛsaṃmata janasya te ca bhaviṣyanti mānamadadagdhāḥ // //
analyzed: te śāstṛ saṃmata janasya te ca bhaviṣyanti māna mada dagdhāḥ
translated: They will be regarded as teachers by the people, and they will be consumed by pride and arrogance.

original: ima śāsanaṃ guṇanidhānaṃ sarvaguṇākāraṃ paramaramyam /
analyzed: śāsanam guṇa nidhānam sarva guṇa ākāram parama ramyam
translated: This teaching, a treasure of good qualities, the embodiment of all good qualities, supremely delightful,

original: nāśaṃ prayāsyati mameha śīlavipattirirṣyamadadoṣaiḥ // //
analyzed: nāśam prayāsyati mama iha śīla vipattiḥ irṣya mada doṣaiḥ
translated: Will perish here due to the faults of moral downfall, jealousy, and pride.

original: ratnākaro yatha viluptaḥ sthāsyati padminīva pariśuṣkā /🔽yūpa vararatnamayaṃ bhagnaṃ naśyati śāsanaṃ carimakāle // //
analyzed: ratnākaraḥ viluptaḥ sthāsyati padminī iva pariśuṣkā  yūpa vara ratna mayam bhagnam naśyati śāsanam carima kāle
translated: Like a plundered treasure trove, like a dried-up lotus pond,🔽Like a broken sacrificial post made of precious jewels, the teaching will perish in the future time.

original: pretādṛśaścarimakāle dharmavilopa vartato sughoraḥ /
analyzed: su ghoraḥ
translated: In the future time, such a terrible destruction of the Dharma will occur.

original: te cāpi bhikṣava adāntā nāśayitāraḥ śāsanaṃ mamedam // //
analyzed: te ca api bhikṣavaḥ a dāntāḥ nāśayitāraḥ śāsanam mama idam  /
translated: And those undisciplined monks will destroy this teaching of mine.

original: ma caryasevaniratānāṃ dūrata saṃgatiḥ kvacana teṣām /
analyzed: ma carya seva niratānām dūrata saṃgatiḥ kvacana teṣām
translated: Those who are devoted to practicing the Dharma will have no connection with them anywhere.

original: pretagatirnrake 'pi ca vāsaḥ tiryagatiśca ito hi cyutānām // //
analyzed: preta gatiḥ nrake ca vāsaḥ tirya gatiḥ ca itas hi cyutānām  /
translated: After passing away from here, they will go to the realm of hungry ghosts, or dwell in hell, or go to the animal realm.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: The physician.

original: anubhūya tīvrakaṭukāni duḥkhamananta varṣaśatamanekaiḥ /
analyzed: anubhūya tīvra kaṭukāni duḥkham ananta varṣa śatam anekaiḥ
translated: Having experienced intense and bitter suffering for many hundreds of years,

original: labdhvā sa mānuṣabhavaṃ vā jāyati duḥkhitaḥ satata śocyaḥ // //
analyzed: labdhvā sa mānuṣa bhavam vā jāyati duḥkhitaḥ satata śocyaḥ
translated: Having obtained a human birth, he is born miserable and always pitiable.

original: andho 'tha vā badhira kāṇo jāyati citragātra suvirūpā /
analyzed: andhaḥ tha vā badhira kāṇaḥ jāyati citra gātra suvirūpā
translated: He is born blind, deaf, or one-eyed, with a disfigured body, unattractive.

original: bībhatsarūpabhayadarśī pāpacarīmimāṃ satata sevī // //
analyzed: bībhatsa rūpa bhaya darśī pāpa carīm imām satata sevī
translated: Always seeing fearful forms that inspire disgust, he serves this sinful conduct.

original: viśrambhate 'sya na ca kaścit śraddadhate 'sya cāpi na ca vākyam /
analyzed: viśrambhate sya na ca kaścid śraddadhate sya ca api na ca vākyam
translated: No one trusts him, and his words are not believed.

original: nirbharstito bhavati nityaṃ yo 'bhiniṣevate viṣamacaryām // //
analyzed: nirbharstitaḥ bhavati nityam yaḥ bhiniṣevate viṣama caryām
translated: He is always despised, he who resorts to this uneven conduct.

original: te rogaduḥkhaśatataptāstāḍita loṣṭakāṣṭhapraharebhiḥ /
analyzed: te roga duḥkha śata taptāḥ tāḍita loṣṭa kāṣṭha praharebhiḥ
translated: They are tormented by hundreds of diseases and sufferings, beaten with clods and sticks.

original: kṣuttṛṣṇa yena paritaptāste ca bhavanti sadā suparibhūtāḥ // //
analyzed: yena paritaptāḥ te ca bhavanti sadā su paribhūtāḥ
translated: They are always completely despised, tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: duḥkhā ananta iti jñātvā dūra pāpacaryaṃ vijahitvā /
analyzed: duḥkhāḥ anantaḥ iti jñātvā dūra pāpa caryam vijahitvā
translated: Knowing that suffering is endless, having abandoned sinful conduct from afar,

original: sevetha sādhucari nityaṃ mā bhavitānutāpa iha paścāt // //
analyzed: sevetha sādhu cari nityam mā bhavitā anutāpaḥ iha paścāt
translated: One should always serve good conduct, so as not to have regret later.

original: yasya priyo bhavati buddho āryagaṇaśca śikṣa dhutadharmāḥ /
analyzed: yasya priyaḥ bhavati buddhaḥ ārya gaṇaḥ ca śikṣa dhuta dharmāḥ
translated: One who loves the Buddha, the noble assembly, and the training of the ascetics' virtues,

original: abhiyujyathā satatamevaṃ tyaktva ca jñātralābhayaśakīrti // //🔽māyopamaṃ hi bhi /
analyzed: satatam evam tyaktvā ca jñātra lābha yaśa kīrti  māyā upamam hi bhi
translated: Always apply yourselves in this way, abandoning fame, gain, praise, and reputation.🔽This compounded world is like an illusion,

original: durametatsvapnasamaṃ ca saṃskṛtamavīkṣyam /
analyzed: duram etat svapna samam ca saṃskṛtam avīkṣyam
translated: like a dream. Do not look upon it as real.

original: nacirādbhaviṣyati viyogaḥ sarvapriyairna nityamiha kaścit // //
analyzed: nacirāt bhaviṣyati viyogaḥ sarva priyaiḥ na nityam iha kaścid
translated: Separation from all that is dear will surely come. Nothing here is permanent.

original: udyujyatāṃ ghaṭata nityaṃ pāramitāsu bhūmiṣu baleṣu /
analyzed: udyujyatām ghaṭata nityam pāramitāsu bhūmiṣu baleṣu
translated: Be diligent, always strive in the perfections, grounds, and powers.

original: mā jātu saṃśayata vīryaṃ yāvanna budhyathā pravarabodhim // //
analyzed: mā jātu saṃśayata vīryam yāvat na budhyathāḥ pravara bodhim
translated: Do not let your diligence slacken until you attain supreme enlightenment.

original: nidānaparivartaḥ prathamaḥ //
analyzed: nidāna parivartaḥ prathamaḥ
translated: Chapter 1: The Introduction

original: dvitīyaḥ parivartaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ parivartaḥ
translated: Chapter 2

original: yadbhūyasā rāṣṭrapāla bodhisattvayānīyānāṃ pudgalānāmime doṣā bhaviṣyanti anabhiyuktā anabhiyuktān pūjayiṣyanti /
analyzed: yat bhūyasā rāṣṭrapāla bodhisattva yānīyānām pudgalānām ime doṣāḥ bhaviṣyanti an abhiyuktāḥ an abhiyuktān pūjayiṣyanti
translated: Rāṣṭrapāla, those who are not diligent will honor those who are not diligent.

original: śaṭhāḥ śaṭhān pūjayiṣyanti /
analyzed: śaṭhāḥ śaṭhān pūjayiṣyanti
translated: The deceitful will honor the deceitful.

original: ajñā ajñān satkartavyān manyante /
analyzed: ajñāḥ ajñān satkartavyān manyante
translated: The ignorant will think the ignorant are worthy of honor.

original: āmiṣapriyāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: āmiṣa priyāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will take delight in material things.

original: adhyavasāne bahulāḥ kulamatsarāḥ śaṭhā dhvāṅkṣā mukharāḥ kuhakāḥ kṣātragurukāḥ /
analyzed: adhyavasāne bahulāḥ kula matsarāḥ śaṭhāḥ dhvāṅkṣāḥ mukharāḥ kuhakāḥ kṣātra gurukāḥ
translated: They will be full of conceit, jealous of families, deceitful, garrulous, boastful, cunning, and obstinate.

original: anyonyavarṇabhāṣaṇatayā lābhaṃ niṣpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: anyonya varṇa bhāṣaṇa tayā lābham niṣpādayiṣyanti
translated: They will acquire gain by praising each other.

original: lābhaparyeṣṭyarthaṃ ca te grāmaṃ pravekṣyanti /
analyzed: lābha paryeṣṭi artham ca te grāmam pravekṣyanti
translated: They will enter the village for the sake of seeking gain,

original: na sattvaparipākārthaṃ na sattvānukampārtham /🔽te ajñānino jñānanimittamātmānaṃ pratijñāsyanti kathaṃ māṃ pare vijānīyuḥ /
analyzed: na sattva paripāka artham na sattva anukampā artham  te ajñāninaḥ jñāna nimittam ātmānam pratijñāsyanti katham mām pare vijānīyuḥ
translated: not for the sake of ripening beings or out of compassion for beings.

original: bahuśrutaḥ kalyāṇadharma iti /
analyzed: bahu śrutaḥ kalyāṇa dharmaḥ iti
translated: They, being ignorant, will advertise themselves as having knowledge, thinking How can others know me as learned and virtuous?

original: agauravāśca bhaviṣyanti yathātrānabhiyuktāḥ /
analyzed: agauravāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti yathā atra anabhiyuktāḥ
translated: They will be disrespectful, as if not engaged in this.

original: bhinnabhājanībhūtā bhaviṣyanti anyonyaskhalitagaveṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: bhinna bhājanībhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti anyonya skhalita gaveṣiṇaḥ
translated: They will become vessels of division, seeking each other's faults.

original: naṣṭaprayogā ajñāḥ kusīdājñānā navakalpanabahulāḥ /
analyzed: naṣṭa prayogāḥ ajñāḥ kusīda ajñānāḥ nava kalpana bahulāḥ
translated: They will be of lost application, ignorant, lazy, and full of new ideas.

original: anyonyabhinnadharmasaṃgāyanatayā svacchandā dṛḍhavairā ākīrṇavyāpādā ayuktaparibhāṣāñjanasaṃjñaptyā iha śāsane cariṣyanti āparipṛcchanaśīlāḥ
analyzed: anyonya bhinna dharma saṃgāyana tayā svacchandāḥ dṛḍha vairāḥ ākīrṇa vyāpādāḥ ayukta paribhāṣā añjana saṃjñaptyā iha śāsane cariṣyanti ā paripṛcchana śīlāḥ
translated: They will practice in this teaching with different Dharma recitations, being self-willed, with strong hatred, and with much malice, by advertising themselves with inappropriate speech. They will be of uninquiring character.

original: dharmaśravaṇenānarthikāḥ /
analyzed: dharma śravaṇena anarthikāḥ
translated: They will be disinterested in listening to the Dharma.

original: ayuktacaryayā daridrakuleṣūpapattiṃ parigṛhīṣyanti /
analyzed: ayukta caryayā daridra kuleṣu upapattim parigṛhīṣyanti
translated: By their inappropriate conduct, they will take rebirth in poor families.

original: te daridrakule pravrajitāḥ samānā lābhamātrakeneha śāsane tuṣṭimutpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: te daridra kule pravrajitāḥ samānāḥ lābha mātrakena iha śāsane tuṣṭim utpādayiṣyanti
translated: Having gone forth in poor families, they will generate satisfaction in this teaching merely for the sake of gain.

original: teṣāmatyayadeśanāpi na bhaviṣyati kiṃ punarjñānābhisamayaḥ /🔽te buddhaguṇān ricitvā jñātralābhamātrakena śravama
analyzed: teṣām atyaya deśanā api na bhaviṣyati kim punar jñāna abhisamayaḥ  te buddha guṇān ricitvā jñātra lābha mātrakena
translated: They will not even confess their transgressions, much less realize the knowledge of perfect enlightenment.

original: ṇāḥ sma ityātmānaṃ pratijñāsyanti /🔽nāhaṃ rāṣṭrapāla teṣāṃ tathārūpāṇāṃ Vaidya / RP
analyzed: smaḥ iti ātmānam pratijñāsyanti  na aham rāṣṭrapāla teṣām tathārūpāṇām
translated: Having heard the qualities of the Buddhas, they will proclaim themselves to be disciples, merely for the sake of gain and fame.

original: pudgalānāmānulomikāmapi kṣāntiṃ vadāmi kutaḥ punarbuddhajñānam /
analyzed: pudgalānām ānulomikām api kṣāntim vadāmi kutas punar buddha jñānam
translated: I do not even say that such people are in accord with the teachings, let alone having the knowledge of a Buddha.

original: sugatisteṣāṃ dūre /
analyzed: su gatiḥ teṣām dūre
translated: Even a good rebirth is far away for them.

original: kiṃ punarbodhiḥ /
analyzed: kim punar bodhiḥ
translated: What to speak of enlightenment?

original: teṣāṃ punā rāṣṭrapāla tathārūpāṇāṃ pudgalānāmaṣṭau bodheḥ paripanthakarān dharmān vadāmi /
analyzed: teṣām punar rāṣṭrapāla tathārūpāṇām pudgalānām aṣṭau bodheḥ paripantha karān dharmān vadāmi
translated: I say, Rāṣṭrapāla, that there are eight dharmas that obstruct the enlightenment of such people as these.

original: katamānaṣṭau /
analyzed: katamān aṣṭau
translated: What are the eight?

original: apāyopapattiḥ daridrakulopapattiḥ pratyantajanapadopattiḥ nīcalukopapattirdurvarṇatāndhatvagatikāḥ pāpamitrasamavadhānaṃ bahumānyatā viṣamāparihāreṇa 🔽kālakriyāḥ /
analyzed: apāya upapattiḥ daridra kula upapattiḥ pratyanta janapada upattiḥ nīca luka upapattiḥ durvarṇa tā andha tva gatikāḥ pāpa mitra samavadhānam bahu mānya tā viṣama a parihāreṇa  kālakriyāḥ
translated: Birth in the lower realms, birth in poor families, birth in border regions, birth in low castes, ugliness, blindness, association with bad friends, and untimely death.

original: imān rāṣṭrapāla aṣṭau dharmān bodheḥ paripanthakarān vadāmi /
analyzed: imān rāṣṭrapāla aṣṭau dharmān bodheḥ paripantha karān vadāmi
translated: I say, Rāṣṭrapāla, that these eight dharmas obstruct enlightenment.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: nāhaṃ rāṣṭrapāla vacanapratijñasya bodhimiti vadāmi /
analyzed: na aham rāṣṭrapāla vacana pratijñasya bodhim iti vadāmi
translated: Rāṣṭrapāla, I do not say that one attains enlightenment by mere verbal recitation or vows.

original: na kuhakasya caryāpariśuddhiṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na kuhakasya caryā pariśuddhim vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the purification of conduct for the deceitful.

original: na śaṭhasya bodhicaryāṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na śaṭhasya bodhi caryām vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the practice of enlightenment for the deceitful.

original: nāmiṣagurukasya buddhapūjāṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na āmiṣa gurukasya buddha pūjām vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the worship of the Buddha for those who are heavy with material things.

original: nābhimāninaḥ prajñāpariśuddhiṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na abhimāninaḥ prajñā pariśuddhim vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the purification of wisdom for the proud.

original: nāhaṃ duṣprajñasamanvāgatasya saṃśayacchedanaṃ vadāmi /🔽nāhaṃ matsariṇa āśayapariśuddhiṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na aham duṣprajña samanvāgatasya saṃśaya chedanam vadāmi  na aham matsariṇaḥ āśaya pariśuddhim vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the cutting off of doubt for one who is endowed with bad wisdom.🔽I do not speak of the purification of intention for the envious.

original: nāhamanadhimuktibahulasya dhāraṇīpratilābhaṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na aham an adhimukti bahulasya dhāraṇī pratilābham vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the attainment of dhāraṇī for one who is not greatly devoted.

original: nāhamasadguṇaparyeṣakasya sugatipratilābhaṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na aham asat guṇa paryeṣakasya sugati pratilābham vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the attainment of a good rebirth for one who seeks bad qualities.

original: na kulamatsarasya kāyapariśuddhiṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na kula matsarasya kāya pariśuddhim vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the purification of the body for one who is attached to family.

original: nāhamakalpitāryapathasya buddhasamavadhānaṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na aham akalpita ārya pathasya buddha samavadhānam vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the encounter with the Buddha for one who has not prepared the noble path.

original: na kulādhyavasitasya vākpariśuddhiṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na kula adhyavasitasya vāc pariśuddhim vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the purification of speech for one who is attached to family.

original: na gauravasya cittapariśuddhiṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na gauravasya citta pariśuddhim vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the purification of mind for one who is not respectful.

original: nāhamamātrajñasya dharmakāmatāṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na aham amātra jñasya dharma kāma tām vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the desire for the Dharma for one who knows only a little.

original: na kāyajīvitasāpekṣasya dharmaveṣṭiṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na kāya jīvita sāpekṣasya dharma veṣṭim vadāmi
translated: I do not speak of the search for the Dharma for one who is concerned with body and life.

original: nāhaṃ rāṣṭrapāla ṣaṭaśāstṝṃstathā vigarhāmi yathā tān mohapuruṣān vigarhāmi /
analyzed: na aham rāṣṭrapāla ṣaṭ śāstṝn tathā vigarhāmi yathā tān moha puruṣān vigarhāmi
translated: Rāṣṭrapāla, I do not so much condemn the six teachers as I condemn those deluded people.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: anyathāvādinaste anyathākāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: anyathāvādinaḥ te anyathākāriṇaḥ
translated: They speak one way and act another.

original: visaṃvādakāḥ sadevakasya lokasya //
analyzed: visaṃvādakāḥ sa devakasya lokasya
translated: They deceive the world, including the gods.

original: atha khalu bhagavaṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then, Blessed One, at that time he spoke these verses:

original: asaṃyatā uddhata unnatāśca agauravā mānina lābhautsadā /
analyzed: a saṃyatāḥ uddhata unnatāḥ ca a gauravāḥ
translated: Those who are unrestrained, agitated, arrogant, disrespectful, conceited, attached to gain,

original: kleśābhibhūtāḥ sakhilāḥ sakiṃcanāḥ sudūra te tādṛśa agrabodhaye // //
analyzed: kleśa abhibhūtāḥ sa khilāḥ sa kiṃcanāḥ su dūra te tādṛśa agra bodhaye
translated: Overcome by afflictions, deceitful, and greedy, are far from that supreme enlightenment.

original: lābhābhibhūtasya kusīda vardhate kusīdabhūtasya pranaṣṭa śraddhā /
analyzed: lābha abhibhūtasya kusīda vardhate kusīda bhūtasya pranaṣṭa śraddhā
translated: For one overcome by gain, laziness increases; for one who is lazy, faith is lost.

original: śraddhāvipannasya pranaṣṭa śīla duḥśīlabhūtasya pranaṣṭa saṃgatiḥ // //🔽daridrabhūtāśca hi pravrajitvā dāridyramuktāṃ samavāpya pūjām /
analyzed: śraddhā vipannasya pranaṣṭa śīla duḥśīla bhūtasya pranaṣṭa saṃgatiḥ  daridra bhūtāḥ ca hi pravrajitvā dāridyra muktām samavāpya pūjām
translated: For one whose faith is lost, morality is lost; for one whose morality is lost, association is lost.🔽Having gone forth, they become poor, and having received worship freed from poverty,

original: taiḥ kāñcano bhāramivāpaviddhaḥ sa sasyabhāraḥ punarudgṛhītaḥ // //🔽lābhārthikoaraṇyamupaiti vastuṃ gaveṣate tatra gataśca jñātīn /
analyzed: taiḥ kāñcanaḥ bhāram iva apaviddhaḥ sa sasya bhāraḥ punar udgṛhītaḥ  lābha arthikaḥ araṇyam upaiti vastum gaveṣate tatra gataḥ ca jñātīn
translated: They discard it like a discarded golden burden, and take up that burden of crops again.🔽One seeking gain goes to the forest, and having gone there, seeks relatives.

original: abhijñavidyāpratibhānasaṃpado vihāya gṛhṇāti sa cāpi jñātīn // //
analyzed: abhijña vidyā pratibhāna saṃpadaḥ vihāya gṛhṇāti sa ca api jñātīn
translated: Endowed with supernormal knowledge, learning, and eloquence, he abandons them and takes up those relatives again.

original: apāyabhūmiṃ gatimakṣaṇeṣu daridratāṃ nīcakulopapattim /
analyzed: apāya bhūmim gatim akṣaṇeṣu daridra tām nīca kula upapattim
translated: They take rebirth in the lower realms, in unfortunate destinies, in poverty, in low-caste families,

original: jātyandhadaurbalyamathālpasthāmatāṃ gṛhṇanti te mānavaśena mūḍhāḥ // //
analyzed: jātyandha daurbalyam atha alpa sthāmatām gṛhṇanti te māna vaśena mūḍhāḥ
translated: As blind from birth, as weak, and with little strength, those fools, out of pride in their human status.

original: te vṛtticaryāparihīnabhāvāḥ pramādalābhena smṛtipranaṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: te vṛtti caryā parihīna bhāvāḥ pramāda lābhena smṛti pranaṣṭāḥ
translated: They, whose nature is deprived of livelihood and conduct, who have lost mindfulness due to the gain of heedlessness,

original: ghoraṃ prayāsyanti mahāprapātaṃ yato na mokṣo 'styapi kalpakoṭibhiḥ // //
analyzed: ghoram prayāsyanti mahā prapātam yatas na mokṣaḥ sti api kalpa koṭibhiḥ
translated: Will go to a terrible great abyss, from which there is no liberation even in millions of eons.

original: yadīha lābhina bhaveta bodhistaddevadatto 'pi labheta bodhim /
analyzed: yadi iha bhaveta bodhiḥ tat devadattaḥ pi labheta bodhim
translated: If one could attain enlightenment here by mere gain, then even Devadatta would attain enlightenment.

original: vairambhavātena yathaiva pakṣī kṣipyanti lābhena tathā ayuktāḥ // //
analyzed: vairambha vātena yathā eva pakṣī kṣipyanti lābhena tathā ayuktāḥ
translated: Just as a bird is carried away by a storm wind, so are the unsuitable ones carried away by gain.

original: puṇyairvihīnāḥ paradāragṛddhā aśuddhaśīlāḥ kuśaleṣu boddaraḥ /
analyzed: puṇyaiḥ vihīnāḥ para dāra gṛddhāḥ aśuddha śīlāḥ kuśaleṣu boddaraḥ
translated: Deprived of merit, greedy for others' wives, impure in conduct, averse to wholesome actions,

original: te śāsane 'narthaśmaśānadāruvat ye bodhicittena alabdhajñānāḥ // //
analyzed: te śāsane nartha śmaśāna dāru vat ye bodhi cittena alabdha jñānāḥ
translated: They are like useless logs in the teaching, those who have not attained the knowledge of the enlightenment mind.

original: bodhyarthiko 'nveṣati buddhadharmān na tiṣṭhate cāpi yathā samokṣaḥ /
analyzed: bodhi arthikaḥ nu eṣati buddha dharmāt na tiṣṭhate ca api yathā samokṣaḥ
translated: One who seeks enlightenment seeks the Buddha's teachings, but does not abide as if liberated.

original: dṛḍhāḥ sa lepena kṛtaḥ kapirvā mānābhibhūtasya tathaiva bodhiḥ // //🔽Vaidya / RP
analyzed: dṛḍhāḥ sa lepena kṛtaḥ kapiḥ vā māna abhibhūtasya tathā eva bodhiḥ 🔽vaidya rp
translated: Like a monkey smeared with glue, so is enlightenment for one overcome by pride.🔽The wise one, having attained the enlightenment mind, should not be proud, thinking, I am a bodhisattva.🔽The wise one, having attained the enlightenment mind, should not be proud, thinking, I am a bodhisattva.

original: bodhyarthikenāpi mayā svajīvaṃ tyaktaḥ priyaḥ dharmapadasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bodhyarthikena api mayā sva jīvam tyaktaḥ priyaḥ dharma padasya hetoḥ
translated: Even for the sake of enlightenment, I would give up my own life and what is dear, for the sake of a single word of the Dharma.

original: tyaktvā ca dharmāṃsta ayuktayogāḥ nirarthabhūtā nipatanti śāsanam // //
analyzed: tyaktvā ca ayukta yogāḥ nirartha bhūtāḥ nipatanti śāsanam  /
translated: Those who abandon the Dharma and are not devoted to practice, fall into the teachings without purpose.

original: mahāprapātaṃ jvalitaṃ hutāśanaṃ subhāṣitārthe patito 'smi pūrve /
analyzed: mahā prapātam jvalitam hutāśanam subhāṣita arthe smi pūrve
translated: For the sake of the well-spoken Dharma, I have fallen in the past into a great abyss, a burning fire.

original: śrutvā ca tasmin pratipattiye sthito vihāya sarvāṇi priyāpriyāṇi // //
analyzed: śrutvā ca tasmin sthitaḥ vihāya sarvāṇi priya apriyāṇi
translated: Having heard it, I remained in practice, abandoning all that is dear and not dear.

original: śrutvā guṇāḍhyaṃ ca vicitraśāsanaṃ teṣāṃ spṛhā naikapade 'pi jāyate /
analyzed: śrutvā guṇāḍhyam ca vicitra śāsanam teṣām spṛhā nā eka pade jāyate
translated: Having heard the Dharma that is rich in qualities and diverse teachings, they do not develop even a momentary desire for it.

original: adharmakāmasya kuto 'sti bodhiḥ yathaiva cāndhasya pathi prakāśanam // //
analyzed: adharma kāmasya kutas sti bodhiḥ yathā eva ca andhasya pathi prakāśanam
translated: How can there be enlightenment for one who desires unrighteousness, just as there is no illumination on a path for one who is blind?

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ rāṣṭrapāla atīte 'dhvanyasaṃkhyaeyaiḥ kalpairasaṃkhyeyatarairacintyairatulyairapramāṇairvipulairaprameyairyadāsīt /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam rāṣṭrapāla atīte dhvani asaṃkhyaiyaiḥ kalpaiḥ asaṃkhyeyataraiḥ acintyaiḥ atulyaiḥ apramāṇaiḥ vipulaiḥ aprameyaiḥ yat āsīt
translated: In the past, Protector of the Nation, in an incalculably long, incalculably longer, inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, vast, and unfathomable eon ago,

original: tena kālena tena samayena siddhārthabuddhirnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka
analyzed: tena kālena tena samayena siddhārthabuddhiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loka
translated: at that time, in that time, there was a Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One named Siddhatthabuddhi in the world.

original: udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ
analyzed: udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām
translated: He appeared, perfected in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans,

original: ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He appeared in the world, a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened one, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavat.

original: tena ca samayena arciṣmānnāma rājābhūt /
analyzed: tena ca samayena arciṣmān nāma rājā abhūt
translated: And at that time there was a king named Arcimat.

original: arciṣmataḥ punā rāṣṭrapāla rājño jambūdvīpe rājyamabhūtṣoḍaśayojanasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: arciṣmataḥ punar rāṣṭrapāla rājñaḥ jambūdvīpe rājyam abhūt ṣoḍaśa yojana sahasrāṇi
translated: And, Rāṣṭrapāla, King Arcimat's kingdom in Jambūdvīpa extended over sixteen thousand yojanas.

original: tena ca rāṣṭrapāla kālena tasmin jambūdvīpe viṃśatinagarasahasrāṇyabhūvan sarvāṇi kulakoṭisahasrikāṇi /
analyzed: tena ca rāṣṭrapāla kālena tasmin jambūdvīpe viṃśati nagara sahasrāṇi abhūvan sarvāṇi kula koṭi sahasrikāṇi
translated: And, Rāṣṭrapāla, at that time in that Jambūdvīpa there were twenty thousand cities, all with populations in the millions.

original: tasya khalu punā rāṣṭrapāla rājño 'rciṣmato ratnaprabhāsaṃ nāma nagaramabhūdrājadhānī yatra sa rājā arciṣmān prativasati dvādaśayojanānyāyāmena
analyzed: tasya khalu punar rāṣṭrapāla rājñaḥ rciṣmataḥ ratnaprabhāsam nāma nagaram abhūt rājadhānī yatra sa rājā arciṣmān prativasati dvādaśa yojanāni āyāmena
translated: And, Rāṣṭrapāla, King Arcimat had a capital city named Ratnaprabhāsa, where King Arcimat resided. It was twelve yojanas long

original: pūrveṇa paścimena ca /
analyzed: pūrveṇa paścimena ca
translated: from east to west,

original: sapta yojanāni vistareṇa dakṣiṇenottareṇa ca /
analyzed: sapta yojanāni vistareṇa dakṣiṇena uttareṇa ca
translated: and seven yojanas wide from south to north.

original: saptānāṃ ratnānāṃ ca saptaprākāramaṣṭāpadasukṛtam /
analyzed: saptānām ratnānām ca sapta prākāram aṣṭāpada su kṛtam
translated: It was surrounded by seven walls made of the seven precious substances, and the ground was made of lapis lazuli.

original: tena ca samayena daśavarṣakoṭiniyutāni sattvānāmāyuḥpramāṇamabhūt /
analyzed: tena ca samayena daśa varṣa koṭi niyutāni sattvānām āyuḥ pramāṇam abhūt
translated: And at that time the lifespan of beings was ten trillion years.

original: rājñaḥ punā rāṣṭrapāla arciṣmataḥ puṇyaraśmirnāma putro 'bhūdabhirūpaḥ prāsādiko darśanīyaḥ paramaśubhavarṇapuṣkalatayā samanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: rājñaḥ punar rāṣṭrapāla arciṣmataḥ puṇyaraśmiḥ nāma putraḥ bhūt abhirūpaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ parama śubha varṇa puṣkala tayā samanvāgataḥ
translated: “Rāṣṭrapāla, King Arciṣmān had a son named Puṇyaraśmi, who was handsome, good-looking, and attractive, possessing the full complement of good qualities and supreme beauty.

original: tasya jātamātrasyaiva nidhānasahasraṃ prādurbhūtam /
analyzed: tasya jāta mātrasya eva nidhāna sahasram prādurbhūtam
translated: As soon as he was born, a thousand treasures appeared to him.

original: saptānāṃ ratnānāmekaṃ cātra nidhānaṃ rājñaḥ prāsāde prādurbhūtaṃ daśapauruṣapramāṇaṃ saptānāṃ ratnānām /
analyzed: saptānām ratnānām ekam ca atra nidhānam rājñaḥ prāsāde prādurbhūtam daśa pauruṣa pramāṇam saptānām ratnānām
translated: One of the seven treasures appeared in the king’s palace, measuring ten fathoms, and consisted of the seven precious substances.

original: tasya khalu punā rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśme rājakumārasya jātāmātrasyaiva sarve jāmbūdvīpakāḥ sattvā āttamanaso 'bhūvan /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśme rāja kumārasya jāta amātrasya eva sarve jāmbūdvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ ātta manasaḥ bhūvan
translated: “Rāṣṭrapāla, as soon as Prince Puṇyaraśmi was born, all the beings in Jambūdvīpa were delighted.

original: ye ca sattvā bandhanagatāsteṣāṃ bandhanamokṣo 'bhūt /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ bandhana gatāḥ teṣām bandhana mokṣaḥ bhūt
translated: The beings who were in prison were released from their bonds.

original: tena khalu punā rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśminā rājakumāreṇa saptabhirdivasaiḥ sarvaśilpānyadhigatāni yāvanti laukikāni //
analyzed: tena khalu punar rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśminā rāja kumāreṇa saptabhiḥ divasaiḥ sarva śilpāni adhigatāni yāvanti laukikāni
translated: Rāṣṭrapāla, within seven days Prince Puṇyaraśmi mastered all the worldly crafts.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśme rājakumārasya śuddhāvāsakāyikā devatā ardharātrakālasamaye saṃcodayanti sma apramattena te kumāra sadā bhavitavyam
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśme rāja kumārasya śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devatāḥ ardharātra kāla samaye saṃcodayanti sma apramattena te kumāra sadā bhavitavyam
translated: “Young man, you should always be heedful,

original: anityatāpratyavekṣaṇakuśalena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: anityatā pratyavekṣaṇa kuśalena bhavitavyam
translated: skilled in contemplating impermanence.

original: alpaṃ hi kumāra jīvitaṃ manuṣyāṇām /
analyzed: alpam hi kumāra jīvitam manuṣyāṇām
translated: Young man, the life of humans is short;

original: gamanīyaḥ saṃparāyaḥ /
analyzed: gamanīyaḥ saṃparāyaḥ
translated: they must go on to the next world.

original: paralokabhayadarśinā ca te bhavitavyaṃ na sarmakriyoddhureṇa /
analyzed: para loka bhaya darśinā ca te bhavitavyam na sarma kriyā uddhureṇa
translated: You should see the fear of the next world and not be distracted by the affairs of this life.”

original: tasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: At that time, they spoke these verses:

original: mā kumāra bhava supramattako mā pramādavaśamabhyupeṣyase /
analyzed: mā kumāra bhava su pramattakaḥ mā pramāda vaśam abhyupeṣyase
translated: “Young man, do not be heedless; do not come under the sway of heedlessness.

original: apramāda sugatena varṇito ninditā hi sugataiḥ pramattakāḥ // //
analyzed: apramāda sugatena varṇitaḥ ninditāḥ hi sugataiḥ pramattakāḥ
translated: Heedfulness is praised by the Sugatas; the heedless ones are condemned by the Sugatas.

original: apramatta iha ye ca sūratā dānasaṃyamaratā amatsarāḥ /
analyzed: a pramattaḥ iha ye ca sūratāḥ dāna saṃyama ratāḥ amatsarāḥ
translated: Those who are heedful here, the heroes, delighting in generosity and restraint, free from stinginess,

original: sarvasattvakṛpamaitramānasā te bhavanti nacirānnarottamāḥ // //
analyzed: sarva sattva kṛpa maitra mānasā te bhavanti nacirāt nara uttamāḥ
translated: with minds of compassion and love for all beings, they soon become supreme among men.

original: ye 'prameya sugatā atītāḥ sāṃprataṃ ca hi ye 'pyanāgatāḥ /
analyzed: ye sugatāḥ atītāḥ sāṃpratam ca hi ye pi anāgatāḥ
translated: Those immeasurable Sugatas of the past, and those who are present now and in the future,

original: sarvaeva kuśalaista udgatā apramādapatha eva susthitāḥ // //
analyzed: sarve eva kuśalaiḥ te udgatāḥ apramāda pathe eva susthitāḥ
translated: all of them have arisen through virtue, well-established on the path of heedfulness.”

original: annapānamatha vastrabhojanaṃ hemarūpyamaṇibhūṣaṇam /
analyzed: anna pānam atha vastra bhojanam hema rūpya maṇi bhūṣaṇam
translated: Food, drink, clothing, and sustenance, gold, silver, jewels, and ornaments,

original: dattaṃ tairapi ca kalpakoṭiyaḥ prārthayadbhiriha bodhimuttamām // //🔽Vaidya / RP 🔽hastapādamatha karṇanāsikā yācitā dadati saṃpraharṣitāḥ /🔽sarvabodhiguṇapūritāśayāḥ te bhavanti nacirānnarottamāḥ // //
analyzed: dattam taiḥ api ca kalpa koṭiyaḥ prārthayadbhiḥ iha bodhim uttamām  vaidya rp  hasta pādam atha karṇa nāsikāḥ yācitāḥ dadati saṃpraharṣitāḥ  sarva bodhi guṇa pūrita āśayāḥ te bhavanti nacirāt nara uttamāḥ
translated: Even those given by them for many millions of eons, by those who seek enlightenment here in the supreme way.🔽The wise one, having given up the pleasures of the senses,

original: rajyasaukhyavibhavāṃśca sarvaśo viprahāya dayitāḥ sriyo 'pi ca /
analyzed: rajya saukhya vibhavān ca sarvaśas viprahāya dayitāḥ ca
translated: Having given up the kingdom, the pleasures of love, and the wealth of sovereignty,🔽Having given up the pleasures of love, even the beloved women,

original: raṅgamāyasadṛśaṃ hi saṃskṛtaṃ saṃśrayasva vanameva niḥspṛhaḥ // //
analyzed: raṅgam āya sadṛśam hi saṃskṛtam saṃśrayasva vanam eva niḥspṛhaḥ
translated: For conditioned things are like a play or illusion. Take refuge in the forest alone, without desire.

original: jīvitaṃ capalamadhruvaṃ sadā mṛttikāghaṭaka eva bhedi ca /
analyzed: jīvitam capalam adhruvam sadā mṛttikā ghaṭake eva bhedi ca
translated: Life is fleeting and always unstable, like a clay pot, it is bound to break.

original: yācitopamamaśāśvataṃ sadā nātra nityamaśubhaṃ kumāraka // //
analyzed: yācita upamam aśāśvatam sadā na atra nityam aśubham kumāraka
translated: Like something borrowed, it is never eternal. There is no permanence or purity in this, young man.

original: neha mātra na pitā na bāndhavā dhārayanti yatamāna durgatim /
analyzed: na iha na pitā na bāndhavāḥ dhārayanti yatamāna durgatim
translated: Here, neither mother, nor father, nor relatives can protect one from misfortune, even if they try.

original: yatkṛtaṃ hi śubhāśubhaṃ tatprāyantamanuyāti pṛṣṭhataḥ // //
analyzed: yat kṛtam hi śubha aśubham tat prāyantam anuyāti pṛṣṭhatas
translated: For whatever good or bad deeds one has done, that follows one from behind.

original: kāmahetu bahukalpasāgarā anyamanyavadhitā nirarthakāḥ /
analyzed: kāma hetu bahu kalpa sāgarāḥ anya manya vadhitāḥ nirarthakāḥ
translated: For the sake of desire, in many oceans of eons, killing each other in vain,

original: kasyacinna ca kṛtaṃ tvayā hitaṃ vyartha eva ca niveśitaḥ śramaḥ // //
analyzed: kasyacid na ca kṛtam tvayā hitam vyarthaḥ eva ca niveśitaḥ śramaḥ
translated: You have not benefited anyone, and your efforts have been wasted.

original: adya te jagata eṣato hitaṃ bodhiśāntamatulaṃ padottamam /
analyzed: adya te jagataḥ eṣataḥ hitam bodhi śāntam atulam pada uttamam
translated: Today, seeking the welfare of the world, you aspire for the unsurpassed state of tranquil enlightenment.

original: majjamāṃsamapi carma śuṣyate yadyapi tvamapi mā kṛthā śramam // //
analyzed: majja māṃsam api carma śuṣyate yadi api tvam api mā kṛthāḥ śramam
translated: Even if your flesh, bones, and skin dry up, do not give up your efforts.

original: durlabho hi sugatasya saṃbhavaḥ śāntadharmaśravaṇaṃ sudurlabham /
analyzed: durlabhaḥ hi sugatasya saṃbhavaḥ śānta dharma śravaṇam su durlabham
translated: The appearance of a Sugata is rare, and hearing the teachings of peace is extremely rare.

original: mārapakṣamavadhūya yatnato buddhajñāna nacireṇa lapsyase // //
analyzed: māra pakṣam avadhūya yatnataḥ buddha jñāna nacireṇa lapsyase
translated: Having diligently abandoned Mara's faction, you will soon attain the wisdom of a Buddha.

original: bhadramitraparisevakaḥ sadā pāpamitraparivarjako bhava /
analyzed: bhadra mitra parisevakaḥ sadā pāpa mitra parivarjakaḥ bhava
translated: Always serve good friends and avoid evil friends.

original: satpathe upanayanti te sadā duṣpathā ca satataṃ nivārakāḥ // //
analyzed: sat pathe upanayanti te sadā duṣpathā ca satatam nivārakāḥ
translated: They always lead you on the right path and constantly keep you from wrong paths.

original: sādhu vīryamapi kṛtva susthiraṃ kāyajīvitaspṛhāṃ vihāya ca /
analyzed: sādhu vīryam api susthiram kāya jīvita spṛhām vihāya ca
translated: Having firmly cultivated good effort, and abandoned attachment to body and life,

original: vajrakalpahṛdayā dṛḍhāśrayā buddhamārgamimameva suśrutam // //
analyzed: vajra kalpa hṛdayāḥ dṛḍha āśrayāḥ buddha mārgam imam eva su śrutam
translated: with a mind as stable as a vajra, you have well heard this path to Buddhahood.

original: durlabhaṃ padavaraṃ hyanuttaraṃ sarva eva purimā narottamā /
analyzed: durlabham pada varam hi anuttaram sarve eva purimāḥ nara uttamāḥ
translated: This unsurpassed, excellent state is rare, all the supreme beings of the past

original: araṇyagocararatāḥ prabhaṃkarāḥ teṣa tvaṃ cara pathe 'nuvartakaḥ // //
analyzed: araṇya gocara ratāḥ prabhaṃkarāḥ teṣa tvam cara pathe nuvartakaḥ
translated: delighted in dwelling in the forest, shining brightly - you should follow their path.

original: araṇyavāsanirataḥ sadā bhava mātṛputrapitṛbāndhavān priyān /
analyzed: araṇya vāsa nirataḥ sadā bhava mātṛ putra pitṛ bāndhavān priyān
translated: Always delight in dwelling in the forest, abandoning your dear mother, son, father, and relatives,

original: viprahāya sakalaṃ suhṛjjanaṃ kāyajīvitakṛtāmapi tṛṣṇām /
analyzed: viprahāya sakalam suhṛd janam kāya jīvita kṛtām api tṛṣṇām
translated: And all your friends and relatives, and even your craving for your body and life,

original: eṣatādya vipulaṃ sugatajñānasaṃcayam eṣatā padavaraṃ hyanuttaram // //
analyzed: eṣatā adya vipulam sugata jñāna saṃcayam eṣatā pada varam hi anuttaram
translated: Seek today the vast accumulation of the Sugata's knowledge, and seek the supreme, unsurpassed state.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumārastata upādāya daśabhirvarṣairna jātu styānamiddhamavakrāmitavān /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ tatas upādāya daśabhiḥ varṣaiḥ na jātu styānam iddham avakrāmitavān
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, from that time on, for ten years, the young prince Puṇyaraśmi never experienced laziness or drowsiness,

original: na jātu hasitavān /🔽na krīḍito na ramitaḥ /
analyzed: na jātu hasitavān  na krīḍitaḥ na ramitaḥ
translated: never laughed,

original: na paricārito na jātūdyānabhūmiṃ gato na jātu sakhāyān dṛṣṭvā vismitaḥ /
analyzed: na paricāritaḥ na jātu udyāna bhūmim gataḥ na jātu sakhāyān dṛṣṭvā vismitaḥ
translated: never played, never rejoiced, never attended to others, never went to the pleasure groves, never marveled at seeing friends,

original: na jātu gītābhilāṣyabhūt /
analyzed: na jātu gīta abhilāṣī abhūt
translated: never desired to sing,

original: na rājyadhanagṛhanagareṣu spṛhāmutpāditavān /
analyzed: na rājya dhana gṛha nagareṣu spṛhām utpāditavān
translated: never gave rise to longing for the wealth, kingdom, house, or city,

original: evaṃ sarvavastuṣu anapekṣo 'bhūt /
analyzed: evam sarva vastuṣu anapekṣaḥ bhūt
translated: and so on, he became indifferent to all things.

original: ekaḥ pradhyāyamānaḥ sthito 'bhūt pratisaṃlīnaḥ paramadaurbalyabhāvaṃ vicintayan /
analyzed: ekaḥ pradhyāyamānaḥ sthitaḥ bhūt pratisaṃlīnaḥ parama daurbalya bhāvam vicintayan
translated: He stood alone, contemplating, absorbed, thinking about the state of supreme weakness,

original: asāramitvaraṃ ca lokamanāśvasan /
analyzed: asāram itvaram ca lokam anāśvasān
translated: and the world's lack of substance and impermanence, without any confidence.

original: apriyasamavadhānaṃ priyavinābhāvaṃ bālollāpanaṃ saṃsāraratinirāsvādaṃ rājyasukhaṃ vimoghadharmaṃ Vaidya / RP
analyzed: apriya samavadhānam priya vinābhāvam bāla ullāpanam saṃsāra rati nirāsvādam rājya sukham vimogha dharmam
translated: The king said, “The meeting with what is unpleasant, the separation from what is pleasant, the deception of childish beings, the lack of satisfaction in worldly pleasures, the futility of royal happiness, and the delusion of Dharma, physician,

original: bhavābhīṣṭaṃ śamatṛptaṃ pṛthagjanatvaṃ sadā viruddham /
analyzed: bhava abhīṣṭam śama tṛptam pṛthagjana tvam sadā viruddham
translated: The desire for existence, the satisfaction of tranquility, and the constant opposition of being an ordinary person—

original: bālāyuktajanamadhyagato 'smi yannvahaṃ tūṣṇībhāvenātināmadhyeyam /
analyzed: bālā yukta jana madhya gataḥ smi yat nu aham tūṣṇībhāvena ati nāma dhyeyam
translated: I am in the midst of childish and improper people. I should remain silent and not engage in conversation.”

original: sa ekānte tūṣṇībhūtaḥ apramādaṃ vicintayan priyavinābhāvamekākī viharati sma //
analyzed: saḥ ekānte tūṣṇībhūtaḥ apramādam vicintayan priya vinābhāvam ekākī viharati sma
translated: He remained silent in one place, contemplating heedfulness and the separation from what is dear, dwelling alone.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājñārciṣmatā anyatarasmin pṛthivīpradeśe ratipradhānaṃ nāma nagaraṃ māpitamabhūt kumārasya paribhogārtham /
