analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājñā arciṣmatā anyatarasmin pṛthivī pradeśe ratipradhānam nāma nagaram māpitam abhūt kumārasya paribhoga artham
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, King Arciṣmān had a city named Ratipradhāna built on a certain piece of land for the prince to enjoy.

original: dakṣiṇenottareṇa ca sapta vīthīśatāni /
analyzed: dakṣiṇena uttareṇa ca sapta vīthī śatāni
translated: It had seven hundred streets running north and south,

original: saptabhiḥ prākāraiḥ samantato 'nuparikṣiptamabhūtsaptaratnamayaiḥ kiṅkiṇījālasamucchritairmuktājālaratnayaṣṭivitānaiḥ /
analyzed: saptabhiḥ prākāraiḥ samantataḥ nu parikṣiptam abhūt sapta ratna mayaiḥ kiṅkiṇī jāla samucchritaiḥ muktā jāla ratna yaṣṭi vitānaiḥ
translated: and was surrounded on all sides by seven ramparts made of the seven precious substances, with nets of bells and canopies of jeweled poles and pearl nets.

original: sarveṣu ca vīthīmukheṣu aśītiratnayaṣṭisahasrāṇi sthāpitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca vīthī mukheṣu aśīti ratna yaṣṭi sahasrāṇi sthāpitāni abhūvan
translated: In front of every street, eighty thousand jeweled poles were erected.

original: sarvasyā ca ratnayaṣṭayāṃ yaṣṭiratnasūtrasahasrāṇi nibaddhānyabhūvan /
analyzed: sarvasyāḥ ca ratna yaṣṭayām yaṣṭi ratna sūtra sahasrāṇi nibaddhāni abhūvan
translated: And on every jeweled pillar, a thousand jeweled threads were fastened.

original: sarvatra ca ratnasūtre caturdaśa tālapaṅktikoṭyo nibaddhānyabhūvan /
analyzed: sarvatra ca ratna sūtre caturdaśa tāla paṅkti koṭyaḥ nibaddhāni abhūvan
translated: And on every jeweled thread, fourteen koṭis of palm trees were fastened.

original: yāsāṃ vāteneritānāṃ vātasaṃghaṭṭitānāṃ tadyathāpi nāma tūryaśatasahasrasya ghoṣaśabdaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yāsām vātena īritānām vāta saṃghaṭṭitānām tat yathā api nāma tūrya śata sahasrasya ghoṣa śabdaḥ syāt
translated: When shaken by the wind, the sound of those palm trees was like the sound of a hundred thousand musical instruments.

original: sarveṣu ca vīthīmukheṣu pañca pañca kanyāśatāni sthāpitānyabhūvan gītakuśalāni nṛttakuśalāni prathamayauvanaprāptāni sarvajagatparibhogyāni
analyzed: sarveṣu ca vīthī mukheṣu pañca pañca kanyā śatāni sthāpitāni abhūvan gīta kuśalāni nṛtta kuśalāni prathama yauvana prāptāni sarva jagat paribhogyāni
translated: At the entrance to every street, five hundred girls were placed, skilled in singing and dancing, in the prime of youth, to be enjoyed by the whole world.

original: tāsāṃ ca rājñārciṣmatā ājñā dattābhūt rātridivaṃ bhavantībhirnānyā kthā kāryāṃ anyatra nṛttagītavāditena /
analyzed: tāsām ca rājñā arciṣmatā ājñā dattā abhūt rātri divam bhavantībhiḥ na anyā kthā kāryām anyatra nṛtta gīta vāditena
translated: And King Arciṣmān gave them this order: Day and night, you should do nothing but sing, dance, and play music, except for that.

original: sarve rañjayitavyā ye keciccaturṣu dikṣvāgacchanti /
analyzed: sarve rañjayitavyāḥ ye kecid caturṣu dikṣu āgacchanti
translated: You should delight everyone who comes from the four directions.

original: apyevaṃ nāma kumārasya raticittamutpadyeta /
analyzed: api evam nāma kumārasya rati cittam utpadyeta
translated: And let it be so that the prince's mind becomes joyful.

original: na ca kasyacit sattvasyāpanāyaṃ vaktavyam /
analyzed: na ca kasyacid sattvasya apanāyam vaktavyam
translated: And you should not speak of any misfortune to anyone.

original: teṣu ca punaḥ sarvavīthīmukheṣu annamannārthikebhyo dīyate /
analyzed: teṣu ca punar sarva vīthī mukheṣu annam anna arthikebhyaḥ dīyate
translated: And in all those street entrances, food is given to those who seek food.

original: pānaṃ pānārthikebhyaḥ /
analyzed: pānam pāna arthikebhyaḥ
translated: He gave drinks to those who needed drinks,

original: yānaṃ yānārthikebhyo yāvadvadvastragandhamālyavilepanaśayyopāśrayajīvitapariṣkāraṃ
analyzed: yānam yāna arthikebhyaḥ yāvat vat vastra gandha mālya vilepana śayyā upāśraya jīvita pariṣkāram
translated: vehicles to those who needed vehicles, and so on up to ointments, perfumes, garlands, and beds, and all the necessities of life,

original: suvarṇarūpyamaṇimuktāvaiḍūrya śaṅkhaśilāpravālajātarūparajata hastyaśvaśodhanaṃ sarvābharaṇaṃ
analyzed: suvarṇa rūpya maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāla jātarūpa rajata hasti aśva śodhanam sarva ābharaṇam
translated: gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch-shells, crystals, corals, refined gold, silver, elephants, horses, and all kinds of ornaments,

original: ratnarāśayaśca sthāpitā abhūvan sarvajanaparibhogārtham /
analyzed: ratna rāśayaḥ ca sthāpitāḥ abhūvan sarva jana paribhoga artham
translated: and heaps of jewels were placed there for the enjoyment of all people.

original: tena ca samayena madhye nagarasya samantato yojanaṃ gṛhaṃ kumārasya māpitamabhūtparibhogāya saptānāṃ ratnānāmaṣṭāpadanibaddhaṃ toraṇasaptapratimaṇḍitam
analyzed: tena ca samayena madhye nagarasya samantataḥ yojanam gṛham kumārasya māpitam abhūt paribhogāya saptānām ratnānām aṣṭāpada nibaddham toraṇa sapta pratimaṇḍitam
translated: At that time, in the middle of the city, a house was built for the prince's enjoyment, extending one yojana on all sides, made of the seven precious substances, with eight corners and adorned with seven gates,

original: tatra caikaḥ prāsādaḥ kārito 'bhūt /
analyzed: tatra ca ekaḥ prāsādaḥ kāritaḥ bhūt
translated: and in it a palace was constructed,

original: yatra catasraḥ śayanakoṭyaḥ prajñaptamabhūtkumārasya paribhogārtham /
analyzed: yatra catasraḥ śayana koṭyaḥ prajñaptam abhūt kumārasya paribhoga artham
translated: where four koṭis of beds were arranged for the prince's enjoyment.

original: tatra ca madhye udyānaṃ māpitamabhūtsarvapuṣpavṛkṣasarvaphalavṛkṣasarvaratnavṛkṣapratisphuṭaṃ saṃchāditamabhūta /
analyzed: tatra ca madhye udyānam māpitam abhūt sarva puṣpa vṛkṣa sarva phala vṛkṣa sarva ratna vṛkṣa pratisphuṭam saṃchāditam abhūta
translated: In the middle of it, a garden was built, covered with all kinds of flowering trees, all kinds of fruit trees, and all kinds of jeweled trees,

original: tasya khalu punā rāṣṭrapāla udyānasya madhye puṣkariṇi kāritābhūt saptaratnamayī catūratnasopānī /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar rāṣṭrapālaḥ udyānasya madhye puṣkariṇi kāritā abhūt sapta ratna mayī catur ratna sopānī
translated: “Rāṣṭrapāla, in the middle of that park, he had a pond made, which was made of the seven precious materials and had staircases made of the four precious materials.

original: tadyathā suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya /
analyzed: tat yathā suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya
translated: Namely, gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: aṣṭottaraṃ ca siṃhamukhaśataṃ yena gandhodakaṃ praviśati tasyāḥ khalu punaḥ puṣkariṇyāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa uttaram ca siṃhamukha śatam yena gandha udakam praviśati tasyāḥ khalu punar puṣkariṇyāḥ
translated: There were one hundred and eight lion-mouths through which scented water flowed into that pond.

original: aṣṭaśatameva siṃhamukhānāṃ yena punareva tadvāri nirvahati /
analyzed: aṣṭaśatam eva siṃha mukhānām yena punar eva tat vāri nirvahati
translated: There were exactly one hundred and eight lion-mouths through which the water flowed out again.

original: utpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkaiḥ satatasamitaṃ saṃpuṣpitā samantataśca ratnavṛkṣaparivāritā sarvakālikaiśca puṣpaphalavṛkṣaiḥ parisphuṭā /
analyzed: utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīkaiḥ satata samitam saṃpuṣpitā samantataḥ ca ratna vṛkṣa parivāritā sarva kālikaiḥ ca puṣpa phala vṛkṣaiḥ parisphuṭā
translated: It was always filled with blooming lotuses, blue lotuses, night lotuses, and white lotuses, and surrounded on all sides by jeweled trees and trees bearing flowers and fruits at all times.

original: tasyāḥ puṣkariṇyāḥ tīre aṣṭaśataṃ ratnavṛkṣāṇāṃ māpitamabhūt /🔽sarvasmin ratnavṛkṣe ṣaṣṭiṣaṣṭi ratnasūtrāṇi nibaddhāni /
analyzed: tasyāḥ puṣkariṇyāḥ tīre aṣṭaśatam ratna vṛkṣāṇām māpitam abhūt  sarvasmin ratna vṛkṣe ṣaṣṭiṣaṣṭi ratna sūtrāṇi nibaddhāni
translated: On the banks of that pond, he had eight hundred jeweled trees planted.🔽On each jeweled tree, sixty jeweled threads were fastened.

original: sarvatra ca tālapaṅktikoṭyo nibaddhāḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra ca tāla paṅkti koṭyaḥ nibaddhāḥ
translated: And on each one, ten million strings of pearls were fastened.

original: tāsāṃ ca vāteneritānāṃ vātasaṃghaṭṭitānāṃ śabdo niścarati tadyathāpi nāma tūryaśatasahasrasya saṃpravāditasya /
analyzed: tāsām ca vātena īritānām vāta saṃghaṭṭitānām śabdaḥ niścarati tat yathā api nāma tūrya śata sahasrasya saṃpravāditasya
translated: And when those [flowers] were blown by the wind and struck by the wind, a sound arose, just like the sound of a hundred thousand musical instruments.

original: sā ca puṣkariṇi upariratnajālasaṃchāditābhūt /
analyzed: sā ca puṣkariṇi upari ratna jāla saṃchāditā abhūt
translated: And that lotus pond was covered above with a jeweled net,

original: mā kumārasya rajo pāṃśurvā śarīre nipatiṣyatīti //
analyzed: mā kumārasya rajaḥ pāṃśuḥ vā śarīre nipatiṣyati iti
translated: so that no dust or dirt would fall on the body of the prince.

original: tena ca samayena tasmin prāsāde catasra āsanakoṭyaḥ prajñaptā abhūvan saptaratnamayyaḥ /
analyzed: tena ca samayena tasmin prāsāde catasraḥ āsana koṭyaḥ prajñaptāḥ abhūvan sapta ratna mayyaḥ
translated: At that time, in that palace, four koṭis of seats were arranged, made of the seven precious substances.

original: sarvasmiṃścāsane pañca pañca dūṣyaśatāni prajñptānyabhūvan /
analyzed: sarvasmin ca āsane pañca pañca dūṣya śatāni prajñptāni abhūvan
translated: And on each seat, five hundred pairs of garments were arranged.

original: tatra ca madhye āsanaṃ prajñaptaṃ saptaratnamayaṃ saptapauruṣamuccatvena aśītidūṣyakoṭibhiḥ prajñaptam /
analyzed: tatra ca madhye āsanam prajñaptam sapta ratna mayam sapta pauruṣam ucca tvena aśīti dūṣya koṭibhiḥ prajñaptam
translated: And in the middle, a seat was arranged, made of the seven precious substances, seven cubits high, arranged with eighty koṭis of pairs of garments,

original: yatra puṇyaraśmī rājakumāro Vaidya / RP
analyzed: yatra puṇya raśmiḥ rāja kumāraḥ
translated: where Prince Puṇyaraśmi would sit, the physician.

original: niṣetsyata iti /
analyzed: niṣetsyate iti
translated: So that he may sit there.

original: sarvatra cāsanamūle agarugandhaghaṭikā dhūpyate /
analyzed: sarvatra ca āsana mūle agaru gandha ghaṭikā dhūpyate
translated: And at the foot of each seat, an agarwood incense burner was burning.

original: triṣkṛtvo divasasya triṣkṛtvo rātreḥ puṣpasaṃstaraḥ kriyate /
analyzed: triṣkṛtvaḥ divasasya triṣkṛtvaḥ rātreḥ puṣpa saṃstaraḥ kriyate
translated: Three times a day and three times a night, a bed of flowers was made.

original: suvarṇachadanācchāditaṃ suvarṇapadmapralambitaṃ muktājālavitataṃ maṇiratnaprabhāvabhāsitamaśītisahasrapralambitam /🔽sarvatra ca ratnavṛkṣe patākāśatāni pralambitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: suvarṇa chadana ācchāditam suvarṇa padma pralambitam muktā jāla vitatam maṇi ratna prabhā avabhāsitam aśīti sahasra pralambitam  sarvatra ca ratna vṛkṣe patākā śatāni pralambitāni abhūvan
translated: It was covered with a golden canopy, hung with golden lotuses, draped with pearl nets, illuminated by the radiance of precious jewels, and hung with eighty thousand banners.🔽At every jeweled tree, there were a hundred banners hanging.

original: sarvatra codyāne navatirmaṇiratnaśatasahasrāṇi yojanaprabhāṇi sthāpitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: sarvatra ca udyāne navatiḥ maṇi ratna śata sahasrāṇi yojana prabhāṇi sthāpitāni abhūvan
translated: In every garden, there were ninety thousand precious jewels, each with a radiance of a hundred thousand leagues, that were placed there.

original: teṣāṃ ca prabhayā sarvaloko 'vabhāsito 'bhūt /
analyzed: teṣām ca prabhayā sarva lokaḥ vabhāsitaḥ bhūt
translated: By their radiance, the entire world was illuminated.

original: tasmin punā rāṣṭrapāla udyāne śukasārikakroñcakokilamayūrahaṃsacakravākakunālakalaviṅkajīvaṃjīvakā manuṣyapralāpinaḥ pakṣiṇo 'bhūvan /
analyzed: tasmin punar rāṣṭrapāle udyāne śuka sārika kroñca kokila mayūra haṃsa cakravāka kunāla kalaviṅka jīvaṃjīvakāḥ manuṣya pralāpinaḥ pakṣiṇaḥ bhūvan
translated: Moreover, in that garden, there were parrots, myna birds, cranes, cuckoos, peacocks, geese, chakravakas, kunalas, kalavinkas, and jivamjivakas that spoke like humans.

original: yeṣāṃ nikūjitāni nadatāṃ nandane devānāmiva madanīyaḥ śabdo niścarati /
analyzed: yeṣām nikūjitāni nadatām nandane devānām iva madanīyaḥ śabdaḥ niścarati
translated: When they cooed and sang, a sound arose that was intoxicating, like that of the gods in the Nandana Grove.

original: kumārasya ca paribhogārthaṃ pañcarasaśataprakārāṇi bhojanāni satatasamitamabhisaṃskṛtānyabhūvan sarvākārasaṃpannāni //
analyzed: kumārasya ca paribhoga artham pañca rasa śata prakārāṇi bhojanāni satata samitam abhisaṃskṛtāni abhūvan sarva ākāra saṃpannāni
translated: For the prince's enjoyment, there were always prepared five hundred types of food with a hundred flavors, complete in every way.

original: tena ca punaḥ samayena viṃśavarṣāḥ samānāḥ ṣoḍaśavarṣātikrāntāḥ kumārakāḥ sarvanagarebhyaḥ samudānīya tatra ca nagare praveśitā abhūvan sarvaśilpasthānakarmasthānavidhijñāḥ
analyzed: tena ca punar samayena viṃśa varṣāḥ samānāḥ ṣoḍaśa varṣa atikrāntāḥ kumārakāḥ sarva nagarebhyaḥ samudānīya tatra ca nagare praveśitāḥ abhūvan sarva śilpasthāna karmasthāna vidhi jñāḥ
translated: At that time, boys of twenty years, sixteen years old, were gathered from all the cities and brought into that city, skilled in all crafts, skilled in all worldly pleasures and enjoyments.

original: sarvaloikikaratyupakaraṇavidhijñānāmaśītikoṭyaḥ tasminnagare praveśitā abhūvan /🔽tasya mātāpitṛbhyāṃ koṭiḥ kanyānāṃ dattā /
analyzed: sarva loikika rati upakaraṇa vidhi jñānām aśīti koṭyaḥ tasmin nagare praveśitāḥ abhūvan  tasya mātā pitṛbhyām koṭiḥ kanyānām dattā
translated: Eighty koṭis were brought into that city.🔽His parents gave him a koṭi of maidens.

original: jñātisaṃghena koṭiḥ /🔽naigamajñānapadaiḥ koṭiḥ /
analyzed: jñāti saṃghena koṭiḥ  naigama jñānapadaiḥ koṭiḥ
translated: A koṭi was given by the kinsmen,

original: sarvarājena koṭiḥ kanyānāṃ dattā abhūvan /
analyzed: sarva rājena koṭiḥ kanyānām dattāḥ abhūvan
translated: a koṭi by the citizens and guildsmen,🔽and a koṭi by the king.

original: tāśca sarvā abhurūpāḥ prāsādikā darśanīyāḥ sarvāḥ ṣoḍaśavarṣapramāṇā jātyā gītakuśalā
analyzed: tāḥ ca sarvāḥ abhurūpāḥ prāsādikāḥ darśanīyāḥ sarvāḥ ṣoḍaśa varṣa pramāṇāḥ jātyā gīta kuśalā
translated: All of them were beautiful, graceful, and lovely to behold, all sixteen years of age, skilled in singing,

original: vādyakuśalā nṛttakuśalā hasitakuśalāḥ puruṣopasaṃkramaṇakuśalā ārjavāḥ śiśavā madhurā
analyzed: vādya kuśalāḥ nṛtta kuśalāḥ hasita kuśalāḥ puruṣa upasaṃkramaṇa kuśalāḥ ārjavāḥ śiśavāḥ madhurā
translated: skilled in playing instruments, skilled in dancing, skilled in laughing, skilled in approaching men, straightforward, youthful, sweet,

original: vṛddhayaḥ pūrvābhilāpinyaḥ smitamukhāśopacārakuśalāḥ sarvakalāsu vidhijñā nātidīrghā
analyzed: vṛddhayaḥ pūrva abhilāpinyaḥ smita mukha āśā upacāra kuśalāḥ sarva kalāsu vidhi jñāḥ na ati dīrghā
translated: affectionate, speaking first, skilled in smiling and attending, skilled in all arts, not too tall,

original: nātihrasvā nātisthūlā nātigauryo nātiśyāmāḥ /
analyzed: na ati hrasvāḥ na ati sthūlāḥ na ati gauryaḥ na ati śyāmāḥ
translated: not too short, not too fat, not too fair, not too dark.

original: yāsāmutpalagandho mudhāt pravāti /
analyzed: yāsām utpala gandhaḥ mudhāt pravāti
translated: From whose mouths the scent of utpala flowers wafts,

original: candanagandho gātrebhyaḥ pravāti /
analyzed: candana gandhaḥ gātrebhyaḥ pravāti
translated: and from whose bodies the scent of sandalwood wafts.

original: vyaktāṃ iva devakanyakāḥ /
analyzed: vyaktām iva deva kanyakāḥ
translated: They are like clearly visible celestial maidens.

original: ekāntamanāmayacāroṇyaḥ /
analyzed: ekāntam anāmaya cāroṇyaḥ
translated: They are completely free from illness and pain.

original: tāsāṃ madhyagataḥ puṇyaraśmī rājakumāraḥ saṃgītisaṃprabhāṇitena tatra ca saṃgītiśabde
analyzed: tāsām madhya gataḥ puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ saṃgīti saṃprabhāṇitena tatra ca saṃgīti śabde
translated: In the middle of them, Prince Puṇyaraśmi, through the power of his previous practice, did not arouse thoughts of desire.

original: caivaṃ cittamutpādayati mahānamitrasaṃgho batāyaṃ mama prādurbhutaḥ kuśaladharmaparimoṣakaḥ /
analyzed: ca evam cittam utpādayati mahān amitra saṃghaḥ bata ayam mama prādurbhutaḥ kuśala dharma parimoṣakaḥ
translated: He thought, 'Alas, this great assembly of enemies has appeared to me, stealing away my wholesome qualities.

original: hanta anapekṣo bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: hanta anapekṣaḥ bhaviṣyāmi
translated: I will be indifferent.'

original: sa tasmin samaye syādyathāpi nāma vadhyaḥ puruṣo dṛṣṭvā na vismayacitta mutpādayati /
analyzed: sa tasmin samaye syāt yathā api nāma vadhyaḥ puruṣaḥ dṛṣṭvā na vismaya cittam utpādayati
translated: At that time, he was like a man who, seeing his executioner, does not arouse thoughts of amazement.

original: evameva puṇyaraśmī rājakumāraḥ tāṃ pramadāṃ dṛṣṭvā na viṣmayati /
analyzed: evam eva puṇyaraśmīḥ rāja kumāraḥ tām pramadām dṛṣṭvā na viṣmayati
translated: In the same way, Prince Puṇyaraśmi, seeing those women, was not amazed.

original: nāpi tatra nagare /
analyzed: na api tatra nagare
translated: Nor was he amazed by the city.

original: na ca sakhībhiṃrvismayati sma /
analyzed: na ca sakhībhiṃḥ vismayati sma
translated: Nor was he amazed by his companions.

original: taiśca daśabhirvarṣairna jātu rūpanimittamudgṛhītavān /
analyzed: taiḥ ca daśabhiḥ varṣaiḥ na jātu rūpa nimittam udgṛhītavān
translated: For those ten years, he never grasped at the sign of form,

original: na śabdanimittaṃ na gandha nimittaṃ na rasanimittaṃ na sparśanimittamudgṛhītavān /
analyzed: na śabda nimittam na gandha nimittam na rasa nimittam na sparśa nimittam udgṛhītavān
translated: never grasped at the sign of sound, smell, taste, or touch.

original: anyatraivaṃrūpaṃ cittaṃ pravartayate sma kadā tāvadevaṃrūpādamitrasaṃghamadhyānmama mokṣo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anyatra evaṃrūpam cittam pravartayate sma kadā tāvat evaṃrūpāt amitra saṃgha madhyāt mama mokṣaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He thought, ‘When will I be liberated from this kind of assembly of enemies?

original: kadāhamapramādacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi yena me mokṣo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kadā aham apramāda caryām cariṣyāmi yena me mokṣaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When will I be able to practice heedfulness so that I can be liberated?’

original: atha khalu tāḥ kanyakāḥ rājño 'rciṣmata ārocayanti sma na deva kumāraḥ krīḍati /
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ kanyakāḥ rājñaḥ rciṣmataḥ ārocayanti sma na deva kumāraḥ krīḍati
translated: “Then the girls said to King Arciṣmān, ‘Your Majesty, the prince does not play,

original: na ramate /
analyzed: na ramate
translated: does not enjoy himself,

original: na paricārayati /
analyzed: na paricārayati
translated: and does not amuse himself.’

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājā arciṣmānaśītibhī rājasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ yena puṇyaraśmī rājakumārastenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājā arciṣmān aśītibhiḥ rāja sahasraiḥ sārdham yena puṇyaraśmīḥ rāja kumāraḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: “Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, King Arciṣmān, together with eighty-thousand kings, approached Prince Puṇyaraśmi.

original: upasaṃkramyāśrumukhaḥ pravepamānena kāyena śocamāno dharaṇitale prapatitaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya aśru mukhaḥ pravepamānena kāyena śocamānaḥ dharaṇi tale prapatitaḥ
translated: Having approached, with tears on his face, his body trembling, sorrowful, he fell to the ground.

original: sa utthāya dharaṇitalātpuṇyaraśmiṃ rājakumāraṃ gāthābhidhyabhāṣata
analyzed: saḥ utthāya dharaṇi talāt puṇyaraśmim rāja kumāram gāthā abhidhyabhāṣata
translated: Having risen from the ground, he spoke to Prince Puṇyaraśmi with these verses:

original: prakṣasva putravararatna mama pralāpaṃ śokārdito nipatito 'smi bhuvi kṣapānte /
analyzed: prakṣasva putra vara ratna mama pralāpam śoka arditaḥ nipatitaḥ smi bhuvi kṣapā ante
translated: “ ‘Son, best of jewels, listen to my lament! At the end of the night, afflicted by sorrow, I fell to the ground.

original: kenāpriyaṃ tava kṛtaṃ mam tadbravīhi jyeṣṭhaṃ dadāmi yadihāsya kṣaṇena daṇḍam // //
analyzed: kena apriyam tava kṛtam mam tat bravīhi jyeṣṭham dadāmi yat iha asya kṣaṇena daṇḍam
translated: By whom was an unpleasant act done to you? Tell me that, and I will immediately mete out punishment to the eldest.’🔽“ ‘Father, I have no enemy, nor is there anyone who has done me an unpleasant act.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: I have no desire for the objects of desire.

original: prekṣasva me 'dya nagaraṃ surasaṃgharamyaṃ manasā mayābhiracittaṃ yadidaṃ tvadarthe /
analyzed: prekṣasva me dya nagaram sura saṃgha ramyam manasā mayā abhiracittam yat idam tvad arthe
translated: Behold my city today, delightful to the assembly of gods, which I have constructed in my mind for your sake.

original: kimihāṅgamadya vikalaṃ mama tadvadāśu śakrasya vādya vibhavaṃ tava darśayāmi // //
analyzed: kim iha aṅgam adya vikalam mama tadvat āśu śakrasya vā adya vibhavam tava darśayāmi  /
translated: What part of it is deficient now? Tell me quickly, and today I will show you the splendor of Shakra.

original: śokārditaṃ kamalalocanacārunetraṃ strīsaṃghamapsarasamaṃ vilapantamīkṣa /
analyzed: śoka arditam kamala locana cāru netram strī saṃgham apsaras amam vilapantam īkṣa
translated: Look at the assembly of women, equal to the celestial nymphs, their beautiful eyes like lotuses, lamenting in sorrow.

original: etābhiranyaiśca ramasva vinīya śokaṃ kiṃ śalyaviddha iva dhyāyasi dīnavakraḥ // //
analyzed: etābhiḥ anyaiḥ ca ramasva vinīya śokam kim śalya viddhaḥ iva dhyāyasi dīna vakraḥ  /
translated: Enjoy yourself with them and others, dispelling your sorrow. Why do you brood like one afflicted by a dart, your face downcast?

original: etāḥ svaraṅgarucirāḥ suratervidhijñāḥ saṃgītitālasamaye ca viniścayajñāḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ sva raṅga rucirāḥ surateḥ vidhi jñāḥ saṃgīti tāla samaye ca viniścaya jñāḥ
translated: These women are skilled in the art of love, their voices sweet, and they know the rules of music and rhythm.

original: kālastavādya suratasya na śocitasya mlānaṃ saroruhamivāsi kimadya dīnaḥ // //
analyzed: kālaḥ tava adya suratasya na śocitasya mlānam saroruham iva asi kim adya dīnaḥ  /
translated: This is the time for love, not for grieving. Why are you downcast today, like a withered lotus?

original: udyānapuṣpaphalapatravikīrṇaśākhā udviddhacitramiva citrarathaṃ surāṇām /
analyzed: udyāna puṣpa phala patra vikīrṇa śākhāḥ udviddha citram iva citraratham surāṇām
translated: The branches of the pleasure garden are strewn with flowers, fruits, and leaves, like the colorful chariot of the gods.

original: saṃcintayasva prathamaṃ hi vayastavedaṃ kālo rate rama ihādya suta prasīda // //
analyzed: saṃcintayasva prathamam hi vayaḥ tava idam kālaḥ rate rame iha adya suta prasīda  /
translated: First consider that this is your youth. The time is now for love and pleasure. Be gracious, my son.

original: tulyā taveyamapi puṣkariṇī surāṇāṃ snānārthamutpalasarojavanābhikīrṇā /
analyzed: tulyā tava iyam api puṣkariṇī surāṇām snāna artham utpala saroja vana abhikīrṇā
translated: This lotus pond is equal to that of the gods, strewn with blue and red lotuses, for bathing.

original: padmāni mattavaraṣaṭpadabhūṣitāni saṃcintya tāṃ ka iha nābhirameta putra // //
analyzed: padmāni matta vara ṣaṭpada bhūṣitāni saṃcintya tām kaḥ iha na abhirameta putra
translated: O son, who would not delight in them, having contemplated on them, except one who is possessed by the demon of greed?

original: haṃsā mayūraśukasārikakokilāśca koṇālajīvakalaviṅka manojñaghoṣāḥ /
analyzed: haṃsāḥ mayūra śuka sārika kokilāḥ ca manojña ghoṣāḥ
translated: Geese, peacocks, parrots, myna birds, cuckoos, and melodious-voiced jīvañjīvakas,

original: gandharvamādana ivā himavatsamīpe śrutvā naraḥ ka iha nātra ratiṃ labheta // //
analyzed: gandharva mādane himavat samīpe śrutvā naraḥ kaḥ iha na atra ratim labheta  /
translated: Having heard them, like in the Gandharvamādana near the Himalayas, what man would not find delight here?

original: etā vimānamaṇicūḍasamuktajālā vaiḍūryakāñcanacitā iva vaijayante /
analyzed: etāḥ vimāna maṇi cūḍa samukta jālāḥ vaiḍūrya kāñcana citāḥ iva vaijayante
translated: These are like the jeweled nets of the Vaijayanta palace, adorned with lapis lazuli and gold,

original: ratnāsanāni ca varāṇi varāstṛtāni cārusvarā kanakakaṅkaṇatālapaṅktyaḥ // //
analyzed: ratna āsanāni ca varāṇi vara āstṛtāni cāru svarā kanaka kaṅkaṇa tāla paṅktyaḥ
translated: With excellent bejeweled seats well-covered, and beautiful-sounding golden bracelets and rows of cymbals.

original: gambhīradhīravaratūryaninādaghuṣṭā vīthīṣu dānavisarāstava cāpi hetoḥ /
analyzed: gambhīra dhīra vara tūrya nināda ghuṣṭāḥ vīthīṣu dāna visarāḥ tava ca api hetoḥ
translated: The streets are filled with the deep and majestic sounds of excellent musical instruments, and for your sake,

original: kanyāḥ sahasrabahugītarutāḥ kriyante śrūyanti nandanavane 'psarasāṃ yathaiva /
analyzed: kanyāḥ sahasra bahu gīta rutāḥ kriyante śrūyanti nandana vane psarasām yathā eva
translated: Thousands of maidens are made to sing in melodious voices, like the celestial nymphs in the Nandana grove.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: O Vaidya!

original: kasmān triviṣṭapasame bhavane manojñe vikṣiptacitta iha kiṃ na ratiṃ karoṣi // //
analyzed: kasmāt triviṣṭapa same bhavane manojñe vikṣipta cittaḥ iha kim na ratim karoṣi  /
translated: Why, in this delightful palace equal to heaven, do you not find delight here with a distracted mind?

original: ete kumāra tava devasamānagarbhāḥ krīḍāsakhāya saha putra ramasva caibhiḥ /
analyzed: ete kumāra tava deva samāna garbhāḥ krīḍā sakhāya saha putra ramasva ca ebhiḥ
translated: O prince, these companions of yours, equal to the gods in birth, play with you, be joyful with them, O son.

original: mātā pitā ca tava saṃsthita sāśrukaṇṭhāḥ kiṃ duḥkha nāsti karuṇā ca jane tavāsmin // //
analyzed: mātā pitā ca tava saṃsthita sa aśru kaṇṭhāḥ kim duḥkha na asti karuṇā ca jane tava asmin  /
translated: Your mother and father are standing there, their throats choked with tears. Do you have no sorrow or compassion for them?

original: so 'thābravīdguṇacito bhavadoṣadarśī nirviṇṇa saṃskṛtamanarthika kāmabhogaiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ thā bravīt guṇa citaḥ bhava doṣa darśī nirviṇṇa saṃskṛtam anarthika kāma bhogaiḥ
translated: He replied, I am disgusted with the world, seeking liberation, and have no use for sensual pleasures. I see the faults of existence and am intent on virtues.

original: saṃsārapañcaragataṃ jagadīkṣyaṃ cedaṃ mokṣārthikaḥ pitaramāha śṛṇuṣva deva // //
analyzed: saṃsāra pañcara gatam jagat īkṣyam ca idam mokṣa arthikaḥ pitaram āha śṛṇuṣva deva
translated: Seeing the world caught in the five fetters, he said to his father, 'Listen, Your Majesty, I seek liberation.'

original: devāpriyaṃ mam kṛtaṃ na hi kenacinme kiṃ tvasti me 'dya na hi kāmaguṇeṣu chandaḥ /
analyzed: deva apriyam mam kṛtam na hi kenacid me kim tu asti me na hi kāma guṇeṣu chandaḥ
translated: No one has done anything displeasing to me. But now I have no desire for sensual pleasures.

original: sarve priyāṃ ripusamā hi nirānuraktā ye kleśadurgatiprapāta prapātayanti // //
analyzed: sarve priyām ripu samāḥ hi nirānuraktāḥ ye kleśa durgati prapāta prapātayanti
translated: All beloved ones are like enemies, without affection, who cause one to fall into afflictions, bad rebirths, and precipices.

original: etāḥ striyo hyabudhabālajanābhirāmā mārasya pāśaguṇabaddha mahāprapātāḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ striyaḥ hi abudha bāla jana abhirāmāḥ mārasya mahā prapātāḥ
translated: These women are pleasing to the ignorant and childish, but are the snares and qualities of Mara, great precipices.

original: nityaṃ tathā vigarhita āryajanena caitāḥ sevāmi kiṃ narakadurgatiśokamūlāḥ // //
analyzed: nityam tathā vigarhitaḥ ārya janena ca etāḥ sevāmi kim naraka durgati śoka mūlāḥ
translated: The noble ones always criticize them in this way. Why should I serve the roots of hell, bad rebirths, and sorrow?

original: etāḥ striyo hi chavimātrakarūparabhyāḥ snāyvasthiyantramaśucībhi nirarthako 'ham /
analyzed: etāḥ striyaḥ hi chavi mātraka rūpa rabhyāḥ snāyu asthi yantram aśucībhiḥ nirarthakaḥ ham
translated: These women are only attached to mere skin, flesh, and form. It is meaningless for me to be attached to the impure machine of sinews and bones.

original: prasrāviṇī rudhiramūtraśakṛnmalānāṃ vyaktaṃ śmaśānasadṛśīṣu kathaṃ rameyam // //
analyzed: prasrāviṇī rudhira mūtra śakṛt malānām vyaktam śmaśāna sadṛśīṣu katham rameyam  /
translated: Leaking blood, urine, and feces, how could I find pleasure in these bodies that are clearly like charnel grounds?

original: gītaṃ na śroṣyamapi vādyarutaṃ na grāhyaṃ svapnāya mābhiratayo 'budhamohanāśca /
analyzed: gītam na śroṣyam api vādya rutam na grāhyam svapnāya mā abhiratayaḥ budha mohanāḥ ca
translated: I will not listen to singing, nor accept the sound of musical instruments, nor be attached to dreams, which are the delusion of the ignorant.

original: saṃkalpalālasa gatā abudhā tu nāśaṃ kiṃ kleśadāsa iva bālajano bhaviṣye // //
analyzed: saṃkalpa lālasa gatā abudhā tu nāśam kim kleśa dāsaḥ iva bāla janaḥ bhaviṣye  /
translated: The ignorant who are attached to the desires of imagination are destroyed. Why should I be like an ordinary person, a slave to afflictions?

original: sarve ime drumalatā śiśire pravṛtte kāntāravṛkṣasadṛśā hi bhavantyaramyāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ime śiśire pravṛtte kāntāra vṛkṣa sadṛśāḥ hi bhavanti aramyāḥ
translated: All these trees and vines, when winter arrives, become like trees in the wilderness, unappealing.

original: sarvaśriyo vidhamanī hi anityateyaṃ mohātpramādamupayāmi cale tu jīve // //
analyzed: sarva śriyaḥ vidhamanī hi anitya tā iyam mohāt pramādam upayāmi cale tu jīve
translated: This impermanence destroys all beauty. Out of delusion, I am heedless, while life is fleeting.

original: cittaṃ samudra iva tarpayituṃ na śakyaṃ tṛṣṇāpravṛttinirataḥ punareva kāṅkṣa /🔽Vaidya / RP
analyzed: cittam samudraḥ iva tarpayitum na śakyam tṛṣṇā pravṛtti nirataḥ punar eva kāṅkṣa  vaidya rp
translated: The mind is like an ocean, incapable of being satisfied. Attached to the activity of craving, it desires again.

original: anyonyaghāti jagadīkṣya hi kāmahetoḥ meruryathaiva pavanairahamaprampyaḥ // //
analyzed: anyonya ghāti jagat īkṣya hi kāma hetoḥ meruḥ yathā eva pavanaiḥ aham aprampyaḥ
translated: The world is seen to kill each other for the sake of desire. Like Mount Meru, I am unmoved by this.

original: na tvaṃ pitā na sahajā mama nāpi bhāryāḥ trātā na bāndhavajanā nṛpate hmapāyāt /
analyzed: na tvam pitā na sahajāḥ mama nā api bhāryāḥ trātā na bāndhava janāḥ nṛpate hmapāyāt
translated: You are not my father, nor my co-born, nor my wife. O King, the relatives are not my protectors from misfortune.

original: sarve vayaṃ tṛṇagatā iva bindulekhā mā tāta cittavaśagā bhavatāṃ pramattāḥ // //
analyzed: sarve vayam tṛṇa gatāḥ iva bindulekhāḥ mā tāta citta vaśa gāḥ bhavatām pramattāḥ  /
translated: We are all like a drop of dew on a blade of grass. Do not be heedless, my dear, do not come under the sway of the mind.

original: dhigyauvanena manujeśvara yanna nityaṃ dhigjīvitasya gamanaṃ giritoyaśīghram /
analyzed: dhik yauvanena manuja īśvara yat na nityam dhik jīvitasya gamanam giri toya śīghram
translated: Fie on youth, O Lord of Men, that it is not eternal. Fie on the swift passing of life, like a mountain stream.

original: dhiksaṃskṛtaṃ kṣayamidaṃ taḍidabhralolaṃ dhikkaṇḍitasya tribhave nṛpa kāmarāgaḥ // //
analyzed: dhik saṃskṛtam kṣayam idam taḍit abhra lolam dhik kaṇḍitasya tri bhave nṛpa kāma rāgaḥ  /
translated: Fie on this conditioned existence, which is fleeting like lightning or a cloud. Fie on the attachment to sensual pleasures in the three realms, O King.

original: saṃcodito 'smi vibudhairbhava apramatto no bodhisattva bhavate viṣayābhilagnaḥ /
analyzed: saṃcoditaḥ smi vibudhaiḥ bhava apramattaḥ naḥ bodhisattva bhavate viṣaya abhilagnaḥ
translated: I am exhorted by the gods: 'Be heedful, do not become attached to objects, O Bodhisattva.

original: buddho bhaveyamiha lokahitānukampī nāsti pramādacaritasya narendra bodhiḥ // //
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhaveyam iha loka hita anukampī na asti pramāda caritasya narendra bodhiḥ
translated: I should become a Buddha, compassionate for the welfare of the world. There is no enlightenment for one who acts heedlessly, O Lord of Men.'

original: kāmāturo bhavati yo nṛpa cittadāsaḥ sa hi puṇyanāśanirato vinivṛttasvargaḥ /
analyzed: kāma āturaḥ bhavati yaḥ nṛpa citta dāsaḥ sa hi puṇya nāśa nirataḥ vinivṛtta svargaḥ
translated: One who is afflicted by desire, O King, a slave to the mind, delights in destroying merit and turns away from heaven.

original: hiṃsāsamiddhamapi nābhicareta jātu pakṣīva pañjaragataḥ kathamāśvaseta // //
analyzed: hiṃsā samiddham api na abhicareta jātu pakṣī iva pañjara gataḥ katham āśvaseta  /
translated: One should never engage in violence, even if it leads to prosperity. How can one trust, like a bird caught in a cage?

original: dhātūśca sarpasadṛśā vadhakāśca skandhāḥ cittaṃ ca sāsravamanarthaka śūnya grāmaḥ /
analyzed: dhātūḥ ca sarpa sadṛśāḥ vadhakāḥ ca skandhāḥ cittam ca sa āsravam anarthaka śūnya grāmaḥ
translated: The elements are like snakes, the aggregates are like murderers, the defiled mind is useless, like an empty village,

original: viṣastambapuṣpita iveha narendra kāyaḥ oghe 'tiruhyati kathaṃ nu ratirmamātra // //
analyzed: viṣa stamba puṣpitaḥ iva iha narendra kāyaḥ oghe tiruhyati katham nu ratiḥ mama atra
translated: The body of a king here is like a poisonous tree in bloom. How can I find pleasure when it grows in the flood?

original: saṃprekṣase jagadidaṃ kugatiprapannaṃ vyaktaṃ padaṃ gaganatulyamapi jvalantam /
analyzed: saṃprekṣase jagat idam kugati prapannam vyaktam padam gagana tulyam api jvalantam
translated: You see this world fallen into bad destinies, clearly manifest, blazing like the sky.

original: teṣāṃ pramokṣaṇanimittamihādya rājan śivadharmanāva samudānayitāsmi śīghram // //
analyzed: teṣām pramokṣaṇa nimittam iha adya rājan śiva dharma nāva samudānayitāsmi śīghram
translated: For their liberation, O king, I will quickly gather the ship of the auspicious Dharma here.

original: suptān vibodhayitumātura jīvitārthaṃ śalya nimūlayitumutpathagān vinetum /
analyzed: suptān vibodhayitum ātura jīvita artham śalya nimūlayitum utpathagān vinetum
translated: To awaken the sleeping, to save the sick, to uproot the dart, to guide those on wrong paths,

original: prod ghuṣya bandhanabimokṣa mahāsahasre saṃtarpayaṃściradaridra subhāṣitena // //
analyzed: pra ud ghuṣya bandhana bimokṣa mahā sahasre saṃtarpayan cira daridra subhāṣitena
translated: Having proclaimed the great liberation of the bound, I will satisfy the long-needy with good speech.

original: sīdanta durgatipathādapi coddhariṣye andhe cakṣurapi tṛṣṇalatāviśoṣī /
analyzed: sīdanta durgati pathāt api ca uddhariṣye andhe cakṣuḥ api tṛṣṇa latā viśoṣī
translated: I will also lift up those sinking from the path of bad destinies, give eyes to the blind, and dry up the creeper of craving.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: The eye-doctor,

original: prajñārciruttamavimuktikṛtapradīpo drakṣanti yena tribhavaṃ naṭaraṅgakalpam // //
analyzed: prajñā arciḥ uttama vimukti kṛta pradīpaḥ drakṣanti yena tri bhavam naṭa raṅga kalpam
translated: The lamp of supreme liberation made by the flame of wisdom, by which they will see the three worlds as like an actor's stage.

original: meghaṃ kṛpākaruṇapāramitābhrakūṭaṃ sattvārthagarjita vipaśyanavidyumālī /
analyzed: megham kṛpā karuṇa pāramitā abhra kūṭam sattva artha garjita vipaśyana vidyu mālī
translated: The cloud of compassion and the peak of the perfection of compassion, thundering for the sake of beings, garlanded with the lightning of insight,

original: bodhyaṅgadhārasukhaśītalavṛṣṭijālaiḥ śītīkaromi ca jagaccirakālataptam // //
analyzed: bodhyaṅga dhāra sukha śītala vṛṣṭi jālaiḥ śītīkaromi ca jagat cira kāla taptam
translated: With the cool rain of the bliss-giving qualities of the factors of awakening, I will cool the world, which has been burning for a long time.

original: etatsmarannahamiha kṣitiśopaviṣṭo nāstīha me praṇidhi saṃskṛtasarvakāmaiḥ /
analyzed: etat smaran aham iha kṣitiśa upaviṣṭaḥ na asti iha me saṃskṛta sarva kāmaiḥ
translated: Remembering this, I sit here on the ground, I have no aspiration for all the desires of the conditioned world.

original: bodhyarthiko hi vicarāmiha sattvahetoḥ ekāṃśiko na hi bhavābhiratau mamecchā // //
analyzed: bodhyarthikaḥ hi vicarām iha sattva hetoḥ ekāṃśikaḥ na hi bhava abhiratau mama icchā
translated: I wander here seeking awakening for the sake of beings, one-pointed, not desiring to delight in existence.

original: jānan vasetka iha pārthiva śatrumadhye ko buddhimān sabhayamārgapathaṃ vrajeta /
analyzed: jānan vaset kaḥ iha pārthiva śatru madhye kaḥ buddhimān sa bhaya mārga patham vrajeta
translated: O King, who would knowingly stay in the midst of enemies here? What wise person would travel on a dangerous path?

original: ko vā sacakṣuriha tāta patetprapāte ko bodhimārgamadhigamya bhavetpramattaḥ // //
analyzed: kaḥ vā sa cakṣuḥ iha tāta patet prapāte kaḥ bodhi mārgam adhigamya bhavet pramattaḥ  /
translated: What person with eyes, O father, would fall into a pit here? Who, having attained the path to awakening, would be heedless?

original: anusrota sarvajagatī pratisrotā so 'haṃ vācā na śakyamiha pārthiva bodhi prāptum /
analyzed: anusrota sarva jagatī pratisrotā saḥ ham vācā na śakyam iha pārthiva bodhi prāptum
translated: While the whole world flows downstream, I flow upstream. O King, awakening cannot be attained here by speech.

original: meruprayātamapi sāgaramutsaheyaṃ na tveva me mana ihābhirameta kāmaiḥ // //
analyzed: meru prayātam api sāgaram utsaheyam na tu eva me manaḥ iha abhirameta kāmaiḥ
translated: I would dare to cross the ocean, even if it were as vast as Mount Meru, but my mind would not delight in sensual pleasures here.

original: gacchāśu pārthiva varasvajanena sārdhaṃ sarvāṃ hi rāṣṭraratimutsṛja sarvaloke /
analyzed: gaccha āśu pārthiva vara sva janena sārdham sarvām hi rāṣṭra ratim utsṛja sarva loke
translated: Go quickly, O King, together with your excellent relatives. Abandon all the pleasures of the kingdom and the world.

original: ādāya gacchatu yathābhimataṃ hi yasya gṛhyāpramāda mama tāta na rājyakoṭyā // //🔽śakyā na nārigaṇamadhyagatena bodhiḥ prāptuṃ śivaṃ padamanuttarayogakṣemam /🔽gacchāmyahaṃ girivanāntaramāśrayāmi prāptā hyaraṇyaniratena jinena bodhiḥ // //🔽atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumāraḥ prāsādatalagata eva tābhiḥ pramadābhiḥ sārdhaṃ caṃkramannudvignamanāḥ saṃstribhirīryāpathairviharati🔽katamaistribhiḥ /🔽sthānena caṃkrameṇa niṣadyayā /🔽styānamiddhaparivarjitaḥ upariprāsādatalagato 'ṣṭamyāṃ bhūmau sthitaḥ /🔽so 'rdharātrakālasamaye aśroṣīt antarīkṣācchuddhāvāsakāyikā devatā buddhasya varṇaṃ bhāṣamāṇā gacchanti /
analyzed: ādāya gacchatu yathā abhimatam hi yasya gṛhya apramāda mama tāta na rājya koṭyā  śakyā na nāri gaṇa madhya gatena bodhiḥ prāptum śivam padam anuttara yogakṣemam  gacchāmi aham giri vana antaram āśrayāmi prāptā hi araṇya niratena jinena bodhiḥ  atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ prāsāda tala gataḥ eva tābhiḥ pramadābhiḥ sārdham caṃkraman udvigna manāḥ san tribhiḥ īryāpathaiḥ viharati  katamaiḥ tribhiḥ  sthānena caṃkrameṇa niṣadyayā  styāna middha parivarjitaḥ upari prāsāda tala gataḥ ṣṭamyām bhūmau sthitaḥ  saḥ ṛdharātra kāla samaye aśroṣīt antarīkṣāt śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devatāḥ buddhasya varṇam bhāṣamāṇāḥ gacchanti
translated: Taking it, may he go as he wishes. O father, I am not interested in a kingdom, even for the sake of a hundred sons.”

original: vistareṇa dharmasya saṃghasya varṇaṃ bhāṣamāṇā gacchanti /
analyzed: vistareṇa dharmasya saṃghasya varṇam bhāṣamāṇāḥ gacchanti
translated: They go, praising the Dharma and the Saṅgha in detail.

original: śrutvā ca rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumāraḥ saṃhṛṣṭaromakūpajātaḥ aśru nipātayati /
analyzed: śrutvā ca rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ saṃhṛṣṭa romakūpa jātaḥ aśru nipātayati
translated: Having heard this, Rāṣṭrapāla, young prince Puṇyaraśmi's pores bristled with joy and he shed tears.

original: sa saṃvegajāto 'ñjaliṃ kṛtvā tāṃ devatāṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata 🔽Vaidya / RP
analyzed: sa saṃvega jātaḥ ñjalim kṛtvā tām devatām gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata  vaidya rp
translated: With a mind filled with awe, he joined his palms and addressed the gods in verse:

original: mayi karuṇa janitvā devatā duḥkhite 'smin yadi na kuruta manyuṃ kiṃcidevābhipṛcche /
analyzed: mayi karuṇa janitvā devatāḥ duḥkhite smin yadi na kuruta manyum kiṃcid eva abhipṛcche
translated: O gods, having generated compassion for me, who am suffering, if you do not feel any anger, I will ask you something.

original: kasya guṇa vadanto gacchetātrāntarīkṣe sukhitamiha mano me vākyametaṃ niśāmya // //
analyzed: kasya guṇa vadantaḥ gaccheta atra antarīkṣe sukhitam iha manaḥ me vākyam etam niśāmya  /
translated: Whose qualities are you proclaiming as you travel through the sky? My mind is joyful upon hearing these words.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla tā devatāḥ puṇyaraśmirājakumāraṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣanta
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla tāḥ devatāḥ puṇyaraśmi rāja kumāram gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣanta
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, those gods addressed young prince Puṇyaraśmi in verse:

original: śravaṇamupagataste kiṃ na buddhaḥ kumāra śaraṇamaśaraṇānāṃ nāma siddhārthabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: śravaṇam upagataḥ te kim na buddhaḥ kumāra śaraṇam aśaraṇānām nāma siddhārtha buddhiḥ
translated: O prince, have you not heard of the Buddha named Siddhārthabuddhi, the refuge of those without a refuge?

original: paracarikuśalo 'sau puṇyaprajñāguṇaḍhyo daśaniyutasahasrādhyāyināṃ tasya saṃghaḥ // //
analyzed: para cari kuśalaḥ sau puṇya prajñā guṇa ḍhyaḥ daśa niyuta sahasra adhyāyinām tasya saṃghaḥ
translated: He is skilled in the conduct of others, rich in the qualities of merit and wisdom, and his saṅgha consists of ten nayuta-thousand students.

original: puṇyarasmirāha
analyzed: puṇyarasmiḥ āha
translated: Puṇyaraśmi said:

original: ahamapi jina dṛkṣye kīdṛśaṃ tasya rūpaṃ vadata api ca sarve kīdṛśo cāsya varṇaḥ /
analyzed: aham api jina dṛkṣye kīdṛśam tasya rūpam api ca sarve ca asya varṇaḥ
translated: I too wish to see the Victorious One. What is his appearance like? Tell me, and all of you, what is his color like?

original: ahamapi paripṛcche kīdṛśī bodhicaryā bhavati yatha caran vai sarvasattvaikanāthaḥ // //
analyzed: aham api paripṛcche kīdṛśī bodhi caryā bhavati caran vai sarva sattva eka nāthaḥ
translated: I also ask, what is the practice of enlightenment like, and how does one act as the sole protector of all beings?

original: atha khalu tā devatāḥ puṇyaraśmiṃ rājakumāraṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣanta 🔽snugdharucikeśā dakṣiṇāvartajātā giritatamiva haima śobhate cāsya coṣṇi /🔽gagana iva ca śūnyo bhāsate cāsya ūrṇā sphaṭikamaṇiviśuddhā dakṣiṇā nābhi jātā // //
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ devatāḥ puṇyaraśmim rāja kumāram gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣanta  snugdha ruci keśā dakṣiṇa āvarta jātā giri tatam iva haima śobhate ca asya ca uṣṇi  gagane iva ca śūnyaḥ bhāsate ca asya ūrṇā sphaṭika maṇi viśuddhā dakṣiṇā nābhi jātā  /
translated: Then those goddesses spoke these verses to Prince Puṇyaraśmi:🔽His hair is soft and lovely, curling to the right, and shines like a golden mountain peak.🔽And his ūrṇā, like the sky, shines forth, his navel on the right is pure like a crystal gem.

original: bhramaragaṇaviśuddhā netra nīlotpalābhā siṃhahanu narendrao bimba oṣṭhaḥ svayaṃbhūḥ /
analyzed: bhramara gaṇa viśuddhā nīlotpala ābhā siṃha hanu bimbaḥ oṣṭhaḥ svayaṃbhūḥ
translated: His eyes are like blue lotuses, pure like a swarm of bees. The Self-Existent One has the jaw of a lion, his lips are like bimba fruit.

original: sṛjati ca sahasraṃ vai raśmikoṭīranantān sphurati ca trisahasrān durgatīḥ śoṣayaṃśca // //🔽samasahitasuvṛttā danta citra suśuklā himarajataviśuddhā viṃśati dveguṇāsya /
analyzed: sṛjati ca sahasram vai raśmi koṭīḥ anantān sphurati ca tri sahasrān durgatīḥ śoṣayan ca  / sama sahita su vṛttā hima rajata viśuddhā
translated: He emits thousands of endless millions of light rays, and shines throughout the trichiliocosm, drying up the lower realms.🔽His teeth are even, well-rounded, variegated, and very white, pure like snow and silver, twenty-four in number, twice as many as others.

original: jinavarapravarasya tasya daṃṣṭrāścatasraḥ svakamukhapraticchādā tasya jihvā prabhūtā // //
analyzed: jinavara pravarasya tasya daṃṣṭrāḥ catasraḥ svaka mukha praticchādā tasya jihvā prabhūtā  /
translated: The four fangs of that supreme Victor are pure, and his tongue, which covers his face, is large.

original: giri varasahitārthā tasya pralhādanīyā sahita akuṭilā ca bramhaghoṣā suyuktā /
analyzed: tasya
translated: His speech is like the sound of Brahmā, well-formed, pleasant, and not crooked, bringing joy to the best of mountains.

original: tūryaśatasahasrairvāgjinasyārhatulyā vimatiśamakarī sā toṣaṇī arthikānām // //🔽Vaidya / RP
analyzed: tūrya śata sahasraiḥ vāc jinasya arha tulyā vimati śama karī sā toṣaṇī arthikānām  vaidya rp
translated: The speech of the Victorious One, equal to the Arhats, accompanied by hundreds of thousands of musical instruments, pacifies doubts and satisfies those in need.

original: avikalaguṇacitrā bodhi aṅgānukūlā hāraśatasahasrā gumphitā dharmamālā /
analyzed: avikala guṇa citrā aṅga anukūlā hāra śata sahasrā gumphitā dharma mālā
translated: The speech of the Victorious One is delightful, adorned with unbroken qualities, conducive to the factors of enlightenment, a garland of Dharma strung with hundreds of thousands of pearls.

original: tūryarativighuṣṭā devatāgītaramyā amararucisvarā vai hlādanī vāgjinasya // //
analyzed: tūrya rati vighuṣṭā devatā gīta ramyā amara ruci svarā vai hlādanī vāc jinasya
translated: Praised by musical instruments and delightful like the songs of gods, with a voice captivating like that of the immortals, the speech of the Victorious One is delightful.

original: kīnnarakalaviṅkākokilācakravākā barhiṇakalahaṃsāghoṣa konālakānām /
analyzed: kīnnara kalaviṅkā kokilā cakravākāḥ barhiṇa kalahaṃsa āghoṣa konālakānām
translated: The voice of the Victorious One is like the sounds of kinnaras, kalaviṅka birds, cuckoos, ruddy geese, peacocks, swans, and koināla birds.

original: bramharutanirghoṣā kinnarāṇāṃ svarāṅgā akhalitamanavadyā sarvārthānubodhā // //🔽citrasphaṭikaślakṣṇā paṇḍitānāṃ manāpā codanī vinayanīyā bodhanī premaṇīyā /
analyzed: bramha ruta nirghoṣā kinnarāṇām svara aṅgā akhalita manavadyā sarva artha anubodhā  citra sphaṭika ślakṣṇā paṇḍitānām manāpā codanī vinayanīyā bodhanī premaṇīyā
translated: With the voice of Brahmā, the sounds of the kinnaras, without faltering or fault, it understands all meanings.🔽The speech of the Lord of Dharma is colorful, clear, smooth, pleasing to the wise, instructive, disciplined, enlightening, and endearing.

original: paracarimanakūlā toṣaṇī pṛcchamānā imaguṇa vacanā caitasya dharmeśvarasya // //
analyzed: toṣaṇī ca etasya dharma īśvarasya
translated: Not disagreeable to others, satisfying to those who ask, it possesses these qualities.

original: kamburucira grīvā śāntasaṃvṛttaskandhaḥ /
translated: His neck is beautiful like a conch, his shoulders are well-rounded and peaceful.

original: dīrghaparigha bāhū tasya saptotsadāṅgam /
analyzed: bāhū tasya sapta utsada aṅgam
translated: His arms are long like iron rods, he has seven prominent body parts.

original: kara rucirasuvṛttā dirghavṛttāṅgulīkāḥ tapitakanakavarṇaṃ tasya gātraṃ jinasya // //🔽roma pariṇatāśca dakṣiṇo caikajātā nābhi nikhila durgā guhyakośo hayo vā /🔽ūru gajakaro vā eṇajaṅghaḥ svayaṃbhūḥ karatala suvicitrā svastikāścakracitrāḥ // //
analyzed: kara rucira su vṛttāḥ dirgha vṛtta aṅgulīkāḥ tapita kanaka varṇam tasya gātram jinasya  / ca eka jātāḥ guhya kośaḥ hayaḥ vā  svayaṃbhūḥ svastikāḥ cakra citrāḥ
translated: His fingers are beautiful, well-rounded, long, and round, and his body has the color of refined gold.🔽His body hair is curled, growing singly in each pore, and his navel is deep and his secret part is like that of a horse.🔽His thighs are like the trunk of an elephant, and his calves are like those of an antelope. His palms are beautifully adorned with svastikas and wheels.

original: gajapatigatigāmī siṃhavikrāntagāmī vṛṣabhalalitagāmī indrayaṣṭipravṛddhaḥ /
translated: He walks with the gait of a lordly elephant, with the stride of a lion, and with the graceful gait of a bull. He is straight like a pillar of Indra.

original: gaganakusumavṛṣṭiḥ puṣpachatrā bhavanti vrajatimanuvrajanti dharma ete 'dbhutasya // //
analyzed: gagana kusuma vṛṣṭiḥ puṣpa chatrāḥ bhavanti vrajatim anuvrajanti dharmaḥ ete dbhutasya  /
translated: Flowers rain from the sky, and flower parasols appear. These are the marvelous signs that follow the one who goes forth.

original: lābha atha alābhe saukhyaduḥkhe jinasya ayaśasi yaśa evaṃ nindaśaṃsāsu caivam /
analyzed: saukhya duḥkhe jinasya ayaśasi yaśaḥ evam ninda śaṃsāsu ca evam
translated: The Victorious One is not affected by gain or loss, pleasure or pain, fame or disrepute, praise or blame.

original: jalaruhamiva toyaiḥ sarvato nopaliptaḥ evamiha nṛsiṃho nāsti sattvaḥ samo 'sya // //
analyzed: jalaruham iva toyaiḥ sarvatas na upaliptaḥ evam iha nṛsiṃhaḥ na asti sattvaḥ
translated: Like a lotus is not stuck to water, there is no being equal to him in this world, O Lion among Men.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumāraḥ buddhasya varṇaṃ śrutvā /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ buddhasya varṇam śrutvā
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, the young prince Puṇyaraśmi, having heard the praise of the Buddha,

original: vistareṇa dharmasya saṃghasya varṇaṃ śrutvā /
analyzed: vistareṇa dharmasya saṃghasya varṇam śrutvā
translated: and having heard in detail the praise of the Dharma and the Saṅgha,

original: tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto 'bhūt /
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhūt
translated: He was satisfied, elated, delighted, joyful, and happy.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṣparaśme rājakumārasyaitadabhavat yādṛśaḥ saṃbudho bhagavān /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṣparaśme rāja kumārasya etat abhavat yādṛśaḥ saṃbudhaḥ bhagavān
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, the young prince Puṣpāya thought: “What is the Buddha, the Blessed One, like?

original: yādṛśī cāsya saṃghasaṃpat /
analyzed: yādṛśī ca asya saṃgha saṃpad
translated: What is his perfect Saṅgha like?

original: yādṛśaśca tena dharmaḥ sākṣātkṛtaḥ /🔽yādṛśī cāsya śiṣyasaṃpat /🔽yathā viṣayasamavadhānaśca Vaidya / RP
analyzed: yādṛśaḥ ca tena dharmaḥ sākṣātkṛtaḥ  yādṛśī ca asya śiṣya saṃpad  yathā viṣaya samavadhānaḥ ca
translated: What is the Dharma that he has realized like?🔽What is his perfect assembly of disciples like?🔽How is the world like a doctor?

original: saṃsāraḥ / yathākṛtajñaśca saṃsāraḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāraḥ yathā akṛtajñaḥ ca saṃsāraḥ
translated: How is the world like one who is grateful?

original: yathākṝtajñāśca bālapṛthagjanāḥ /🔽yathā viṣamā ca satkāyadṛṣṭiḥ /
analyzed: yathā kṝtajñāḥ ca bāla pṛthagjanāḥ  yathā viṣamā ca sat kāya dṛṣṭiḥ
translated: How are foolish ordinary beings like those who are grateful?🔽How is the view of the transitory collection like a steep cliff?

original: yathā bahvādīnavaśca gṛhāvāsaḥ /
analyzed: yathā bahu ādīnavaḥ ca gṛha āvāsaḥ
translated: How is living in a home like having many disadvantages?

original: yathā bahudoṣāśca kāmāḥ /🔽yathā garhitaśca paṇḍitaiḥ pramādaḥ /
analyzed: yathā bahu doṣāḥ ca kāmāḥ  yathā garhitaḥ ca paṇḍitaiḥ pramādaḥ
translated: How are desires like having many faults?🔽How is heedlessness like being despised by the wise?

original: yathā saṃmohaṃ cāvidyāndhakāram /🔽yathā duḥprativedhāśca saṃskārāḥ /🔽yathā durdamaṃ citram /
analyzed: yathā saṃmoham ca avidyā andhakāram  yathā duṣprativedhāḥ ca saṃskārāḥ  yathā durdamam citram
translated: How is ignorance and darkness like being confused?🔽How are formations like what is difficult to penetrate?

original: yathā gambhīraṃ nāmarūpam /
analyzed: yathā gambhīram nāma rūpam
translated: How is name-and-form like what is difficult to tame?

original: yathānāsvādaṃ ṣaḍāyatanam /
analyzed: yathānāsvādam ṣaṣ āyatanam
translated: How are the six sense bases like what is not to be savored?

original: yathā duḥkhavipākaścāparijñātaḥ sparśaḥ /
analyzed: yathā duḥkha vipākaḥ ca aparijñātaḥ sparśaḥ
translated: How is contact, when not fully understood, like having a painful ripening?

original: yathā bahvādīnavā vedanāḥ /
analyzed: yathā bahu ādīnavāḥ vedanāḥ
translated: How are feelings like having many disadvantages?

original: yathā gāḍhabandhanā tṛṣṇā /
analyzed: yathā gāḍha bandhanā tṛṣṇā
translated: Like the deep bondage of craving.

original: yathā duḥpratiniḥsaraṇaṃ copādānam /
analyzed: yathā duṣ pratiniḥsaraṇam ca upādānam
translated: Like the difficulty of escape from grasping.

original: yathānāryā bhavatṛṣṇā /
analyzed: yathā anāryā bhava tṛṣṇā
translated: Like the ignoble craving for existence.

original: bhave sati yathā duḥkhasamucchedyā ca jātiḥ /🔽yathā vikārakarī ca jarā /
analyzed: bhave sati yathā duḥkha samucchedyā ca jātiḥ  yathā vikāra karī ca jarā
translated: When there is existence, like the birth that is difficult to end.🔽Like the aging that causes change.

original: yathā vilopakārakaśca vyādhiḥ /
analyzed: yathā vilopa kārakaḥ ca vyādhiḥ
translated: Like the disease that causes destruction.

original: yathā niruvuraktaṃ ca maraṇam /
analyzed: yathā ca maraṇam
translated: Like the death that is so painful.

original: yathālpāsvādā ca pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: yathā alpa āsvādā ca pravṛttiḥ
translated: Like the engagement that has little taste.

original: yathā bahvādīnavā ca bhavābhinirvṛttiḥ /
analyzed: yathā bahu ādīnavā ca bhava abhinirvṛttiḥ
translated: Like the manifestation of existence that has many dangers.

original: yathā ramaṇīyaṃ ca tathāgataśāsanam /
analyzed: yathā ramaṇīyam ca tathāgata śāsanam
translated: And like the delightful teaching of the Tathāgata.

original: nedaṃ śakyaṃ kāmadāsena kleśasaṃmohitena cittakhilena pramādābhiratena bālamadhyagatenāyoniśaścittena
analyzed: na idam śakyam kāma dāsena kleśa saṃmohitena citta khilena pramāda abhiratena bāla madhya gatena ayoniśas cittena
translated: This cannot be done by one who is a slave to desire, deluded by afflictions, with a rough mind, delighting in negligence, fallen into the midst of fools, with an improper mind,

original: saṃsāraraktacittena durjanamadhyagatena na śakyaṃ sugatipanthānamapi viśodhayituṃ
analyzed: saṃsāra rakta cittena durjana madhya gatena na śakyam sugati panthānam api viśodhayitum
translated: with a mind attached to saṃsāra, fallen into the midst of bad people, one cannot even purify the path to a good rebirth,

original: kutaḥ punaranuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhum /🔽tasyaitadabhūt yannvahamita eva prāsādātprāṅbhukhaḥ prapateyam /
analyzed: kutas punar anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum  tasya etat abhūt yat nu aham itas eva prāsādāt prāc bhukhaḥ prapateyam
translated: let alone fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.🔽He thought, Let me fall from this very palace, facing east.

original: mā me dvāreṇa niṣkramato jñātisaṃgho 'ntarāyaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: mā me dvāreṇa niṣkramataḥ jñāti saṃghaḥ ntarāyam kuryāt
translated: May the assembly of relatives not create an obstacle for me as I leave through the door.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumāro yena bhagavān siddhārthabuddhisthathāgatastanmukhastataḥ prāsādādātmānamutsṛṣṭavān /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ yena bhagavān siddhārtha buddhi sthathāgataḥ tad mukhaḥ tatas prāsādāt ātmānam utsṛṣṭavān
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, young prince Puṇyaraśmi threw himself from the palace to the place where the Tathāgata Siddhārthabuddhi was.

original: evaṃ ca bhāṣate sma sacetsa tathāgataḥ sarvaṃ jānāti sarvaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: evam ca bhāṣate sma saced sa tathāgataḥ sarvam jānāti sarvam paśyati
translated: And he said this: ‘If that Tathāgata knows everything and sees everything,

original: samanvāharatu māṃ tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: samanvāharatu mām tathāgataḥ
translated: may the Tathāgata pay attention to me!’

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla siddhārthabuddhistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho dakṣiṇapāṇiṃ prasārya prabhāṃ prāmuñcat /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla siddhārthabuddhiḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dakṣiṇa pāṇim prasārya prabhām prāmuñcat
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha Siddhārthabuddhi extended his right hand and emitted light,

original: yayā puṇyaraśmi rājakumāraḥ spṛṣṭo 'bhūt /🔽tasyāśca prabhāyāḥ śatasahasrapatraṃ padmaṃ śakaṭacakrapramāṇamātraṃ prādurbhūtam /
analyzed: yayā puṇyaraśmi rāja kumāraḥ spṛṣṭaḥ bhūt  tasyāḥ ca prabhāyāḥ śata sahasra patram padmam śakaṭa cakra pramāṇa mātram prādurbhūtam
translated: by which the young prince Puṇyaraśmi was touched.🔽And from that light there appeared a lotus with a hundred thousand petals, the size of a chariot wheel.

original: tasmācca padmāt raśmiśatasahasrāṇi niścaranti sma /
analyzed: tasmāt ca padmāt raśmi śata sahasrāṇi niścaranti sma
translated: And from that lotus there emerged a hundred thousand light rays,

original: mahāṃścāvabhāso 'bhūt /
analyzed: mahān ca avabhāsaḥ bhūt
translated: and there was a great radiance,

original: yenāvabhāsena puṇyaraśmī rājakumāraḥ sphuṭo 'bhūt /
analyzed: yena avabhāsena puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ sphuṭaḥ bhūt
translated: by which the young prince Puṇyaraśmi was filled with light.

original: aht khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumārastasmin padme sthitvā yena sa bhagavān siddhārdhabuddhistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: aht khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ tasmin padme sthitvā yena sa bhagavān siddhārdhabuddhiḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, young prince Puṇyaraśmi, standing on that lotus, bowed to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Siddhārthabuddhi with his palms joined, and uttered this exclamation:

original: tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya namo buddhāyetyudānamudānayati sma //
analyzed: tena añjalim praṇamya namaḥ buddhāya iti udānam udānayati sma
translated: Homage to the Buddha!

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla tena siddhārthabuddhinā tathāgatena sā prabhā pratisaṃhṛtā /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla tena siddhārthabuddhinā tathāgatena sā prabhā pratisaṃhṛtā
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, that Tathāgata Siddhārthabuddhi withdrew that light.

original: sa ca kumārastasya bhagavataḥ pādamūle chinnāpādapa iva prapatitaḥ śatasahasrakṛtvastathāgataṃ vandate sma //
analyzed: sa ca kumāraḥ tasya bhagavataḥ pāda mūle chinnā pādapaḥ iva prapatitaḥ śata sahasra kṛtvas tathāgatam vandate sma
translated: And the young prince, like a tree cut down at the root, fell at the feet of that Blessed One and bowed to the Tathāgata hundreds of thousands of times.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumārastaṃ bhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ tam bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, young prince Puṇyaraśmi addressed that Blessed One with these verses:🔽Today, after a long time, I have found the king of physicians,

original: mayā cirādadya hi vaidyarājaḥ kṛcchrādavāpto 'dya cirātureṇa /
analyzed: mayā cirāt adya hi vaidya rājaḥ kṛcchrāt avāptaḥ cira ātureṇa
translated: who is difficult to obtain, like a sick person who finds a doctor after a long time.🔽Tell me, Lord, how I should abide,

original: ācakṣva me nātha kathaṃ sthito 'haṃ lābhī bhaveyaṃ sugatasya śāsane // //
analyzed: ācakṣva me nātha katham sthitaḥ ham lābhī bhaveyam sugatasya śāsane
translated: so that I may obtain the teaching of the Sugata.🔽I have heard, O Guide, that heedfulness is to be practiced,

original: śruto mayā nāyaka apramādo niśāmya rātrau divi devatābhyaḥ /
analyzed: śrutaḥ mayā nāyaka apramādaḥ niśāmya rātrau divi devatābhyaḥ
translated: having heard it at night from the gods in the sky.

original: śrutvā ca saṃvigna hi āgato 'haṃ kathaṃ narāṇāṃ bhavate pramādaḥ // //
analyzed: śrutvā ca saṃvigna hi āgataḥ ham katham narāṇām bhavate pramādaḥ
translated: Having heard this, I am deeply troubled. How can humans be so heedless?

original: pranaṣṭamārgasya bhavādya deśiko jātyandhabhūtasya bhavādya cakṣuḥ /
analyzed: pranaṣṭa mārgasya bhava adya deśikaḥ jāti andha bhūtasya bhava adya cakṣuḥ
translated: You are now the guide for one who has lost his way, the eyes for one born blind.

original: mahāprapātādiha māṃ samuddhara śraddhākarā kāruṇikā cikitsakā // //
analyzed: mahā prapātāt iha mām samuddhara śraddhā karā kāruṇikā cikitsakā
translated: Lift me up from this great abyss. You are the source of faith, compassionate, a healer.

original: daridrabhūtasya kuruṣva saṃgrahaṃ baddhasya mokṣaṃ kuru me 'dya nātha /
analyzed: daridra bhūtasya kuruṣva saṃgraham baddhasya mokṣam kuru me dya nātha
translated: For one who is destitute, show your favor. Liberate me from bondage, O Lord.

original: sasaṃśayebhyo vimatiṃ ca chinda caryāṃ ca me vyākuru bodhimārge // //
analyzed: sa saṃśayebhyaḥ vimatim ca chinda caryām ca me vyākuru bodhi mārge
translated: Cut through my doubts and uncertainties, and explain to me the conduct on the path to enlightenment.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: O Doctor!

original: tīrthaṃ ca saṃdarśaya uhyato me dīpaṃ kuruṣvāpi mamāndhakāre /
analyzed: tīrtham ca saṃdarśaya uhyataḥ me dīpam kuruṣva api mama andhakāre
translated: Show me the ford. Be a lamp in my darkness.

original: vraṇīkṛtaṃ māṃ hi kuruṣva nirvraṇaṃ śalyaṃ ca me uddhara vaidyarāja // //
analyzed: vraṇīkṛtam mām hi kuruṣva nirvraṇam śalyam ca me uddhara vaidya rāja
translated: Make me, who am wounded, free from wounds. O King of Physicians, pull out my dart.

original: vimocya māṃ durgatisaṃkaṭāttvaṃ bhavopalambhagrahaṇaṃ nikṛnta /
analyzed: vimocya mām durgati saṃkaṭāt tvam bhava upalambha grahaṇam nikṛnta
translated: Liberate me from the danger of bad rebirths. Cut through the grasping at the notion of existence.

original: saṃtāra māṃ śokamahaughapāram aṣṭāṅgamārgeṇa mahāpathena // //
analyzed: saṃtāra mām śoka mahā ogha pāram aṣṭāṅga mārgeṇa mahāpathena
translated: Carry me across the great flood of sorrow to the other shore by the path with eight factors.

original: parīttamāyuḥ kṣayadharmi jīvitaṃ bahvantarāyaṃ kuśalaṃ bhavatyapi /
analyzed: parīttam āyuḥ kṣaya dharmi jīvitam bahu antarāyam kuśalam bhavati api
translated: Life is short and subject to destruction. Virtue is difficult to practice, with many obstacles.

original: puṇyasya sidhyatyacirādvipākaḥ labdhakṣaṇo me 'dya vadaikaniścayam // //
analyzed: puṇyasya sidhyati acirāt vipākaḥ labdha kṣaṇaḥ me vada eka niścayam
translated: The ripening of merit is quickly accomplished. Having obtained this opportunity, tell me with one-pointed certainty.

original: etaddhi me vyākuru lokanātha syādbodhisattvo hi yathāpramattaḥ /
analyzed: etat hi me vyākuru lokanātha syāt bodhisattvaḥ hi yathā pramattaḥ
translated: O Lord of the World, please explain this to me, so that a bodhisattva may be heedful,

original: yathā carannuttamabodhicārikāṃ pramocayeyaṃ bhavabandhanājjagat // //
analyzed: yathā caran uttama bodhi cārikām pramocayeyam bhava bandhanāt jagat
translated: And by practicing the conduct of supreme enlightenment, may liberate the world from the bondage of existence.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla siddhārthabuddhistathāgataḥ puṇyaraśme rājakumārasyādhyāśayaṃ viditvā vistareṇa bodhicaryāṃ saṃprakāśayati /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla siddhārthabuddhiḥ tathāgataḥ puṇyaraśmeḥ rāja kumārasya adhyāśayam viditvā vistareṇa bodhi caryām saṃprakāśayati
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, the Tathāgata Siddhārthabuddhi, knowing the superior intention of Prince Puṇyaraśmi, extensively taught him the conduct of enlightenment.

original: yaṃ śrutvā puṇyaraśminā rājakumāreṇa vimokṣā nāma dhāraṇī praolabdhā /
analyzed: yam śrutvā puṇyaraśminā rāja kumāreṇa vimokṣā nāma dhāraṇī
translated: Having heard it, Prince Puṇyaraśmi attained the dhāraṇī called liberation,

original: pañcābhijñāḥ pratilabdhāḥ /
analyzed: pañca abhijñāḥ pratilabdhāḥ
translated: and attained the five higher knowledges.

original: sa vaihāyase sthitvā puṣpāṇyabhinirmāya taṃ tathāgatamabhyavakirati sma /
analyzed: sa vaihāyase sthitvā puṣpāṇi abhinirmāya tam tathāgatam abhyavakirati sma
translated: Standing in the sky, he created flowers and scattered them over the Tathāgata.

original: abhiprakirati sma //
analyzed: abhiprakirati sma
translated: He scattered them over him.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmi rājakumārastasmādantarīkṣādavatīrya taṃ bhagavantaṃ siddhārthabuddhiṃ tathāgataṃ gāthābhirabhyaṣṭāvīt
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmi rāja kumāraḥ tasmāt antarīkṣāt avatīrya tam bhagavantam siddhārthabuddhim tathāgatam gāthābhiḥ abhyaṣṭāvīt
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, Prince Puṇyaraśmi descended from the sky and praised the Blessed Tathāgata Siddhārthabuddhi with these verses:

original: vandāmi te kanakavarṇanibhā varalakṣaṇā vimalacandramukhā /
analyzed: vandāmi te kanaka varṇa nibhā vara lakṣaṇā vimala candra mukhā
translated: I praise you, one with a body the color of gold, with excellent marks, and a face like a stainless moon.

original: vandāmi te asamajñānadharā sadṛśo na te 'sti tribhave virajaḥ // //
analyzed: vandāmi te asama jñāna dharā sadṛśaḥ na te sti tri bhave virajaḥ
translated: I praise you, one who possesses incomparable wisdom, in the three worlds there is no one equal to you, free from defilements.

original: mṛdu cāru snigdha śubha keśa jinā girirājatulya tava coṣṇiriha /
analyzed: mṛdu cāru snigdha śubha keśa girirāja tulya tava ca uṣṇiḥ iha
translated: O Victorious One, your hair is soft, beautiful, smooth, and splendid, and your head is like the king of mountains here.

original: noṣṇīṣamīkṣitu tavāsti samo vibhrājate bhruvi vare 'pi tavorṇa mune // //
analyzed: na uṣṇīṣam īkṣitu tava asti samaḥ vibhrājate bhruvi vare tava ūrṇa mune
translated: There is no one who can look at your ushnisha as equal to yours. The curl between your eyebrows, O Sage, shines.

original: kundenduśaṅkhahimaśubhranibhā nīlotpalābhaśubhanetravarā /
analyzed: kunda indu śaṅkha hima śubhra nibhā nīlotpala ābha śubha netra varā
translated: Your excellent eyes are like jasmine, the moon, a conch, snow, and the beautiful color of a blue lotus.

original: kṛpayekṣase jagadidaṃ hi yayā vandāmi te vimalanetra jinā // //
analyzed: kṛpayā īkṣase jagat idam hi yayā vandāmi te vimala netra jinā
translated: By which you look compassionately upon this world, I praise you, O Victorious One, with stainless eyes.

original: jihvā prabhūta tanu tāmranibhā
analyzed: jihvā
translated: Your tongue is large, slender, and copper-colored,

original: vadanaṃ ca chādayasi yenasvakam /
analyzed: vadanam ca chādayasi yena svakam
translated: by which you cover your own face.

original: dharmaṃ vadan vinayase ca jagat vandāmi te madhurasnugdhagiram // //
analyzed: dharmam vadan vinayase ca jagat vandāmi te madhura snugdha giram
translated: Speaking the Dharma, you discipline the world. I praise you, one with a sweet and gentle voice.

original: daśanā śubhāḥ sudṛḍha vajranibhāḥ triṃśaddaśāpyaviralāḥ sahitāḥ /
analyzed: daśanā śubhāḥ su dṛḍha vajranibhāḥ triṃśat daśā api aviralāḥ sahitāḥ
translated: Your teeth are excellent, very firm like diamonds, thirty and ten, complete and not sparse.

original: kurvan smitaṃ vinayase ca jagat vandāmi te madhurasatyakathā // //
analyzed: kurvan smitam vinayase ca jagat vandāmi te madhura satya kathā
translated: Smiling, you discipline the world. I praise you, one with sweet and true speech.

original: rūpeṇa cāpratisamo 'si jinā prabhayā ca bhāsayasi kṣetraśatān /
analyzed: rūpeṇa ca apratisamaḥ si jinā prabhayā ca bhāsayasi kṣetra śatān
translated: You are unequaled in form, O Victorious One, and with your radiance, you illuminate hundreds of realms.

original: bramhendrapāla jagato bhagavan jimhībhavanti tava te prabhayā // //
analyzed: bramha indra pāla jagataḥ bhagavan jimhībhavanti tava te prabhayā  /
translated: O Blessed One, the Brahma kings and the guardians of the world, by your radiance, they become dim.

original: eṇeyajaṅgha bhagavanna samā gajarājabarhimṛgarājagateḥ /
analyzed: bhagavat na samā gaja rāja barhi mṛga rāja gateḥ
translated: O Blessed One, your legs are like those of an antelope, not equal to the gait of an elephant king, a peacock, or a deer king.

original: īkṣan vrajasyati yugaṃ bhagavan saṃkampayan dharaṇiśailataṭam // //
analyzed: īkṣan vrajasyati yugam bhagavan saṃkampayan dharaṇi śaila taṭam
translated: Looking, you walk with a stride, O Blessed One, shaking the earth, mountains, and cliffs.

original: kāyaśca lakṣaṇacito bhagavan ślakṣṇa cchavī kanakavarṇaṃ tava /
analyzed: kāyaḥ ca lakṣaṇa citaḥ bhagavan ślakṣṇa chavī kanaka varṇam tava
translated: O Blessed One, your body is adorned with the major and minor marks, and your skin is smooth and golden in color.

original: nekṣan jagad vrajati tṛptimidaṃ rūpaṃ tavāpratimarūpadhara // //
analyzed: na īkṣan jagat vrajati tṛptim idam rūpam tava apratima rūpa dhara
translated: The world never tires of looking at this form of yours, O Bearer of the Unequaled Form.

original: tvaṃ pūrva kalpaśatacīrṇatapā tvaṃ sarvatyāgadamadānarataḥ /
analyzed: tvam kalpa śata cīrṇa tapā tvam sarva tyāga dama dāna rataḥ
translated: You, who practiced austerities for hundreds of past eons, you, who are devoted to giving up everything, to self-control and generosity,

original: tvaṃ sarvasattvakṛpamaitramanā vandāmi te paramakāruṇika // //🔽Vaidya / RP
analyzed: tvam sarva sattva kṛpa maitra manāḥ vandāmi te parama kāruṇika  vaidya rp
translated: You, who have a mind of compassion and loving-kindness for all beings, I pay homage to you, O Supremely Compassionate One.

original: tvaṃ dānaśīlanirataḥ satataṃ tvaṃ kṣāntivīryanirataḥ sudṛḍham /
analyzed: tvam dāna śīla nirataḥ satatam tvam kṣānti vīrya nirataḥ su dṛḍham
translated: You, who are always devoted to generosity and morality, you, who are firmly devoted to patience and effort,

original: tvaṃ dhyānaprajñaprabhatejadharo vandāmi te asamajñānadhara // //
analyzed: tvam dhyāna prajña prabha teja dharaḥ vandāmi te asama jñāna dhara
translated: You, who hold the light and splendor of meditation and wisdom, I pay homage to you, O Bearer of Unequaled Knowledge.

original: tva vādiśūra kugaṇipramathi tvaṃ siṃhavannadasi parṣadi ca /
analyzed: vādi śūra ku gaṇi pramathi tvam siṃha vat nadasi parṣadi ca
translated: You, who are a hero in debate, crushing evil teachers, you roar like a lion in the assembly,

original: tvaṃ vaidyarāja trimalāntakaro vandāmi te paramaprītikara // //
analyzed: tvam vaidya rāja tri mala anta karaḥ vandāmi te parama prīti kara
translated: You are the king of physicians, the terminator of the three defilements, I pay homage to you, the one who brings supreme joy.

original: vākkāyamānasaviśuddha mune tribhaveṣvalipta jalapadmamiva /
analyzed: vāc kāya mānasa viśuddha mune tri bhaveṣu alipta jala padmam iva
translated: Sage, your speech, body, and mind are pure, unstained by the three realms like a water lily,

original: tvaṃ bramhaghoṣa kalaviṅkaravā vandāmi te tribhavapāragatam // //
analyzed: tvam bramhaghoṣa kalaviṅkaravā vandāmi te tri bhava pāra gatam
translated: You have the voice of Brahma, the call of the cuckoo, I pay homage to you, who has gone beyond the three realms.

original: māyopamaṃ jagadidaṃ bhavatā naṭaraṅgasvapnasadṛśaṃ viditam /
analyzed: māyā upamam jagat idam bhavatā naṭa raṅga svapna sadṛśam viditam
translated: This world is known by you to be like an illusion, a stage, or a dream,

original: nātmā na sattva na ca jīvagati dharmā marīcidakacandrasamāḥ // //
analyzed: na ātmā na na ca dharmāḥ marīci daka candra samāḥ
translated: There is no self, no sentient being, no life-force, the phenomena are like a mirage or a moon in the water.

original: śūnyāśca śānta anutpādanaya avijānadeva jagadudbhramati /
analyzed: śūnyāḥ ca śānta anutpāda naya a vijānat eva jagat udbhramati
translated: They are empty, peaceful, and unborn, yet the ignorant world wanders about.

original: teṣāmupāyanayayuktiśatairavatāratyasyapi kṛpālutayā // //
analyzed: teṣām upāya naya yukti śataiḥ avatāra tyasi api kṛpālu tayā
translated: Out of compassion, you lead them with hundreds of skillful means and methods.

original: rāgādibhiśca bahurogaśataiḥ saṃtāpitaṃ satatamīkṣya jagad /
analyzed: rāga ādibhiḥ ca bahu roga śataiḥ saṃtāpitam satatam īkṣya jagat
translated: Seeing the world constantly afflicted by hundreds of diseases such as desire,

original: vaidyottamo vicarase 'pratimaḥ parimocaya sugata sattvaśatān // //
analyzed: vaidya uttamaḥ vicarase pratimaḥ parimocaya sugata sattva śatān
translated: O supreme physician, you move about unrivaled, liberating hundreds of beings, O Sugata.

original: jātījarāmaraṇaśokahataṃ priyaviprayogaparidevaśataiḥ /
analyzed: jātī jarā maraṇa śoka hatam priya viprayoga parideva śataiḥ
translated: Struck by birth, old age, death, and sorrow, separated from loved ones, lamenting in hundreds of ways,

original: satatāturaṃ ca jagadīkṣya mune parimocayan vicarase kṛpayā // //
analyzed: satata āturam ca jagat īkṣya mune parimocayan vicarase kṛpayā
translated: Seeing the world constantly afflicted, O Sage, you move about with compassion, liberating them.

original: rathacakravadbhramati sarvajagat tiryakṣu pretaniraye sugatau /
analyzed: ratha cakra vat bhramati sarva jagat tiryakṣu preta niraye sugatau
translated: The entire world wanders like the wheel of a chariot, among animals, ghosts, in hell, and in good destinies.

original: mūḍhā adeśika anāthagatāḥ teṣāṃ pradarśayasi mārgam // //
analyzed: mūḍhāḥ a deśika anātha gatāḥ teṣām pradarśayasi mārgam
translated: The ignorant, without a guide, without a protector, for them you show the path.

original: ye te babhūva purimāśca jinā dharmeśvarā jagati cārthakarāḥ /
analyzed: ye te babhūva purimāḥ ca jināḥ dharma īśvarāḥ jagati ca artha karāḥ
translated: Those who were the victorious ones in the past, the lords of Dharma, who benefited the world,

original: ayameva taiḥ prakathito 'ryapatho yaṃ deśayasyapi vibho 'pratimaḥ // //
analyzed: ayam eva taiḥ prakathitaḥ rya pathaḥ yam deśayasi api vibho pratimaḥ
translated: This very noble path that they proclaimed, O Lord, you also teach, O incomparable one.

original: snigdhaṃ hyakarṣaya manojña varaṃ bramhādhikaṃ paramaprītikaram /
analyzed: snigdham hi akarṣaya manojña varam bramha adhikam parama prīti karam
translated: Your voice is smooth, attractive, supreme, surpassing Brahmā, and supremely delightful.

original: gandharvakinnaravarāpsarasāmabhibhūya tāṃ giramudāharase // //🔽satyārjavakṣayamupāyanayaiḥ pariśodhitāṃ giramanantaguṇām /
analyzed: gandharva kinnara vara apsarasām abhibhūya tām giram udāharase  satya ārjava kṣayam upāya nayaiḥ pariśodhitām giram ananta guṇām
translated: Having surpassed the voices of gandharvas, kinnaras, and excellent celestial nymphs, you utter it.🔽Having heard that voice, which is purified by truthfulness, sincerity, destruction, means, and principles, and which has infinite qualities,

original: śrutvā hi yāṃ niyutasattvaśatā yānatrayeṇa jina yānti śamam // //
analyzed: śrutvā hi yām niyuta sattva śatāḥ yāna trayeṇa jina yānti śamam
translated: Hundreds of millions of beings, by means of the three vehicles, O Victorious One, attain peace.

original: tava pūjayā sukhamanekavidhaṃ divyaṃ labhanti manujeṣu tathā /🔽āḍhyo mahādhana mahāvibhavo bhavate jagaddhitakaro nṛpatiḥ // //
analyzed: tava pūjayā sukham anekavidham divyam labhanti manujeṣu tathā  āḍhyaḥ mahādhana mahā vibhavaḥ bhavate jagat hita karaḥ nṛpatiḥ
translated: Through your worship, they attain various kinds of happiness, divine and human.🔽You become a king who benefits the world, wealthy, very rich, and powerful.

original: valacakravartyapi ca dvīpapatiḥ jagadāvṛṇoti daśabhiḥ kuśalaiḥ /
analyzed: vala cakravartī api ca dvīpa patiḥ jagat āvṛṇoti daśabhiḥ kuśalaiḥ
translated: And as a powerful universal monarch, a lord of the continents, you cover the world with the ten virtuous actions.

original: ratnāni sapta labhate suśubhāṃ tvayi saṃprasādajanako 'pratima // //
analyzed: ratnāni sapta labhate su śubhām tvayi
translated: One obtains the seven precious substances, and by generating faith in you, one becomes incomparable.

original: bramhāpi śakra api lokapatiḥ bhavate ca saṃtuṣitadevapatiḥ /
analyzed: bramhā api śakra api lokapatiḥ bhavate ca saṃtuṣita deva patiḥ
translated: One becomes Brahma, Shakra, the lord of the world, and the lord of the Tushita gods.

original: parinirmito 'pi ca suyāmapatiḥ tvatpūjayā bhavati cāpi jinaḥ // //
analyzed: parinirmitaḥ ca suyāma patiḥ tvad pūjayā bhavati ca api jinaḥ
translated: One becomes the lord of the Paranirmita gods and the lord of the Suyama gods, and by worshipping you, one becomes a Victorious One.

original: evaṃ hyamogha tava pūja kṛtā saṃdarśanaṃ śravaṇamapyasamam /
analyzed: evam hi amogha tava pūja kṛtā saṃdarśanam śravaṇam api asamam
translated: Thus, worship of you is not in vain, seeing and hearing you is incomparable.

original: bhavate jagadvividhaduḥkhaharaḥ spṛśate paraṃ padavaraṃ hyajaram // //🔽mārgajña mārgakuśalā bhagavan kupathānnivārayasi lokamimam /
analyzed: bhavate jagat vividha duḥkha haraḥ spṛśate param pada varam hi ajaram  mārga jña mārga kuśalāḥ bhagavan kupathāt nivārayasi lokam imam
translated: You become the remover of various sufferings in the world, and you attain the supreme state, which is free from old age.🔽O Blessed One, you who know the path and are skilled in the path, you turn this world away from the wrong path.🔽O Blessed One, you establish this world in the path of the noble ones, which is peaceful, blissful, and free from defilements.

original: kṣeme śive viraja āryapathe pratiṣṭhāpapyasyapi jagadbhagavan // //🔽Vaidya / RP 🔽puṇyādhikasya tava puṇyanidheḥ satatākṣayā bhavati puṇyakriyā /
analyzed: kṣeme śive viraje ārya pathe  vaidya rp  puṇya adhikasya tava puṇya nidheḥ satata akṣayā bhavati puṇya kriyā
translated: O Blessed One, you who are skilled in the path and are skilled in the path, you turn this world away from the wrong path.🔽O Blessed One, you establish this world in the path of the noble ones, which is peaceful, blissful, and free from defilements.🔽O Blessed One, you who are skilled in the path and are skilled in the path, you turn this world away from the wrong path.🔽O Blessed One, you establish this world in the path of the noble ones, which is peaceful, blissful, and free from defilements.

original: bahukalpakoṭīṣu na yāti kṣayaṃ yāvanna saṃspṛśati bodhicarām // //
analyzed: bahu kalpa koṭīṣu na yāti kṣayam yāvat na saṃspṛśati bodhi carām
