translated: O Blessed One, you who are skilled in the path and are skilled in the path, you turn this world away from the wrong path.🔽O Blessed One, you establish this world in the path of the noble ones, which is peaceful, blissful, and free from defilements.🔽O Blessed One, you who are skilled in the path and are skilled in the path, you turn this world away from the wrong path.🔽O Blessed One, you establish this world in the path of the noble ones, which is peaceful, blissful, and free from defilements.🔽O Blessed One, you who are skilled in the path and are skilled in the path, you turn this world away from the wrong path.

original: pariśuddha kṣetra labhate ruciraṃ paranirmitābha sada prītikaram /
analyzed: ruciram prīti karam
translated: O Blessed One, you establish this world in the path of the noble ones, which is peaceful, blissful, and free from defilements.🔽O Blessed One, you who are skilled in the path and are skilled in the path, you turn this world away from the wrong path.🔽O Blessed One, you establish this world in the path of the noble ones, which is

original: śuddhāśca kāyavacasā manasā sattvā bhavantyapi ca kṣetravare // //
analyzed: śuddhāḥ ca kāya vacasā manasā sattvāḥ bhavanti api ca kṣetra vare
translated: And beings become pure in body, speech, and mind in this supreme realm.

original: ityevamādiguṇa naikavidhān labhate jinārcanakṛtān manujaḥ /
analyzed: iti evamādi guṇa nā ekavidhān labhate jina arcana kṛtān manujaḥ
translated: Thus, a human being obtains these and many other kinds of qualities from worshipping the Victorious Ones.

original: svargāpavarga manujeṣu sukhaṃ bhavate ca puṇyanidhi sarvajage // //
analyzed: manujeṣu sukham bhavate ca puṇya nidhi sarva jage  /
translated: Heaven, liberation, and happiness in the human realm - you are the treasure of merit for all beings.

original: kīrtiryaśaśca prasṛtaṃ vipulaṃ tava sarvadikṣu bahukṣetraśatān /
analyzed: kīrtiḥ yaśaḥ ca prasṛtam vipulam tava sarva dikṣu bahu kṣetra śatān
translated: Your fame and glory have spread far and wide in all directions, to many hundreds of realms.

original: saṃkīrtayanti sugatāḥ satataṃ tava varṇamāla parṣatsu jinā // //
analyzed: saṃkīrtayanti sugatāḥ satatam tava varṇa māla parṣatsu
translated: The Sugatas always praise your garland of virtues in their assemblies, O Victorious One.

original: vigatajvarā jagati mokṣakarā priyadarśanā paramakāruṇikā /
analyzed: vigata jvarā jagati mokṣa karā priya darśanā parama kāruṇikā
translated: Free from fever, bringing liberation to the world, delightful to behold, supremely compassionate,

original: śāntendriyā śamaratā bhagavan vandāmi te naravarapravarā // //
analyzed: śānta indriyā śama ratā bhagavan vandāmi te nara vara pravarā
translated: with peaceful senses, devoted to peace, Blessed One, I pay homage to you, supreme among men.

original: labdhā abhijña jina pañca mayā gagane sthitastava niśāmya giram /
analyzed: labdhā abhijña jina pañca mayā gagane sthitaḥ tava niśāmya giram
translated: Having attained the five higher knowledges, O Victorious One, standing in the sky, I heard your words.

original: bhavitāsmi vīra sugatau pratimaḥ vibhajiṣya dharmamamalaṃ jagataḥ // //
analyzed: bhavitāsmi vīra sugatau pratimaḥ vibhajiṣya dharmam amalam jagataḥ
translated: Hero, I will become the equal of the Sugata in the future. I will teach the stainless Dharma to the world.

original: stutvādya sarvaguṇapāragataṃ naradevanāgamahitaṃ sugatam /
analyzed: stutvā adya sarva guṇa pāragatam naradeva nāga mahitam sugatam
translated: Having praised the Sugata today, who has perfected all virtues, who is revered by gods, humans, and nagas,

original: puṇyaṃ yadarjitamidaṃ vipulaṃ jagadāpnuyādapi ca buddhapadam // //
analyzed: puṇyam yad arjitam idam vipulam jagat āpnuyāt api ca buddha padam
translated: Whatever vast merit has been earned by this, may the world attain the state of Buddhahood.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājā arciṣmāṃstasyā rātryā atyayenāśroṣītkumārasyāntaḥpure ruditaśabdam /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājā arciṣmān tasyāḥ rātryāḥ atyayena aśroṣīt kumārasya antaḥpure rudita śabdam
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, when the night was over, King Arciṣmān heard the sound of weeping in the inner palace of the prince.

original: śrutvā ca śīghraṃ tvaramāṇarūpo yena ratipradhānaṃ nagaraṃ tenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: śrutvā ca śīghram tvaramāṇa rūpaḥ yena rati pradhānam nagaram tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Having heard it, he quickly went to the city called Ratipradhāna.

original: upasaṃkramyaitadavocat kiṃ bhavantyo rudanti /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya etat avocat kim bhavantyaḥ rudanti
translated: Having arrived, he said this: “Why are you crying, ladies?”

original: tā avocān puṇyaraśmī rājakumāro na dṛśyate /
analyzed: tāḥ avocān puṇya raśmī rāja kumāraḥ na dṛśyate
translated: They said, “Prince Puṇyaraśmi is not to be seen.”

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājā arciṣmān kumārasyārthe chinnapādapa ina dharaṇītale prapatitaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājā arciṣmān kumārasya arthe chinna pādapaḥ dharaṇī tale prapatitaḥ
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, King Arciṣmān, for the sake of the prince, fell to the ground like a tree that had been cut down.

original: sa utthāya dharaṇitalāt sahasraśaśca tannagaraṃ paricarati rudamānaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ utthāya dharaṇi talāt sahasraśas ca tat nagaram paricarati rudamānaḥ
translated: Having risen from the ground, he wandered around that city in a thousand ways, weeping.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla yā tasminnagare nagaradevatā sā rājānamarciṣmantametadavocat🔽gato mahārāja kumāraḥ pūrvasmin digbhāge siddhārthabuddhiṃ tathāgataṃ darśanāya
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla yā tasmin nagare nagara devatā sā rājānam arciṣmantam etat avocat  gataḥ mahā rāja kumāraḥ pūrvasmin digbhāge siddhārthabuddhim tathāgatam darśanāya
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, the city goddess of that city said this to King Arciṣmān:

original: vandanāya paryupāsanāya //
analyzed: vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: “Great King, the prince has gone to the east to see, pay homage to, and attend upon the Tathāgata Siddhārthabuddhi.”

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājā arciṣmān kumārasyāntaḥpureṇa sārdhaṃ caturaśītibhiḥ prāṇakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrairyena pūrvo digbhāgastenopajagāma
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla rājā arciṣmān kumārasya antaḥpureṇa sārdham caturaśītibhiḥ prāṇa koṭi niyuta śata sahasraiḥ yena pūrvaḥ digbhāgaḥ tena upajagāma
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, King Arciṣmān, together with the retinue of the prince and 84 quintillion other beings, went to the eastern direction.

original: yena siddhārthabuddhistathāgato 'rhan samyassaṃbuddhastenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: yena siddhārthabuddhiḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyassaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: He approached the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Siddhārthabuddhi.

original: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivanditvā ekānte 'tiṣṭhat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivanditvā ekānte tiṣṭhat
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side.

original: ekāntasthitaśca rājā arciṣmān bhagavantamābhirgāthābhirabhyaṣṭāvīt
analyzed: ekānta sthitaḥ ca rājā arciṣmān bhagavantam ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhyaṣṭāvīt
translated: Standing to one side, King Arciṣmān praised the Blessed One with these verses:

original: vandāmi guṇajñānasāgaraṃ naravīraṃ yasya nāsti samaḥ kuto 'dhikastribhave 'smin /
analyzed: vandāmi guṇa jñāna sāgaram nara vīram yasya nā asti samaḥ kutas dhikaḥ tri bhave smin
translated: I pay homage to the ocean of qualities and knowledge, the hero among men, who has no equal, let alone anyone superior, in the three worlds.

original: devendrāsurarājasatkṛtaṃ varasattvaṃ tṛptiṃ naiti jano nirīkṣatastava rūpam // //
analyzed: deva indra asura rāja satkṛtam vara sattvam tṛptim nā eti janaḥ nirīkṣataḥ tava rūpam  /
translated: The supreme being, honored by the lords of gods and demons, people never tire of gazing at your form.

original: dvātriṃśattava kāyalakṣaṇā suviśuddhā merurvā vararatnacitritaḥ pariśuddhaḥ /
analyzed: dvātriṃśat tava kāya lakṣaṇā su viśuddhā meruḥ vā vara ratna citritaḥ pariśuddhaḥ
translated: Your body is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being, pure like Mount Meru, beautifully adorned with the finest jewels.

original: ślakṣṇaṃ kāñcanavarṇasaṃnibhaṃ jinakāntaṃ vandāmi priyarūpadarśanaṃ munikāyam // //
analyzed: ślakṣṇam kāñcana varṇa saṃnibham jina kāntam vandāmi priya rūpa darśanam muni kāyam
translated: Smooth, with the color of gold, the radiance of a Jina, I pay homage to the body of the Sage, whose form is delightful to behold.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: The physician.

original: kalpānacintya śatāśca koṭiyo vrata cīrṇā buddhakoṭiśatāśca satkṛtā bahukalpān /
analyzed: kalpān a cintya śatāḥ ca koṭiyaḥ cīrṇāḥ buddha koṭi śatāḥ ca satkṛtāḥ bahu kalpān
translated: For inconceivable hundreds of thousands of eons, you have practiced austerities and honored hundreds of thousands of Buddhas for many eons,

original: yaṣṭā yajñaśatā acintiyāparimāṇā kāyastena tavābhirājate abhirūpaḥ // //
analyzed: yaṣṭā yajña śatā kāyaḥ tena tava abhirājate abhirūpaḥ  /
translated: You have performed inconceivable and immeasurable hundreds of sacrifices, therefore your body shines brilliantly and is most beautiful.

original: dānaśīlasamādhiprajñayāpi ca kṣāntyā vīryadhyānamupāyaśodhitaṃ tava rūpam /
analyzed: dāna śīla samādhi prajñayā api ca kṣāntyā vīrya dhyānam upāya śodhitam tava rūpam
translated: Your form is purified by giving, morality, concentration, wisdom, patience, diligence, meditation, and skillful means.

original: candrārkamaṇidyutiprabhā na virāji śakrabramhaprabhā na bhāsate purataste // //
analyzed: candra arka maṇi dyuti prabhā na virāji śakra bramha prabhā na bhāsate puratas te  /
translated: The radiance of the sun, moon, and jewels does not shine, the radiance of Shakra and Brahma does not illuminate before you.

original: rūpaṃ darśayate manoramaṃ jagadarthe pratibhāsodakacandrasaṃnibhaṃ yatha māyā /
analyzed: rūpam darśayate manoramam jagat arthe pratibhāsa udaka candra saṃnibham māyā
translated: For the sake of the world, you manifest a delightful form, like an illusion, like a reflection in the water or the moon.

original: sarvāsveva ca dikṣu dṛśyate jinakāyo no cā rūpapramāṇu dṛśyate sugatānām // //
analyzed: sarvāsu eva ca dikṣu dṛśyate jina kāyaḥ dṛśyate sugatānām
translated: The body of the Victorious One is seen in all directions, but the true form of the Sugatas is not seen.

original: tuṣiteṣu kvacideva dṛśyase nivasaṃstvaṃ vyūḍhamānaśca punaḥ supāṇḍaragajabhūtaḥ /
analyzed: tuṣiteṣu kvacid eva dṛśyase nivasan tvam vyūḍha mānaḥ ca punar su pāṇḍara gaja bhūtaḥ
translated: Sometimes you are seen dwelling in the Tusita heaven, and again, O Great One, you appear as a pure white elephant.

original: mātu kukṣigataśca dṛśyase 'pi ca vīraḥ sarvatrānugato mahāmune nabhatulyaḥ // //
analyzed: kukṣi gataḥ ca dṛśyase ca vīraḥ sarvatra anugataḥ mahā mune nabha tulyaḥ
translated: You are seen entering your mother's womb, and yet, O Hero, you are present everywhere, O Great Sage, you are like the sky.

original: jātiṃ saṃdarśayase kvacidbhavān diśatāsu gacchan sapta padāni dṛśyase kvacidurvyām /
analyzed: jātim saṃdarśayase kvacid bhavān diśa tāsu gacchan sapta padāni dṛśyase kvacid urvyām
translated: Sometimes you display birth, walking seven steps in the directions, and are seen on the earth.

original: hyeṣṭho 'haṃ sanarāmare jage atidevo mociṣye jaga duḥkhasāgarādgira muñcan // //
analyzed: hyeṣṭhaḥ ham sa nara amare jage atidevaḥ mociṣye jaga duḥkha sāgarāt gira muñcan  /
translated: I am the highest, the god of gods among the world of men and immortals, releasing the world from the ocean of suffering, uttering a roar.

original: dharmasaṃśayu nāsti te mune kvacideva śikṣāṃ cāpi ca loka dṛśyate lipijñāne śāntaṃ dhyānasamādhigocaramanuprāptaṃ strīṇāṃ madhyagataśca dṛśyate
analyzed: dharma saṃśayu na asti te mune kvacid eva śikṣām ca api ca dṛśyate lipi jñāne śāntam dhyāna samādhi gocaram anuprāptam strīṇām madhya gataḥ ca dṛśyate
translated: O Sage, you have no doubt about the Dharma anywhere. And training is seen in the world for knowing writing. Having attained the peaceful domain of meditation and concentration, you are seen in the midst of women,

original: kvacideva // //
analyzed: kvacid eva
translated: sometimes indeed.

original: tyaktvā mātāpitā mahītale pramadāśca jñātīn śokahatān vimūrcchitān viruvantaḥ /
analyzed: tyaktvā mātā pitā mahī tale pramadāḥ ca jñātīn śoka hatān vimūrcchitān viruvantaḥ
translated: Having abandoned mother, father, and women on the earth, and relatives struck down by grief, unconscious and wailing,

original: niṣkrānto vanavāsamīkṣyase padamekaṃ devākoṭiśataiḥ parivṛto varasattvaḥ // //
analyzed: niṣkrāntaḥ vana vāsam īkṣyase padam ekam devā koṭi śataiḥ parivṛtaḥ vara sattvaḥ
translated: having seen them, you set out for forest dwelling, taking one step, O best of beings, surrounded by hundreds of millions of gods.

original: mārāste caturo 'pi nirjitāścirakālaṃ mārān dharṣayamāṇa dṛśyate 'pi ca kṣetre /
analyzed: mārāḥ te caturaḥ nirjitāḥ cira kālam mārān dharṣayamāṇa dṛśyate ca kṣetre
translated: You have long since conquered the four Maras, and yet you are seen in the realm, frightening the Maras.

original: cakraṃ vartayase 'pyacintiyaṃ purimeṇa cakraṃ vartayamāna dṛśyase kṛpayā tvam // //
analyzed: cakram vartayase pi acintiyam purimeṇa cakram vartayamāna dṛśyase kṛpayā tvam  /
translated: You turn the inconceivable wheel in the east, and out of compassion, you are seen turning the wheel.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: O Sage, you are the supreme physician, the best of physicians, the best of physicians, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best of healers, the best

original: nityaṃ śāśvatadṛṣṭisaṃjñitaṃ jagadīkṣya nirvāsya iti vāca bhāṣase pariṣatsu /
analyzed: nityam śāśvata dṛṣṭi saṃjñitam jagat īkṣya nirvāsyaḥ iti vāca bhāṣase pariṣatsu
translated: Seeing the world with the view of permanence and eternity, you speak in assemblies, I will attain nirvana.

original: saṃsārābhirataṃ jagatsatatamīkṣya śāntāṃ śītagatiṃ ca nirvṛtiṃ vadasi tvam // //
analyzed: saṃsāra abhiratam jagat satatam īkṣya śāntām śīta gatim ca nirvṛtim vadasi tvam
translated: Seeing the world always attached to samsara, you speak of the peaceful, cool state of nirvana.

original: puṇyajñānamupāyaprajñato na samaste sphurase kāyaprabhāya tvaṃ mune bahukṣetrān /
analyzed: puṇya jñānam upāya prajñataḥ na samaste sphurase kāya prabhāya tvam mune bahu kṣetrān
translated: In merit, knowledge, means, and wisdom, you are not equal, O Sage, your body's radiance shines in many realms.

original: bhāṣante tava varṇa nāyakā diśatāsu vande tvāmasamantagocaraṃ munirājam // //
analyzed: bhāṣante tava varṇa nāyakāḥ diśatāsu vande tvām asamanta gocaram muni rājam
translated: The guides in the directions speak of your praise. I pay homage to you, the Sage-King whose sphere is incomparable.

original: vandāmo 'pi ca dharmatāmakhilaprāptaṃ sarvasattvakriyāsu dṛśyase yatha māyā /
analyzed: ca dharma tām akhila prāptam sarva sattva kriyāsu dṛśyase māyā
translated: We also pay homage to the one who has attained the nature of reality, who appears in the actions of all beings like an illusion.

original: na ca te 'styāgamanaṃ kvacidgamanaṃ vā māyādharma sati pratiṣṭhitamabhivande // //
analyzed: na ca te styā gamanam kvacid gamanam vā māyā dharma sati pratiṣṭhitam abhivande
translated: You have no coming or going anywhere, you abide in the Dharma of illusion. I pay homage to you.

original: sādhu tvaṃ naravīra bhāṣase varamārgaṃ bodhiryena varā hyavāpyate jagadarthe /
analyzed: sādhu tvam nara vīra bhāṣase vara mārgam bodhiḥ yena varāḥ hi avāpyate jagat arthe
translated: You, O hero among men, speak well of the supreme path by which the supreme enlightenment is attained for the sake of the world.

original: etāmapyahamāśu dharmatāmanubuddhā deśeyaṃ naravīraṃ dhamatāṃ jagadarthe // //
analyzed: etām api aham āśu dharmatām anubuddhā deśeyam nara vīram dhamatām jagat arthe
translated: I too have quickly realized this very nature of reality. I will teach it, O hero among men, for the sake of the world, for the sake of the nature of reality.

original: sarvajñaṃ vigatajvaraṃ naravīraṃ yasya nāsti samaḥ kuto 'dhikastribhave 'smin /
analyzed: sarvajñam vigata jvaram nara vīram yasya nā asti samaḥ kutas dhikaḥ tri bhave smin
translated: The Omniscient One, the Hero among Men, free from fever, who has no equal in this triple world, much less anyone superior,

original: stutvā puṇyamupārjitaṃ mayā yadiha tena śāntāṃ bodhivarāmanuttarāṃ spṛśatu lokaḥ // //
analyzed: stutvā puṇyam upārjitam mayā yat iha tena śāntām bodhi varām anuttarām spṛśatu lokaḥ
translated: If I have gained any merit by praising him, may it cause the world to attain the peace of the supreme, unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla sa tathāgataḥ siddhārthabuddhiḥ rājño 'rciṣmato 'dhyāśayaṃ viditvā tathā dharmaṃ deśayāmāsa yathā sarve avaivartikā abhūvannanuttarāyāṃ 🔽samyaksaṃbodhau //
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla sa tathāgataḥ siddhārtha buddhiḥ rājñaḥ rciṣmataḥ dhyā āśayam viditvā tathā dharmam deśayāmāsa yathā sarve a vaivartikāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām  samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, the Tathāgata Siddhārthabuddhi, knowing the superior intention of King Arciṣmān, taught the Dharma in such a way that they all became irreversible from supreme and perfect awakening.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumārastaṃ bhagavantaṃ siddhārthabuddhiṃ tathāgatametadavocat adhivāsayatu bhagavānasmākāṃ nagare śvobhaktena
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ tam bhagavantam siddhārtha buddhim tathāgatam etat avocat adhivāsayatu bhagavān asmākām nagare śvobhaktena
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, Prince Puṇyaraśmi said to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Siddhārthabuddhi, 'May the Blessed One consent to take his meal tomorrow in our city, together with the community of monks.'

original: adhivāsayati ca bhagavān puṇyaraśme rājakumārasya tūṣṇībhāvenānukampāmupādāya //
analyzed: adhivāsayati ca bhagavān puṇyaraśme rāja kumārasya tūṣṇībhāvena anukampām upādāya
translated: And the Blessed One, out of compassion, consented to Prince Puṇyaraśmi by remaining silent.

original: atha khalu puṇyaraśmī rājakumārastau mātāpitarau tāśva pramadā āmantrayati sma anumodayantu bhavantaḥ sarve sahitāḥ sarve samagrāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ tau mātā pitarau pramadāḥ āmantrayati sma anumodayantu bhavantaḥ sarve sahitāḥ sarve samagrāḥ
translated: Then the young prince Puṇyaraśmi addressed his parents and the women: ‘All of you, be in agreement and consent to this.

original: yathālaṃkṛtaṃ ratipradhānaṃ nagaraṃ tathāgatasya niryātayāmuanapekṣaḥ /
analyzed: yathā alaṃkṛtam rati pradhānam nagaram tathāgatasya
translated: Without any hesitation, I will offer to the Tathāgata the city of Ratipradhāna, just as it is adorned.’

original: tairekasvareṇānumoditam //
analyzed: taiḥ eka svareṇa anumoditam
translated: They all agreed in one voice.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rājakumāro yathālaṃkṛtaṃ ratipradhānaṃ nagaraṃ tathāgatāya niryātayati sma anapekṣaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla puṇyaraśmī rāja kumāraḥ yathā alaṃkṛtam rati pradhānam nagaram tathāgatāya niryātayati sma anapekṣaḥ
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, the young prince Puṇyaraśmi, without any hesitation, offered to the Tathāgata the city of Ratipradhāna, just as it was adorned.

original: pañcarasaśatavyūhena ca bhojanena taṃ tathāgataṃ pratipādayati sma sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghena /
analyzed: pañca rasa śata vyūhena ca bhojanena tam tathāgatam pratipādayati sma sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena
translated: He presented to the Tathāgata, together with the community of monks, a meal consisting of a hundred and five flavors.

original: sarveṣāṃ teṣāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ saptaratnacitān vihārān kārayāmāsa maṇicaṃkramān prajñaptānupari ca ratnajālavitānavitatān vāmadakṣiṇena puṣpavṛkṣasupariniṣṭhitān
analyzed: sarveṣām teṣām bhikṣūṇām sapta ratna citān vihārān kārayāmāsa maṇi caṃkramān prajñaptān upari ca ratna jāla vitāna vitatān vāma dakṣiṇena puṣpa vṛkṣa su pariniṣṭhitān
translated: He had monasteries built for all those monks, constructed of the seven precious substances, with bejeweled walkways laid out, covered above with canopies of jeweled nets, with flowering trees planted on the left and right,

original: puṇḍarīkapuṣkariṇyupaśibhitānyubhayato mukhanirmaladūṣyaśatasahasraprajñaptāni Vaidya / RP
analyzed: puṇḍarīka puṣkariṇī upaśibhitāni ubhayatas mukha nirmala dūṣya śata sahasra prajñaptāni
translated: adorned with pools of blue lotus flowers, with a hundred thousand pairs of spotless woolen garments laid out on both sides,

original: śayyāsanāni /
analyzed: śayyā āsanāni
translated: and with beds and seats.

original: ekaikasya ca bhikṣorabhivandya cīvaro dīyate sma ekaikaḥ /
analyzed: ekaikasya ca bhikṣoḥ abhivandya cīvaraḥ dīyate smaḥ ekaikaḥ
translated: And to each monk, a robe was offered.

original: anyonyāni cīvarāṇyanipradīyante divase divase /
analyzed: anyonyāni cīvarāṇi a nipradīyante divase divase
translated: And other robes were offered, day after day.

original: sa tribhirvarṣakoṭibhiḥ styānamiddhaṃ nāvakrāmitavān /
analyzed: sa tribhiḥ varṣa koṭibhiḥ styānam iddham na avakrāmitavān
translated: For thirty million years, he did not succumb to drowsiness or torpor.

original: nātmaprema kṛtavān /
analyzed: na ātma prema kṛtavān
translated: He did not indulge in self-love.

original: buddhapūjāṃ prati nānyamanasikāraḥ /
analyzed: buddha pūjām prati na anya manasikāraḥ
translated: He did not think of anything else than worshipping the Buddha.

original: etasminnantare na kāmavitarkaṃ vitarkitavān /
analyzed: etasmin antare na kāma vitarkam vitarkitavān
translated: In the meantime, he did not entertain thoughts of desire,

original: na vyāpādavitarkaṃ na vihiṃsāvitarkaṃ na rājyatṛṣṇām /
analyzed: na vyāpāda vitarkam na vihiṃsā vitarkam na rājya tṛṣṇām
translated: thoughts of malice, thoughts of harm, or longing for a kingdom.

original: sarvathānapekṣo 'bhūtkāye jīvite ca /
analyzed: sarvathā anapekṣaḥ bhūt kāye jīvite ca
translated: In every way, he was indifferent to his body and life,

original: prāgevānyatarasmin bāhyavastuni /
analyzed: prāk eva anyatarasmin bāhya vastuni
translated: let alone to any external thing.

original: etasminnantare yadbhagavatā bhāṣitaṃ tatsarvamavadhāritam /
analyzed: etasmin antare yat bhagavatā bhāṣitam tat sarvam avadhāritam
translated: In the meantime, he understood everything that was spoken by the Blessed One.

original: na ca dvirapi sa tathāgataḥ pṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: na ca dvis api sa tathāgataḥ pṛṣṭaḥ
translated: And he did not ask the Tathāgata a second time.

original: etasminnantare na snāto na sarpitailena vā gātraṃ mrakṣitam /
analyzed: etasmin antare na snātaḥ na sarpi tailena vā gātram mrakṣitam
translated: In the meantime, he did not bathe, nor did he anoint his body with sesame oil,

original: na pādadhāvanaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: na pāda dhāvanam kṛtam
translated: nor did he wash his feet.

original: na klāntasaṃjñotpāditā /
analyzed: na klānta saṃjñā utpāditā
translated: He did not arouse the notion of weariness.

original: na jātu niṣaṇṇo 'nyatra bhaktaparibhogārthamuccāraprasrāvaṇārthaṃ ca /
analyzed: na jātu niṣaṇṇaḥ nyatra bhakta paribhoga artham uccāra prasrāvaṇa artham ca
translated: He never sat down, except to eat, to relieve himself, or to urinate.

original: yasmiṃśca samaye sa tathāgataḥ parinirvṛtastasmin samaye lohitacandranasya citā kāritā /
analyzed: yasmin ca samaye sa tathāgataḥ parinirvṛtaḥ tasmin samaye lohita candra nasya citā kāritā
translated: And when that Tathāgata had passed into parinirvāṇa, he had a funeral pyre made for the red-crested one.

original: yatra sa tathāgato dhmāpitastasminneva ca pṛthivipradeśe varṣaśatasahasraṃ dhātūnāṃ pūjāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: yatra sa tathāgataḥ dhmāpitaḥ tasmin eva ca pṛthivi pradeśe varṣa śata sahasram dhātūnām pūjām kṛtavān
translated: Where that Tathāgata was cremated, in that very place he made offerings to the relics for a hundred thousand years.

original: sarvaṃ jambūdvīpaṃ sarvapuṣpaiḥ sarvamālyaiḥ sarvagandhaiḥ sarvavādyairyāvat sarvapūjāsatkārān kṛtvā pañcāccaturnavatiḥ stūpakoṭyaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitavān
analyzed: sarvam jambūdvīpam sarva puṣpaiḥ sarva mālyaiḥ sarva gandhaiḥ sarva vādyaiḥ yāvat sarva pūjā satkārān kṛtvā pañcāt caturnavatiḥ stūpa koṭyaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitavān
translated: Having made offerings with all the flowers, garlands, perfumes, and musical instruments of Jambudvīpa, he established ninety-five koṭis of stūpas.

original: te ca stūpāḥ saptaratnamayā ratnajālasaṃchannā muktājālavitānavitatāḥ /
analyzed: te ca stūpāḥ sapta ratna mayāḥ ratna jāla saṃchannāḥ muktā jāla vitāna vitatāḥ
translated: Those stūpas were made of the seven precious substances, covered with jeweled nets, and adorned with pearl nets.

original: saptānāṃ ratnānāṃ pañca pañca chatraśatānyekaikasmin stūpe āropitavān /
analyzed: saptānām ratnānām pañca pañca chatra śatāni ekaikasmin stūpe āropitavān
translated: He erected five hundred parasols of the seven precious substances for each stūpa.

original: sarvatra ca stūpe tūryaśatasahasrāṇi niścāritavān /
analyzed: sarvatra ca stūpe tūrya śata sahasrāṇi niścāritavān
translated: He caused hundreds of thousands of musical instruments to be played at each stūpa.

original: samantataśca jambūdvīpe puṣpavṛkṣān ropitavān /
analyzed: samantataḥ ca jambūdvīpe puṣpa vṛkṣān ropitavān
translated: And all around Jambudvīpa he planted flower trees.

original: ekaikatra dīpyate sarvagandhatailasya /
analyzed: ekaikatra dīpyate sarvagandha tailasya
translated: Each one was lit with all the perfumes and oils.

original: sarvagandhamālyavilepanaiśca pūjāmakarot /
analyzed: sarva gandha mālya vilepanaiḥ ca pūjām akarot
translated: He made offerings with all the perfumes, garlands, and ointments.

original: anenopāyena varṣakoṭiṃ pūjāṃ kṝtvāḥ tataḥ pravrajitaḥ /
analyzed: anena upāyena varṣa koṭim pūjām tatas pravrajitaḥ
translated: In this way, he made offerings for a hundred million years and then went forth.

original: sa pravrajitā traicīvariko 'bhavat /🔽nityaṃ piṇḍapātacāriko 'naiṣadyikaḥ /
analyzed: sa pravrajitā traicīvarikaḥ bhavat  nityam piṇḍapāta cārikaḥ naiṣadyikaḥ
translated: Having gone forth, he became a wearer of rags.🔽He always went for alms, and he did not accept invitations.

original: na jātu pārśvaṃ dattavān /
analyzed: na jātu pārśvam dattavān
translated: He never lay down.

original: na styānamiddhamavakrāmitavān /
analyzed: na styānam iddham avakrāmitavān
translated: He never succumbed to laziness or drowsiness.

original: tena nirāmiṣacittena catako varṣakoṭyo dharmadānaṃ dattam /🔽na cānenāntaśaḥ /
analyzed: tena nirāmiṣa cittena catakaḥ varṣa koṭyaḥ dharma dānam dattam  na ca anena antaśas
translated: With a mind free from worldly desires, he gave the gift of the Dharma for four hundred million years.

original: sādhukāro 'pi parasyāntikātpratikāṅkṣitaḥ /
analyzed: sādhukāraḥ pi parasya antikāt pratikāṅkṣitaḥ
translated: He never even hoped for a word of praise from others.

original: kutaḥ punarlābhasatkāraḥ /
analyzed: kutas punar lābha satkāraḥ
translated: How could he desire gain or honor?

original: nāpi klānto 'bhūddharmaśravaṇena dharmadeśanayā ca /
analyzed: na api klāntaḥ bhūddharma śravaṇena dharma deśanayā ca
translated: He was never tired of listening to the Dharma or teaching the Dharma.

original: tasya devatāḥ paricaryāṃ kurvanti sma /
analyzed: tasya devatāḥ paricaryām kurvanti sma
translated: The gods served him.

original: tasya cānuśikṣitvā sarvajanapado 'ntaḥpuraṃ sarvapādamūlaṃ sarvasahāyāśca pravrajitāḥ //
analyzed: tasya ca anuśikṣitvā sarva janapadaḥ ntaḥpuram sarva pāda mūlam sarva sahāyāḥ ca pravrajitāḥ
translated: And following his example, all the people of the country, the harem, all his ministers, and all his friends went forth.

original: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla śūddhāvāsakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāmetadabhavat puṇyaraśmeranuśikṣamāṇaḥ sarvarājyajanakadaḥ pravrajitaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu rāṣṭrapāla śūddhāvāsa kāyikānām deva putrāṇām etat abhavat puṇyaraśmeḥ anuśikṣamāṇaḥ sarva rājya janaka daḥ pravrajitaḥ
translated: Then, Rāṣṭrapāla, the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm had this thought: “The entire population of the kingdom, following Puṇyaraśmi’s example, has gone forth.

original: asmābhistasyopasthānaparicaryā kartavyā /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ tasya upasthāna paricaryā kartavyā
translated: We must serve and attend to him.”

original: trayāṇāṃ ratnānāmupasthāna kṛtaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: trayāṇām ratnānām upasthāna kṛtam bhaviṣyati
translated: and he will have made offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: tasya punastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya catuḥṣaṣṭivarṣakoṭyaḥ saddharmastasthau /
analyzed: tasya punar tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya catuḥṣaṣṭi varṣa koṭyaḥ saddharmaḥ tasthau
translated: And after the parinirvāṇa of that Tathāgata, the true Dharma remained for sixty-four koṭīs of years.

original: sarvasya puṇyaraśminā bhikṣuṇā buddhasahasrasya caivaṃrūpā pūjā kṛtābhūt //
analyzed: sarvasya puṇya raśminā bhikṣuṇā buddha sahasrasya ca evaṃrūpā pūjā kṛtā abhūt
translated: And all of that was done by the monk Puṇyaraśmi, who made such offerings to a thousand Buddhas.

original: syātkhalu punaste rāṣṭrapāla etarhi kāṅkṣā vā vimatirvā vicikitsā vā anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayenārciṣmān nāma rājābhūt /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar te rāṣṭrapālaḥ etarhi kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena arciṣmān nāma rājā abhūt
translated: Rāṣṭrapāla, do you have any doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism that at that time, on that occasion, the king named Arciṣmān was someone else?

original: na khalu punastvayaivaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar tvayā evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: amitāyuḥ sa tathāgatastena kālena tena samayenārciṣmānnāma rājābhūt /
analyzed: amita āyuḥ sa tathāgataḥ tena kālena tena samayena arciṣmān nāma rājā abhūt
translated: The Tathāgata Amitāyus at that time, on that occasion, was the king named Arciṣmān.

original: syātkhalu punaste rāṣṭrapāla anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena puṇyaraśmirnāma rājakumāro 'bhūt /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar te rāṣṭrapāla anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena puṇyaraśmiḥ nāma rāja kumāraḥ bhūt
translated: Rāṣṭrapāla, do you have any doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism that at that time, on that occasion, the prince named Puṇyaraśmi was someone else?

original: na khalu punastvayaivaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar tvayā evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ahaṃ sa tena kālena tena samayena puṇyaraśmirnāma rājakumāro 'bhūt /
analyzed: aham sa tena kālena tena samayena puṇyaraśmiḥ nāma rāja kumāraḥ bhūt
translated: I was the prince named Puṇyaraśmi at that time, on that occasion.

original: yāpi sā nagaradevatā /
analyzed: yā api sā nagara devatā
translated: And that city goddess

original: akṣobhyastathāgato 'bhūt /
analyzed: akṣobhyaḥ tathāgataḥ bhūt
translated: became the Tathagata Akshobhya.

original: Vaidya / RP tasmāttarhi rāṣṭrapāla bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi rāṣṭrapāla bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena
translated: Therefore, Rashtrapala, a Bodhisattva Mahasattva who desires to fully awaken to supreme and perfect enlightenment

original: tasya puṇyaraśmirājakumārasyāniśikṣitavyamadhyāśayapratipattyā priyāpriyaparityāgitayā
analyzed: tasya puṇyaraśmi rāja kumārasya a niśikṣitavyam adhyāśaya pratipattyā priya apriya parityāgi tayā
translated: should train in the great aspiration of that Prince Punyarashmi, by giving up what is dear and not dear,

original: apramādacaryayā evaṃ duḥkhābhisaṃskārapratilabdhā me 'nuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiriti /
analyzed: apramāda caryayā evam duḥkha abhisaṃskāra pratilabdhā me nuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ iti
translated: and by practicing heedfulness, thinking, 'I have attained supreme and perfect enlightenment through this very difficult practice.'

original: tatte 'nabhiyuktā lābhasatkāraślokagurukā jñātyadhyavasitā mānahatā lābhahatāstapasvino vihanyante /
analyzed: tat te lābha satkāra śloka gurukāḥ jñāti adhyavasitāḥ māna hatāḥ lābha hatāḥ tapasvinaḥ vihanyante
translated: Those who are not diligent, who are devoted to gain, honor, and fame, who are attached to their relatives, who are struck down by pride and gain, who harm ascetics,

original: lābhahetoḥ śāsanāddūrībhavanti /
analyzed: lābha hetoḥ śāsanāt dūrībhavanti
translated: who are far removed from the teachings for the sake of gain,

original: nirarthakaṃ pravrajitāḥ śramaṇadūṣakā bodhisattvakhaṭukāḥ kāyavākcittavaṅkāḥ naimittikāḥ
analyzed: nirarthakam pravrajitāḥ śramaṇa dūṣakāḥ bodhisattva khaṭukāḥ kāya vāc citta vaṅkāḥ naimittikāḥ
translated: who have gone forth in vain, who defile ascetics, who are rough towards Bodhisattvas, who are crooked in body, speech, and mind, who are fortune-tellers,

original: vitathapratijñāḥ svapratijñātaścyutāḥ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayyāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāranimittamadhyavasitāḥ /
analyzed: vitatha pratijñāḥ sva pratijñātaḥ cyutāḥ cīvara piṇḍapāta śayyā āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāra nimittam adhyavasitāḥ
translated: who have false vows, who have fallen from their own vows, who are attached to robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, and medicines for curing the sick,

original: ahrīkā anapatrapā acāritrā asaddharmaprasṛtā gocaravirahitā buddhagocarāddūrībhūtā buddhajñānavirahitāḥ mokṣacittavirahitāḥ bodhicittavirahitāḥ
analyzed: ahrīkāḥ anapatrapāḥ acāritrāḥ asat dharma prasṛtāḥ gocara virahitāḥ buddha gocarāt dūrībhūtāḥ buddha jñāna virahitāḥ mokṣa citta virahitāḥ bodhi citta virahitāḥ
translated: They are shameless, have no sense of modesty, have bad conduct, are devoted to bad teachings, are devoid of the sphere of activity, are far removed from the sphere of activity of the Buddhas, are devoid of the knowledge of the Buddhas, are devoid of the mind of liberation, are devoid of the mind of enlightenment,

original: tasmāttarhi rāṣṭrapāla imamevaṃrūpaṃ dharmaṃ śrutvā boddhavyam pāpamitrānyudyuktāni na sevitavyāni lābhārthikānām //
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi rāṣṭrapālaḥ imam evaṃrūpam dharmam śrutvā boddhavyam pāpa mitrāni udyuktāni na sevitavyāni lābha arthikānām
translated: Therefore, Rāṣṭrapāla, having heard this kind of Dharma, one should understand that one should not attend to devotedly to bad friends who are intent on gain and honor.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: aprameye daśabalacalite lābhe jñātau parigatahṛdayā /
analyzed: aprameye daśa bala calite lābhe jñātau parigata hṛdayā
translated: In immeasurable gain, moved by the ten powers, with their hearts filled with fame and gain,

original: hitvā bodhiṃ guṇaśatanicitāṃ lābhārthaṃ te parakulanicatāḥ // //
analyzed: hitvā bodhim guṇa śata nicitām lābha artham te para kula nicatāḥ
translated: Abandoning enlightenment, which is a storehouse of hundreds of qualities, for the sake of gain, they are devoted to the families of others.

original: dhvāṅkṣā duṣṭā hrīdhṛtirahitā kṣetrārthaṃ te namucivaśagatāḥ /
analyzed: dhvāṅkṣā duṣṭā hrī dhṛti rahitā kṣetra artham te namuci vaśa gatāḥ
translated: They are like crows, wicked, devoid of shame and conscience, for the sake of fields, they are under the power of Namuci.

original: kleśādhīnā bhavagatipraṇatā bhāṣantyevaṃ vayamapi guṇinaḥ // //
analyzed: kleśa adhīnāḥ bhava gati praṇatāḥ bhāṣanti evam vayam api guṇinaḥ
translated: Under the sway of afflictions, inclined towards the course of existence, they say, 'We too are virtuous.'

original: kāyo 'raṇye smṛtirapi nagare lābhārthaṃ te caritavikalpe /
analyzed: kāyaḥ raṇye smṛtiḥ api nagare lābha artham te carita vikalpe
translated: The body in the forest, and mindfulness in the city, for the sake of gain, they engage in discriminating conduct.

original: dūre mokṣo nabha iva dharaṇi dūre jāhu bhujagavadetān // //
analyzed: dūre mokṣaḥ nabhaḥ iva dharaṇi dūre jāhu bhujaga vat etān
translated: Liberation is far away, like the sky from the earth, go far away from them, like a snake.

original: buddho dharmo na ca priyavadatāṃ tadvatsaṃgho guṇaśatabharitaḥ /
analyzed: buddhaḥ dharmaḥ na ca priya vadatām tadvat saṃghaḥ guṇa śata bharitaḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Dharma, and likewise the Sangha, filled with a hundred qualities, are not to be attained through flattery.

original: hitvā svargaṃ kupathaprayātā aṣṭavighātairbhavaśatavihatāḥ // //
analyzed: hitvā svargam kupatha prayātāḥ aṣṭa vighātaiḥ bhava śata vihatāḥ
translated: Having abandoned heaven, going on bad paths, hindered by the eight obstacles, defeated in the hundred existences,

original: śrutvaināṃ mama cārikāṃ samupadiṣṭāṃ bhūtādhyāśayato 'tra yujyathā pratipattyā /
analyzed: śrutvā enām mama cārikām samupadiṣṭām bhūta adhyāśayataḥ pratipattyā
translated: Having heard this conduct of mine well-taught, here one should be diligent in practice with a pure superior intention.

original: duṣprāpyaṃ bahukalpakoṭibhiḥ kṣaṇaprāptā tasmādatra yathoktadharmatāmabhiyujyet // //
analyzed: duṣprāpyam bahu kalpa koṭibhiḥ kṣaṇaprāptā tasmāt atra yathā ukta dharmatām abhiyujyet  /
translated: Difficult to attain in many millions of eons, attained in a moment, therefore one should be diligent in the nature of phenomena as taught here.

original: yo hīcchedvarabodhi budhyituṃ varayāne smāryāstena mahīpate guṇāstasya /
analyzed: yaḥ hi icchet vara bodhi budhyitum varayāne smāryāḥ tena mahīpate guṇāḥ tasya
translated: Whoever wishes to awaken to supreme enlightenment by the supreme vehicle, by that one the qualities of that lord should be remembered.

original: saṃcintya yathābhūta yoniśaḥ sthātavyamevaṃ bodhi asaṅga ridhyate sugatānām // //
analyzed: saṃcintya yathā bhūta yoniśas sthātavyam evam ridhyate sugatānām
translated: As much as is thought, as it is, one should stand in such a way, thus the enlightenment of the Sugatas is accomplished without attachment.

original: āryaṃ vaṃśaṃ niṣevate guṇaprekṣī jñānaṃ tatra utpādayecchu ivātra /
analyzed: āryam vaṃśam niṣevate guṇa prekṣī jñānam tatra utpādayet śu iva atra
translated: One who sees qualities should attend to the noble lineage, there one should generate knowledge like a swan.

original: mā evaṃ pravijahya śāsanaṃ guṇamaṇḍaṃ sarvāsvetagatīṣu pañcasū yatha bālāḥ // //
analyzed: mā evam pravijahya śāsanam guṇa maṇḍam sarvāsu etagatīṣu bālāḥ
translated: Do not thus abandon the teaching, the ornament of qualities, in all five destinies like the foolish ones.

original: Vaidya / RP
analyzed: vaidya rp
translated: The physician.

original: śailāraṇyaguhānijāsino bhavateha tatrasthāśca ma ātma manyathā paṭapaṃsī /
analyzed: śaila araṇya guhā nija asinaḥ bhavata iha tatrasthāḥ ca me ātma
translated: Here one should dwell in mountain forests and caves, but while dwelling there, one should not be proud or conceited.

original: ātmānaṃ paribhāṣathā satatanitya manusmaranto buddhakoṭi virāgitā purimā ye // //
analyzed: ātmānam paribhāṣatha satata nitya manusmarantaḥ purimāḥ ye
translated: You should always remember and reproach yourselves, thinking, 'We have caused millions of Buddhas to lose interest in the past.'

original: kāye jīvita tṛṣṇa utsṛha anapekṣā dharme yujyata tīvra gauravaṃ janayitvā /
analyzed: kāye jīvita tṛṣṇa utsṛha anapekṣā dharme yujyata tīvra gauravam janayitvā
translated: Abandon attachment to body and life, and be heedless. Generate intense respect for the Dharma.

original: pratipattiśca mayāpi bhāṣitā iha sūtre paścā bodhi na teṣu durlabhā iha sthitvā // //
analyzed: pratipattiḥ ca mayā api bhāṣitā iha sūtre paścā na teṣu durlabhā iha sthitvā
translated: I have also taught practice in this sūtra. Having remained here, enlightenment will not be difficult for them to attain.

original: ye yuktāśca ihāpi harṣitā jinayāne śrutvā yukta sudurmanā bhavitāraḥ /
analyzed: ye yuktāḥ ca iha api harṣitāḥ jinayāne bhavitāraḥ
translated: Those who are engaged in this and delighted in the Jina's vehicle, having heard, will become very unhappy.

original: tasmādvai janayeta śāsane adhimuktiṃ mā paścādanutāpa bheṣyathā vicaramāṇāḥ // //
analyzed: tasmāt vai janayeta śāsane adhimuktim mā paścāt anutāpa vicaramāṇāḥ
translated: Therefore, generate devotion in the teaching. Do not later regret while wandering, thinking, 'We did not practice.'

original: yaśca punā rāṣṭrapāla bodhisattvaḥ pañcapāramitāsu caret /
analyzed: yaḥ ca punar rāṣṭrapāla bodhisattvaḥ pañca pāramitāsu caret
translated: Moreover, Rāṣṭrapāla, if a bodhisattva were to practice the five perfections,

original: yaśceha dharmaparyāyapratipatyā saṃpādayet ahamatra śikṣiṣye 'hamatra saṃvare sthāsyāmi /
analyzed: yaḥ ca iha dharmaparyāya pratipatyā saṃpādayet aham atra śikṣiṣye ham atra saṃvare sthāsyāmi
translated: and if another were to accomplish this Dharma discourse through practice, thinking, 'I will train in this, I will abide in this restraint,'

original: eṣa puṇyaskandho 'sya puṇyaskandhasya purataḥ śatatamāmapi kalāṃ nopaiti sahasratamāmapi śatasahasratamāmapi koṭiśatasahasratamāmapi /
analyzed: eṣa puṇya skandhaḥ u sya puṇya skandhasya puratas śatatamām api kalām na upaiti sahasratamām api śata sahasratamām api koṭi śata sahasratamām api
translated: this accumulation of merit would not approach even a hundredth part of that accumulation of merit, not even a thousandth, not even a hundred-thousandth, not even a koṭi-hundred-thousandth part of it.

original: saṃkhyāmapi kalāmapi gaṇanāmapi upamāmapi upanisāmapi dhṛtipadamapi nopaiti /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api upanisām api dhṛti padam api nā upaiti
translated: It does not reach even a fraction, a part, a calculation, a comparison, an illustration, or a basis of comparison.”

original: asmin khalu punardharmaparyāye bhāsyamāṇe triṃśatāṃ niyutānāṃ sadevamānuṣāsurāyāśca prajāyā anutpadantapūrvāṇyanuttarasyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: asmin khalu punar dharmaparyāye bhāsyamāṇe triṃśatām niyutānām sa deva mānuṣa asurāyāḥ ca prajāyāḥ an utpad anta pūrvāṇi anuttarasyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: When this Dharma teaching was being given, thirty quintillion beings, including gods, humans, and asuras, generated the unsurpassed perfect mind of enlightenment for the first time.

original: avaivartyāścābhūvannanuttarasyāḥ samyaksambodheḥ /
analyzed: avaivartyāḥ ca abhūvan anuttarasyāḥ samyaksambodheḥ
translated: They became irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: saptānāṃ ca bhikṣusahasrāṇāmanupādāyāsravebhyaścittāni vimuktāni //
analyzed: saptānām ca bhikṣu sahasrāṇām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni
translated: And the minds of seven thousand monks were liberated from contaminants, without further grasping.

original: atha khalu āyuṣmān rāṣṭrapālo bhagavantametadavocat kiṃnāmāyaṃ bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān rāṣṭrapālaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kiṃnāmā ayam bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ
translated: Then the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, what is the name of this Dharma teaching?

original: kathaṃ cainaḥ dhārayāmi /
analyzed: katham ca enaḥ dhārayāmi
translated: And how should I remember it?”

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ rāṣṭrapālametadavocat amoghapratijñāviśuddhamiti nāma dhāraya /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam rāṣṭrapālam etat avocat amogha pratijñā viśuddham iti nāma dhāraya
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla, “Remember it as ‘The Pure, Unfailing Vow,’

original: satpuruṣavikrīḍitaṃ bodhisattvacaryāviniścayaṃ nāma dhāraya /
analyzed: sat puruṣa vikrīḍitam bodhisattva caryā viniścayam nāma dhāraya
translated: and as ‘The Play of the Good Man,’ and as ‘The Ascertainment of the Bodhisattva Practice,’

original: arthapāripūrī ca nāma dhāraya //
analyzed: artha pāripūrī ca nāma dhāraya
translated: and as ‘The Fulfillment of Meaning.’”

original: idamavocadbhagavān /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: This was spoken by the Blessed One.

original: āttamanā āyuṣmān rāṣṭrapālaḥ sadevamānuṣāsuragandharvaśca loko bhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manāḥ āyuṣmān rāṣṭrapālaḥ sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The Venerable Rāṣṭrapāla was satisfied, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

original: iti puṇyaraśmeḥ satpuruṣasya pūrvayogasūtraratnarājaṃ samāptam //
analyzed: iti puṇyaraśmeḥ sat puruṣasya pūrva yoga sūtra ratna rājam samāptam
translated: Thus ends the Jewel King of Sutras on the Former Lives of the Holy Man Punyaraśmi.

original: āryarāṣṭrapālaparipṛcchā nāma mahāyānasūtraṃ samāptam //
analyzed: ārya rāṣṭrapālaparipṛcchā nāma mahāyāna sūtram samāptam
translated: The Mahayana Sutra called The Questions of the Noble Rāṣṭrapāla is completed.

original: Vaidya / RP / ślokasūcī
analyzed: vaidya rp ślokasūcī
translated: The Table of Contents of the Verses
